author: {'steamid': '76561198060775229', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1697894833}
review:
Следил и ждал что разработчик допилит игру, но вот прошло уже 7 лет и каких то больших изменений не наблюдается,так еще и оказывается что разработчик политический Пи****с который выставляет на показ всем свою точку зрения и тыкает этим в игре повсюду,
Это игра а не политические баталии,так что лови заслуженный палец вниз.
Не тратьте свое время на эту помойку,лучше возьмите Transport Fever 2 и наслаждайтесь уже готовой игрой и кучей модов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133157008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2960, 'playtime_at_review': 11552, 'last_played': 1712453131}
review:
Great game! Yes it still is (and already was a long time) in early access and it definetly will stay there even longer BUT you get a complete game, there is nothing "missing" like in so many other games.

The game itself and its "token system" (instead of of just "money") are a very good and refreshing feature compared to all other normal "tycoon-games" of this kind. The option to switch to full 3D and just take a ride with your trains, trucks or planes also is very nice.

I hope the dev will get the support he needs and continues his work on it (We need ships and trams ;) ).

author: {'steamid': '76561197993026137', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 21541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 29, 'playtime_at_review': 17831, 'last_played': 1712319767}
review:
Mashinky (in early access at the time of writing), may initially resemble OpenTTD but offers a refreshing gameplay experience with its distinct game mechanics. Although it's unclear if there is one developer or a team behind the project, they are dedicated to delivering new content at a steady pace.

Mashinky introduces innovative features such as eras, which require specific resources for progression. Each era brings new requirements, a unique "resource," production lines, vehicles, and more, setting it apart from other tycoon games and requiring the player to rethink his plan regularly. All buildings (production, town, station...) can be upgraded to enhance their capabilities/size/capacities which helps the player reaches the various goals.
The game also offers numerous tools to simplify the player's life (auto replacement of vehicles for example).

Finally, graphics are very nice for a tycoon game.
If you're looking for something different in the transport tycoon genre, that's a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058493215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2712, 'last_played': 1704789166}
review:
Хочется для начала сказать, что авторы проекта молодцы, купил игру еще в далеком 2018 году и наблюдал за ее развитием вплоть до 21-ого года
Но сейчас, игру превратили в политическое поле битвы, напихав флаги украины везде где только можно. Ребят вы можете кого угодно поддерживать, писать об этом и т.д., но на кой просто тыкать в глаза везде и всюду своими обоссаными тряпками? Уважение к разработчику появляется тогда, когда он уважает свое комьюнити, которое может быть как разделено политически, так и территориально. Мы все люди, и у всех у нас своя правда. Так давайте же выстраивать мосты коммуникаций между нами хотя бы в играх, а не наполнять их политической повесткой, тем самым провоцируя на конфликты нации/конфессии/религии
Я считаю парни, что тут уже вы поступаете определенно не этично

author: {'steamid': '76561198018740860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 13849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2181, 'last_played': 1708281165}
review:
Mashinky is a tycoon game where you build railroads and collect resources to build more railroads. The game is still under development but despite that the game is playable and enjoyable.
There is no comprehensive tutorial and apparently the UI is missing some tooltips so might take some time to figure out how certain features work (especially the signals). Once you get the hang of the game mechanics there's no end to the fun and joy the game provides.
If you played and liked Railroad Tycoon II, you will probably like Mashinky too. Definitely worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092081745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1704832644}
review:
Все еще очень сыро. Про плюсы уже все сказали. А вот с минусами... очень раздражает модель расширения города: т е есть почта, она в городе, но если она не попадает в зону жд станции, то почту вы возить паровозом не можете. Более того даже вы не можете привезти грузовиком почту на жд станцию, а только из одного почтового отделения в другое. Тоже самое, есть завод который производит продукты,  но он не будет автоматически перекидывать на расположенную  авто станцию продукты, он будет продолжать их накапливать. Т е стоит жд станция полная продуктов, и только когда она наполнится тогда начнет заполнятся авто станция....
Из общего, нормальных туториалов в игре нет, которые именно обьясняли логику разработчика, openttd в этом плане намного интуитивнее.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963664342', 'num_games_owned': 1465, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5070, 'last_played': 1707978112}
review: By far the most fun I've had with railway route planning games. Like the best engineering games it's about constantly tweaking and expanding your setup as requirements change (e.g. entering a new era and new resources/factories appear on the map) to get goods transported through an increasingly complicated network.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006614080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3870, 'last_played': 1703787260}
review:
If you are looking for the game that will let the legendary king of the genre namely "railroad tycoon 2" rest in peace, dont look further, this is the game you're looking for. It could even let OTTD rest in peace too, altough OTTD have a better UI and is a very robust game that will not die that easily even if its aged now

Sure its not perfect (small dev team, started as a 1 man team) but this is truly a "labor of love" and in constant evolution since i purchased it years ago, and I'm confident it will be even better when it will be in "finished state"

author: {'steamid': '76561197973320222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 169, 'playtime_at_review': 23772, 'last_played': 1712483211}
review:
Do not think of this game a strategy game or OpenTT or strict economy simulation - think of it as a mix between a board game, or a train-set for you and your child (or inner child), where you just block your room with railroads and have the most fun with just driving the train here and there. I strongly dislike games of the first type as I don't find too economy oriented games fun. This game, OTOH, I like very much. However, it is not for everyone, I guess.

I have a rather small number of hours played because I don't have the time to play in general and to play with a train set you just have to be in the right mood - but I always come back to it and enjoy the time very much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039791819', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10175, 'last_played': 1709921804}
review: If you were an old Chris Sawyer's locomotion fan, and enjoyed open ttd etc. Get this game, you will have hours and hours of fun. All while tinkering with network structuring and good economic growth! I do agree the updates have been slow, but its a project of love. I personally think this game was made to itch a fix for a more modern game of its kind, which I think we can all just appreciate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002518465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1452, 'last_played': 1712468030}
review:
Yes it's buggy and frequently freezes up forcing a full log out or reboot, but it has a *lot* of potential to be a replacement for one of my all time favorites, Chris Sawyer's Locomotion.  Unlike transport fever 1 or 2, this routes trains from station to station, not track to track... looking at you transport fever 1/2.  Way back in 2004, Locomotion did this the right way, station to station, no researching this or that, just income vs expenses, supply & demand, and routing controlled by signalling.  Over the years, I have invested thousands, possibly even tens of thousands of hours enjoying that title and still play it on occasion.

This is a 1 person project but what they have accomplished is genuinely impressive and I eagerly await their future plans becoming reality

author: {'steamid': '76561198116671022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 6066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3254, 'last_played': 1705238167}
review:
Mashinky jsou klenot logistických strategií. A navíc jsou od českého tvůrce, který si prakticky dělal hru od základu sám a to se vším všudy. Žádné Unity nebo podobné enginy, které jsou zdarma. Prostě zlaté české ručičky.

Hru bych přirovnal ke stařičké hře Transport Tycoon Deluxe (TTD) a její novější verzi s multiplayerem, Open TTD ze kterých si hra bere velký vzor a vůbec se za to nestydí. Taky proč? Mashinky vše co bylo v TTD vzala a posunula na o dost vyšší level.

Přibyli věci jako:
- Vylepšování průmyslu dalšími budovami na produkci.
- Vylepšování stanic budovami jako jsou sklady na suroviny, bistra pro pasažéry atd. atd.
- Vylepšování dolů a lesů přístavbami. 
- Vzory křižovatek pro vlaky které si můžete sami tvořit a ukládat.
a je toho opravdu hromada.

Navíc hra se postupem hraní posouvá do dalších časových ér, takže na začátku máte parní prdítka a končíte s elektrickými rychlovlaky. Éry si můžete odemykat buď časově (uplyne určitý čas), nebo si je manuálně odemknete až budete chtít a to takzvanými žetony.

Žetony jsou platidlo, ale ne jen peněžní, ale i surovinové.
Začínáte pouze s peněžními žetony, ale když začnete ze dřeva vyrábět prkna a ty vozit do dílny, tak ta vám bude produkovat žetony prken. Ty pak můžete použít na kupování kvalitnějších vagonů, vlaků nebo vylepšení.
To samé máte i s uhlím. A postupem hry vám přibude žetonů víc, jak se budete posouvat z éry do éry.

A to jsem vůbec nezmínil to, že tomu kulišákovi Janu Zelenému (tvůrce hry) se nakonec zželelo i autíček a letadel které byly v TTD, že je nakonec přidal i sem, do hry která se jmenuje Mashinky. :D No neni to prevít :D

Samozřejmě že není. I když zrovna automobilový průmysl mi ve hře přišel spíš na překážku, tak letadla jsou opravdu super. Přiznám se, do té éry s letadly jsem se zatím ještě nedostal, protože času na hraní moc nemám, ale sledoval jsem to ve videích a upřímně se nemůžu dočkat.
Můžu jen říct že oproti TTD kde jste jen prdli obří letiště a tradá... Zde si budete moct letiště sami organizovat.
Kde bude runway, kde pojezdová dráha, kde terminál a hangáry. Prostě vše. 
Už abych v té éře byl.

Na závěr řeknu jednu větu kterou poslední dobou slyším na youtube všude ... Nikdo mi za tohle nezaplatil :D
Ta hra je prostě boží a vyvrátit se to nedá. 
Prostě pokud máte rádi TTD tak tohle je nutnost ... upřímně jakmile jsem začal hrát Mashinky tak TTD už mě nebaví :D :D  ... a to už je co říct.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198142805381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5484, 'last_played': 1700962286}

author: {'steamid': '76561198335849946', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2799, 'last_played': 1700907663}
review:
what is a transport tycoon? oh, I don't play that game, because Mashinky is better.
seriously, if you want a game that has a linear learning curve, and relaxing gameplay, then you're at the correct store page.
this game will make you enjoy trains and the industry they support even more than you'd like to admit, by slowly adding challenges to overcome and then look back. 
the only thing that will make you stressed and regret your life's decisions are the intersections.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023279373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1710635450}
review:
Amazing game. It is almost impossible to find a train simulator that can check all boxes off for a great tycoon game.  Many games have silly characters, bad train/land/building physics, and/or poor time progression and technology  mechanics.  After buying and trying most of the new train sims, i could not find a replacement for railway tycoon 2.  I then read a review about new train games being mainly "puzzles", and the reviewer mentioned Mashinky, i never heard of it.
 To my great surprise Mashinky is my new favourite new train sim.  The game is fluid, progressive production chains are well designed, all engines and cars/ trucks/ airplanes are beautifully detailed/  The ability to zoom into any vehicle is fun.  Evolving production chains force you to continually optimise and upgrade  your transportation  web of supply and demand.     I find that the best part of the game loop.  I have not even tried the city expansion mechanics yet.  Just an incredible work of train game design art that fills all simulator and tycoon requirements and provides an organic fun play, different each run, learning new tricks each time.

My best congratulations to the developer and his small team, i would recommend this game to anyone who likes this genre of game and wants to spend time in a beautifully designed world.

PS  dont forget to  vote Mashinky as Steam Labour of love

author: {'steamid': '76561198030362857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1699103799}
review:
Просто Ахтунг! В разработке 5 лет...
Построил 2 линии жд по разным отраслям, и 1 депо на общих путях. Мамма Миа!!! Поезда не понимают как ездить по светофорам, нельзя поставить светофор на одном пути в разные стороны! Жд транспорт может ездить только от станции к станции по одному пути, либо по кольцевой трассе, взаимодействие с блоками не возможно. И это 5 лет разработки!!!???
Нет нормальной статистики по объемам перевозки, финансам и прочее, до нормальной игры разработчикам как до Луны(
Из плюсов только визуал/
Запросил возврат.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030467427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2494, 'last_played': 1710927347}
review:
It's still in EA and will likely still be for at least another year, possibly more so if you're waiting for EA to end, it's likely to be a whole before this gets an official release. But, as of now, it is very playable and enjoyable too.

While it looks a lot like Railway Empire, it's much more like Transport Fever2. I'd say TF2 is the better game in every respect but for two things - the economy and the way you grow your cities. The economy in this game is much better. It's not just about accruing vast sums of cash and, once achieved, from that point on simply doing whatever you want, whenever you want without money ever being a consideration again. This game has several currencies, tokens - cash, planks, iron, diesel and steel (so far) which you can use to buy better, more efficient trains, wagons and vehicles. So you'll need to generate all these different tokens throughout the game and you'll need to generate a very good number too.

Growing your cities is also an interesting feature. However, it's not hugely intuitive and if somebody were to make a good video on the matter of city growth and railway catchment areas, that might help a lot of newcomers to get started.

If I were to have one ask, it would be to have boats at some point so as to use the water to transport cargo and people around too. We've just got planes so I wouldn't expect any such feature for another year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040708747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2692, 'last_played': 1699203033}
review:
I've picked up the again after a while of owning it and what a leap it has made since then.
It is everything I want a transport tycoon game to be and works well for a multiplayer game with friends.

There are still issues with sync during multiplayer, but nothing a rejoin wouldn't fix, though a more permanent solution would always be welcome.

Transporting people in this game is very satisfying with the option of specific travel destination. It may not be as simple, but it feels very rewarding when you get a person from a small village on a bus the drops them at a train station and possible even airplane. Connecting them through different hubs and lines. Even small remote towns with their half empty buses are now a charming part of your network.

The town growing mechanics by itself is really well handled and can be very involved with the puzzle like mechanics of getting the best buildings where you want them to be.

The fact that you're also involved in electric network surprised me at first, but it's also something I found very enjoyable and it all adds up to the scenery. Scenery that you can then view as a passanger of your transport network in 3D.

The token system is amazing addition to the game in my opinion as it requires you to improve your network of supplies down to the starting industry, constantly looking for the next chokepoint, train, industry or station to improve.

At this point it is my favourite transport game and if there's one thing I'd like improved, it would be the stability and technical polish. Maybe some game balance with extremely large trains, but overall it's a recommend from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023837720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1697452977}
review:
While there is a lot to like about this game, sadly it is not a game I will be coming back to in a hurry. 

The isometric to full 3d is a nice gimmick and the graphics are really well done, but the underlying economic model and traffic management is simply frustrating and sometimes just feels illogical. 

I really wanted to like this game, and hoped it would be a nice bridge between TF2 and OTTD, however, the economic model is just not as strong as TF2 which itself is lacking compared to OTTD. Routing of trains and vehicles is by far the biggest frustration in the game which only opens more holes in the economic model as parts of your network grind to a halt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090215206', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3807, 'last_played': 1703120320}
review:
Загалом, купуючи гру я мало знав про неї. Найбільше я тоді хотів хоч якось допомогти розробнику, який з перших днів великого вторгнення підтримав Україну (і досі українські прапори майорять на площах кожного міста) і отримав за це купу негативних відгуків від зрозуміло яких істот.

Встановив я її лише через рік, і з довжини цього відгуку видно, скільки у мене було емоцій.
Mashinky стала однією з небагатьох ігор, за якими я просидів десятки годин безперервно, не помічаючи плин часу. Вона дуже затягує. Попередньою такою грою для мене була друга частина Railroad Tycoon. І окрім тієї серії у мене майже відсутній досвід в «симуляторах транспортного магната» чи навіть просто містобудівних симуляторах. Тому я не зможу надати вам прискіпливе порівняння. Це будуть враження від людини, яка просто купила гру і запустила.

Перші годин, мабуть, 40 я провів в режимі будівництва, прокладаючи маршрути і будуючи станції. Я відкривав переходи в нові технологічні епохи самотужки, поступово розвиваючи виробництво. І лише потім звернув увагу, що у гри є й інший режим — споглядання. В ньому світ виглядає більш реалістично, а «Альпійський» рельєф мапи це насправді наші звичні краєвиди.

Але найбільш приголомшливим став третій режим. Ви можете не просто наближати мапу, аби роздивитися будівлі чи транспорт. Ви можете буквально прогулятися створеним світом від першої особи пішки. Або сісти покататися на потязі чи автівці. Можна навіть умовно кермувати, вибираючи куди повертатиме потяг. І якщо на колії є інші потяги, то ви швидше за все в них вріжетеся, що я випадково і зробив в першу ж хвилину за кермом, не дуже розуміючи, де я і куди ми несемося.

Це може прозвучати смішно, але ось цей режим подорожей від першої особи виявився неймовірно імерсивним. Пейзажі, будівлі, транспорт виглядають знайомими, неначе рідними. Додайте сюди можливості фанатських модів, серед яких вже є буквально набори нашої техніки та вагонів.

Mashinky це світ, який хочеться створювати і в якому хочеться відпочивати. Вона зовсім небагато коштує і я дуже раджу придбати, якщо є можливість.

Тепер трошки про неприємні моменти, бо якщо ви купуватимете гру, я вважаю за необхідне вас підготувати. Я дуже полюбив Mashinky і хочу, щоб вона стала краще в цих важливих дрібницях, аби й інші люди її одразу полюбили.

Слід зауважити, що Mashinky досі в «ранньому доступі», звідси випливають мінуси, що одразу збивають з ніг нового гравця (з ними погоджуються і люди, що мають значно більший досвід, але все одно були спантеличені). Гра дуже гнучка і досить легка (складність опосередковано задається при генерації мапи), але наявного в ній туторіалу недостатньо. Не лінуйтеся піти і почитати тематичну wiki. Хоча б розділ Basics, хоча б його сторінку Getting Started на 5 абзаців, яка просто і змістовно пояснює, на чому сконцентруватися, аби не збанкрутувати в перший рік.

Наступний недолік це невеликий вибір гарячих клавіш, які ще й не можна перепризначити. До того ж про них ніде в грі не пишуть, доводиться знову шукати на wiki. Як на мене, хоткеї це essential складова ігор, тим паче стратегій.

І останнє це інтуітивний інтерфейс, який повен усілякими зручностями, про які знову ж таки гра не поспішає розповідати. Коротше кажучи, вам не треба перечитувати всю wiki одразу, але будьте готові, що щодня читатимете звідти пару сторінок, які суттєво покращуватимуть ваші навички, щоразу відкриваючи нові складові геймплею (це не перебільшення).

P.S. Гра вже давненько має офіційний український переклад. А ще вона досить часто оновлюється і найсвіжіший контент може бути не перекладено. Але загалом все зрозуміло. І вам все одно знадобиться знання англійської, аби читати wiki.

author: {'steamid': '76561198434166638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 79279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 378, 'playtime_at_review': 71464, 'last_played': 1712436642}
review: Mashinky jsou super "tycoonovka" ze staré školy v novém kabátku. Jednoduché ovládání a jednoduché na pochopení. AI je taky docela inteligentní. Vláčky i autíčka si umí najít správnou cestu, i když může být na první pohled komplikovaná hlavně v pokročilém stádiu hry. Dnes má i editor map, takže se každý může vyřádit do sytosti. Je pořád ve vývojové fázi, což má výhody i nevýhody. Postupně dodávaný obsah zajišťuje, že je pořád se na co těšit a postupně objevovat nové možnosti. Dojem však kazí dlouhé intervaly mezi novými balíčky obsahu. Chápu autory, že to není určitě zrovna jednoduchá práce. Když si to však vezmeme, kdy vyšla EA-verze hry, tak už je hezkou řádku let a finální produkt je stále v nedohlednu. Za pár dní vyjdou už i letadýlka, tak snad se vše postupně urychlí. Pro vyznavače klasických budovatelských strategií jsou Mashinky téměř povinnost.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964114456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10666, 'last_played': 1701022340}
review:
Its sad, but I can't recommend the game. I played it a lot, love that its a classic tycoon game, that the author is Czech. But its a single person development and the dev does spent enough time on the game to keep it afloat. The credit system is not well balanced (either you run out of something and get stuck, or you have pointless amount of the credits and nothing to do with those). The game is also buggy -- trucks cannot find route (even though there is one, trains crashing on valid lights once you have too many, internal bug report crashing when you try to report something...).
The traffic control is sub par with OTTD, which is a pitty, if you like to build high traffic intersections...

I would love to recommend the game, just can't...

I don't regret the money I spent on this game because there are other much more expensive train games where developer does not care about community at all. In this spot Mashinky is winner because it follows idea of what game should be like. A game with imperfections if you like it and playable and enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198246429772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3047, 'last_played': 1694040555}
review:
Líbí se mi různé epochy a celkový rozvoj hry, jak se každou epochou některé situace mění a zlepšují. grafika je krásná, jen by to chtělo možná i futuristickou epochu =) jako v TTD nějakou jednokolku či maglev.
Ve hře je krásný systém hledání cest vlaků(nejsou hloupý) a hráč vidí kudy chce vlak jet, když má na dráze vadu. Jen mě mrzí, že třeba po elektrifikaci nevidím důvod vlastnit vlaky na uhlí, či starší stroje, ačkoliv jsou krásné. Na druhou stranu to člověka nutí stále modernizovat své tratě a starat se o optimalizaci tras.
Hra je oddychová, ale počátkem elektřiny se zdá, že je skok trochu v obtížnosti, protože je do hry přiveden nový prvek(elektřina a elektrické sítě), které vylepšují  továrny atd... 
Každopádně hra si získá každého milovníka vláčků nebo Tycoon her =)

review:
OpenTTD inspired game that brings it's own merits like passengers having a set destination and resource deliveries creating tokens which means you can't just build one profitable line and never worry about currency ever again. still in development but I got more than enough playtime out of it for the price and I haven't even fully completed a save through all the ages yet. 

Don't let the bad reviews from malding russians dissuade you (oh no he added a flag to the game that you can just disable). If you like OpenTTD style games just try it and use the return window if you don't like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980842191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6153, 'last_played': 1692579286}
review:
There is a lot of game here, and it's surprisingly addictive.   The developer Jan has also added a great deal of new content and works actively to expand the game so I've certainly got a lot for the ticket price.   It had been over a year since I last played, so I though I'd see what changes have been made, leading to some very late night/early morning games as I can't seem to stop making tweaks to try and get thing running smoothly and pile up those tokens!  I still haven't reached the late game content, but each generation requires a good deal of re-think.   The initial mechanics are not overwhelming; however, the learning curve is steep and should improve later play troughs by allowing you to plan a head a little better.  (unless you leave it a year or two like me...)

Graphics are not staggering when you get down to the driving/walking level.  But I often find myself riding along with one of my trains or trucks, just soaking up the atmosphere of the busy network that I've created at the moment there are no passengers, or creatures, not sure if those are planned but I don't really miss them.   One thing I'd really like to see would be to have the place names (especially stations and depots) appear in the real world view on the buildings and platforms.  Love that he has also included Multiplayer!  

Biggest headaches are dealing with traffic jams, and trains that are too big for platforms and can get stuck on switches. But this is really part an parcel of this type of transport game - so if you've played Railway Tycoon or others you'll pretty much know what to expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988774671', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 4638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 63, 'playtime_at_review': 3589, 'last_played': 1711909284}
review: A unique one among other OTTD and Railroad Tycoon alikes, this one is almost more of a factory game than a train game. Different resources are needed to make and maintain advanced trains, meaning that simply making a "profitable" line is not the end of the puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155374561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1703115285}
review:
Идея мне понравилась, а вот реализация…
Он наступит скоро, надо просто подождать.

Если вы любите масштабную игру с сотнями поездов, десятками станций, подключёнными к одной линии и маршрутами через всю карту, возможно вам стоит остаться в OpenTTD. 

Финансовая модель «деньги – не главное» оказалась довольно спорной. В начале игры всего хватает, но после перехода на эпоху стали (именно стали, не железа) начинается печалька. И это с отключённым топливом.

Первые часы игры идут неплохо. Вы не успеете за первые 2 часа почувствовать всю боль и вернуть деньги.

Иногда появляется баг поиска пути, поезда могут начать тормозить до 10 кмч на стрелке между двумя линиями. Решить это костылями я не смог, остаётся надеяться на багфикс. Это полностью уничтожает пропускную способность и, как следствие, желание делать что-то более сложное, чем «1 путь - 1 поезд».

Станции слишком уж маленькие. 6 клеток в начале игры, 10 в конце. Хотя локомотив GE-2 из второй эпохи вполне может тащить и 12 вагонов.

Ограничения скорости на рельсах и поворотах вроде бы есть, но проезд на полной скорости в ручном управлении не даёт никаких последствий. В автоматическом режиме поезда не всегда используют полную мощность.

Разнообразие вагонов не такое большое, как хотелось бы. 2 для дерева, 2 для досок, 3 для угля . . . и все доступны начиная со второй-третьей эпохи.
Пассажирских вагонов достаточно много, но ведь эта игра не про пассажиров.

Предположительно, 3 вышеназванных (и абсолютно субъективных) проблемы «решаются» модами, но если игра требует модов, с игрой явно что-то не так. 

Эта игра – точно не OpenTTD в 3D, как её иногда называют. По-мне, Mashinky ближе к Factorio, нежели к OpenTTD. Что по (не)удобству строительства и управления заданиями, что по экономике. Деньги важны только в начале, а без ресурсов вам не получить крутые поезда. 

А, ещё одна забавная фича. Здесь всё-таки есть автоматическое расставление сигналов на пути до развязки, работает неплохо… Но! Автоматического удаления сигналов нет. Если вы ошиблись и добавили сотню лишних сигналов, удалить их можно либо вручную, либо перестройкой пути. Либо загрузкой из автосейва. Но автосейвов по-умолчанию всего 2, а изменить их количество можно только изменением конфига. Файл setup.xml, строка 64. Номера автосейвов, кстати, идут не по порядку. У вас может быть автосейв 5, затем 4, затем 10… Проверяйте время, а не номер.

Графика неплохая, но не окупает неудобность массового управления.
Фича «покататься на поезде» интересна лишь на первое время. Прямо как анимации в No Man's Sky.

Что до «политики», которую часто тут упоминают… Небольшой флажок с табличкой в центре города. Определённо причина поставить дизлайк и забыть про игру навсегда.

// Для самых-самых непонятливых, флажок – наименьшая из «проблем». Его можно отключить в настройках модов, если для вас это критично. //

author: {'steamid': '76561198087859636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1690136304}
review:
É legal, mas precisa de mais coisas!
Estou jogando movido pelo odio!
O jogo não tem gráficos legais mas não pareceu afetar.
A trilha embora repetitiva foi bem composta, nem me incomodo, até gostei ("uns" jazz )
O jogo tem desafio. Os sinais da linha exigem entendimento, mas depois que pegou as manhas faz milagres. Tem um tutorial muito bom, recomendo muito se comprar ver o [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1160952202]tutorial dos controladores de linha (signals)[/url]
Espere uma promo se tem dúvida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045160451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11760, 'last_played': 1698434922}
review:
Great EA, wouldn't pay the current price though.

What I like:
Token based economy
playing on large maps with sparse citys and industries
starts easy and gets more difficult over time
Beautiful landscape


What ineeds to be improofed:
line management options
(currently you have to manually rearange each train to add new stations, there isn't even a grouping function like open TTD)

Communication is key... the coming update has given me hope.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022347120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1688240315}
review: Cool game. Used to play a lot back last year, but now I have a 4k monitor and can't get to play in Window mode like I want. I don't want to play Fullscreen; I watch movies while I play. It's 2023 and there's zero option to change to Windowed mode and that's BS.
developer_response:
Hello and sorry for inconveniences. Windowed mode is there from the very beginning of early access. You may either pick Windowed mode from initial splash screen, or anytime later in the game or even by Alt+Enter. 

On top of that, if you switch to experimental branch, I've added also borderless window mode.

I am sorry if this option is not what you've expected, in that case, please let me know on email info(at)mashinky(dot)com so I can improve it ;) Thx

author: {'steamid': '76561197971161627', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1688016466}
review:
Real problems with communication or putting out any small partial pieces of progress. Six months after christmas, santa is still flying and not a word was said. Finally some communication was begged out though, and an experimental update came with it. There is some hope for future development. Features that do come out are pretty interesting and with novel ideas compared to the competition. 
Graphics are pretty, but 95% of the time you are in ugly/building mode so you don't get to see them.
I would not hurry to buy it, but if you are burned out on everything similar it will give you some more enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027442761', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1685199093}
review:
I find the UI unintuitive to use. You can't escape out of selections, you can't escape to the main menu. Signals cannot be selected after placement. Signal placement is unintuitive. I have only a single train and it keeps getting stuck all the time because signals cannot be placed in a bi-directional way. A tutorial should present itself on how to use these systems. It didn't.

Asking for a refund.
developer_response:
Thanks a lot for your feedback and sorry for inconveniences.

For bi-directional signals, just click once more at the same spot (clicking on existing signal switches one/bi directional). Also there is an option in settings for what should be default on first click (if one or bi directional signals).

I am working hard on content and intuitivness, but I admit there is always something need to be improve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011111686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9391, 'last_played': 1690645873}
review:
[h1] Kdo má rád vlaky a rád se dívá hodiny do monitoru na přejezdy po výhybkách, jste tady správně! [/h1]
[i] English below. [/i] 
[hr] [/hr]
Taková hra tady prostě dlouho chyběla, oddechová parádička, žádný zběsilý Tycoon (to může někomu chybět). Možné přirovnání k Sid Meier's Railroads, ve které jsem také strávil nemálo času. Start je trochu pomalejší, máte nedostatek peněz a žádným zázračným způsobem se vám je nebude dařit pořádně množit. Změna nastane s další epochou, kdy se do hry zapojí uhlí a od té chvíle si hru začnete užívat.
Líbí se mi možnost zahrát si hru s kamarády, hra může někdy spadnout nebo nefungovat tak, jak má, ale to se časem doladí a o další zábavu bude postaráno. Postupně si říkáte, že složitější doprava z jednoho místa na druhé být nemůže, ale při odemčení nové epochy vám spadne brada a přijdou nové výzvy.
Ocenil bych, kdyby vozidla nejezdila stylem brzda/plyn, ale kupříkladu nějakou vzdálenost před návěstidlem stůj začala volně zpomalovat. Rozjezdy parních vlaků jsou velká osina každého strojvůdce. Pěkné zapojení komunity vám umožní stáhnout si pár parádních modelů do hry, které opět posunout zážitek ze hraní na další úroveň. Zlepšení se nabízí i ve zvuku projíždějících vlaků přes výhybky nebo do oblouků, ale to jsou kosmetické věci. Těším se na finální epochy, které mají být do hry zapojeny a uvidíme, jak to bude všechno společně fungovat.
Vývojáři na hře stále pracují a přidávají stále nový obsah nebo vylepšují ten stávající.
[hr] [/hr]
Such a game was simply missing here for a long time, a relaxing not a frantic Tycoon (some may miss that). A possible comparison to Sid Meier's Railroads, which I also spent a lot of time in. The start is a bit slower, you're short of money and by no miracle will you be able to multiply it properly. The change comes with the next epoch, when coal comes into play, and from that point on you start to enjoy the game.
I like the ability to play the game with friends, the game can sometimes crash or not work as it should, but this will be fine tuned in time and more fun will be taken care of. Gradually you tell yourself that the transport from one place to another couldn't be more difficult, but as you unlock new eras your chin drops and new challenges come.
I'd appreciate it if the vehicles didn't go brake/gas style, but for example started slowing down freely some distance before the stop signal. Steam train turnouts are a big pain in the ass for any engineer. Nice community involvement allows you to download some cool models for the game, which again take the playing experience to the next level. There are also improvements to be made in the sound of trains passing over switches or into curves, but these are cosmetic things. I'm looking forward to the final epochs to be incorporated into the game and seeing how it all works together.
The developers are still working on the game, adding new content or improving existing content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802219097', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1682003520}
review:
Познакомился с игрой когда она ещё только вышла, недавно друг сделал мне подгон и позвал играть, я ожидал что в игре многое поменялось за столько то времени, НО.... увы и ах... в игре особо то и не поменялось не чего... Куча багов, многострадальный кооп так вообще через раз работает. Названия станций, транспорта, зависший курсор хоста (не важно кто хост, курсор не двигается), постоянные вылеты и зависания (на мертво), убивают весь интерес к игре...

Если вы собираетесь брать игру ради коопа настоятельно НЕ рекомендую...
Да и в целом игру брать не советую... Только что бы лежала "на полке"... не больше...

author: {'steamid': '76561198843067962', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1665954601}
review: Чудова гра жанру транспортно-економічних стратегій з цікавими механіками. Якщо вам подобається будувати транспортні магістралі та залізницю і потім спостерігати як потяги бігають по карті перевозячи вантажі та пасажирів, то ця гра варта вашої уваги. Дякую розробнику за підтримку.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996189893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1532523573}
review:
Почему же, почему же игроки положительно оценивают Mashinky аж до статуса "Очень положительные". Всё довольно просто, основная работа разработчиков удивительно умело и в нужное время уметь чесать языком (заявил в Twitter Зелёный Ян: "[i]Good news everyone, #Mashinky is my Full time job now![/i]"), только вот делать игры с 2018 года так и не научились, о чём говорит данный продукт, значит можно сказать точно "разработка игр" это не их основная работа. Игра не дотягивает до TTD от Криса Сойера не то, что даже до OpenTTD, что об обратном твердят любители "Лапши Молинье" на ушах, а не игр. Если и кому-то и давать деньги на развитие транспортной стратегии то это разработчикам OpenTTD, которые делают игру, а не чешут языком.

[code]
[h1]⚠️ Внимание[/h1]
Вы должны понимать, что это моё сугубо личное мнение сформулированное на моих личных вкусовых предпочтениях. А это значит то, что мне сильно не нравится, вам может сильно понравится.
[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030803154', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1681394111}
review: As a fan of simulation and strategy games, I highly recommend Mashinky. It's a unique and challenging game that combines stunning graphics with boardgame-like rules and an isometric construction mode. Building your own transport empire is a rewarding puzzle, and I love how every element of business is considered. The game provides endless opportunities to upgrade and customize your network, and I enjoy the innovative viewing modes that allow me to experience my empire in different ways. Overall, Mashinky is an exciting and immersive journey through time that I can't get enough of.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964808965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1680758874}
review: Everything's so scrunched together there's no room for the railroad, and that's the whole game.  Just pointless due to the scale mistake.
developer_response:
Hello, thanks for your feedback and sorry for inconveniences. 

There is an option to select bigger maps (up to 1024*1024 tiles), also density of industry, towns etc can be lowered, so distances became bigger. 
On the other hand, fitting everything to tight spaces on smallest maps is also part of puzzle gameplay here...

author: {'steamid': '76561197975498126', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1691421003}
review:
Pour tous ceux qui ont le jeu, ce que je vais dire est évident. Ce jeu mériterait d'être plus connu qu'il ne l'est. Un très bon jeu de gestion ferroviaire où seul l'argent ne fait pas tout, contrairement à d'autres jeu de gestion ferroviaire plus connu. Du coup, vous devez étendre votre empire ferroviaire dans tous les secteurs d'activités disponibles qui augmentent au fur et à mesure que vous franchissez une nouvelle ère. différentes taille de map sont disponibles, différents styles et différents reliefs. Ajoutez à cela le choix de la densité des villes, entreprises et encore d'autres choses pour augmenter la difficulté et vous avez là un petit bijou dans le genre. Le style graphique rappel la construction de petits trains sur des planches de bois il y a ma fois fort longtemps.

Si vous voulez avoir un bon aperçu du jeu, je vous conseil un youtuber du nom d' Eki_Nox qui fait à l'heure actuelle une série dessus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127625387', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 52, 'playtime_at_review': 3967, 'last_played': 1711818209}
review:
Ein gut durchdachter Transportmanager im Stil von Transport Fever 2 mit einigen innovativen Ideen, der meiner Meinung nach völlig unterbewertet ist und zu Unrecht ein Nischendasein führt.

Nervig allerdings auch hier, dass die Ingame-Zeit viel zu schnell abläuft, so dass ein Zug schon mal mehrere Monate von einem Ende zum anderen unterwegs ist. Man kann das zwar durch Editieren der Konfigurationsdatei ändern, aber dann funktioniert das Timing mancher Quests nicht mehr.

Ebenso nervig, dass die Fahrzeuge einen wesentlich höheren Verbrauch haben, je älter sie werden. Man kann sie dann zwar durch Knopfdruck zum Depot schicken, um sie durch ein neues Fahrzeug zu ersetzen, aber welchen Spielwert hat das? Bei über 100 Fahrzeugen und extrem schnell ablaufender Zeit einfach nur nervig. Kann und sollte man abschalten.

Alles in allem aber ein sehr entspannendes und hübsch anzuschauendes Spiel, das mir trotz der Abstriche mehr Spaß macht als TF2, weil sich hier nicht nur die langen Strecken lohnen und man auch nicht ganze Armeen von Fahrzeugen auf die Schienen und Straßen werfen muss, um einigermaßen über die Runden zu kommen.

This is a Transport Tycoon Sim Game, It is a Very Good one, well worth the time and money to play.
It gives plenty of challenge, and allows you to create answers for problems. The ai pathing isn't the best, so that is a challenge you will need to overcome as you increase traffic density.
If Transport Tycoon Sim Games are your thing, then this will definitely keep you going for a long time

author: {'steamid': '76561197979975310', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 3470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3470, 'last_played': 1676586791}
review:
The game has all the signs of a Passion Project. It has very cool niche features, like multiple POVs on a train and ability to ride said trains manually. But then there will be a lack of quality of life features and just plain bugs.

Mechanically the game is a half-step ahead of Transport Tycoon from 1994. The difference is, in TD it was very easy to keep your company rolling in cash. You could be struggling at times, but the longer you play the less incentive you have to continue playing. In Mashinky you have to maintain the balance between resource generation and consumption, you have to provide for industries and cities, you have to transport things to be able to transport things. Industry tokens turned out to be a great solution to keep the game rolling.

The game is rather lacking in QoL in comparison with Transport Fever. There are no lines mechanic, no way to build speed-optimized tracks, no [i]convenient[/i] way to upgrade trains.

The multiplayer is there. It works. Most of the time. There are occasional crashes, some features don't work (like 90% of Bonus Trains), lots of smaller issues with pathfinding and desync.

All and all, the game is worth trying. Alone or in MP with a friend. It's fun, reasonably pretty, and enagaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198795503945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4142, 'last_played': 1673878572}
review: Celkom dobrá hra, je to chytľavá, kto má rád železnicu, dopravu a logické myslenie, tak je dobrá hra. Mňa osobne celkom aj bavila táto hra, ale po poslednej aktualizácii je nehrateľná. Každé 2-3 minúty vám padne hra. Bohužiaľ stratilo to pre mňa zmysel pokračovať v hre. Najprv to pri načítaní v hlavnom menu vypísalo, že sú tam nainštalované módy (mal som ich odtiaľto zo steamu z workshopu) čo môže spôsobiť pád hry, módy boli odstránené a aj tak hra padala, tak som to bral ako poškodený save. Začal som novú hru bez módov a aj tak to padalo v kuse. Predtým ako bol v hre Santa, tak to fungovalo bez chyby. V tomto stave hry ju vôbec nedoporučujem. Keď by sa opravilo neustále vypínanie/padanie hry, tak by som tú hru vrelo odporúčal a robil jej aj osobne reklamu nech o nej vie čo najviac ľudí.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076803073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8287, 'last_played': 1702676406}
review:
Táto hra má očarujúci efekt pre každého hráča čo mal možnosť hrať Transport Tycoon, ale aj milovníkov modelových železníc, ktorý pre svoje hobby už nemajú dosť miesta. Rozdelená je do období od skorej parnej doby až po dobu monorail-u teda si každý svoju obľúbenú dobu nájde.
Okrem železnice je možnosť riešiť logistiku aj autodopravou.  
Systém žetónov surovín pripomína stolnú hru a dáva jej tým zaujímavý typ obtiažnosti. 
Zaujímavým bodom v hre sú aj návestidlá - ja osobne som dostal radu aby som ich používať a skúšal kombinovať.  
Komunita prispieva množstvom úprav, ktoré umožňujú milovníkom modelových železníc mať v hre vlastných favoritov v podobe lokomotív, vagónov, automobilov a už aj lietadiel. Okrem dopravných vozidiel je tam aj mnoho prvkov dekorácie a iných vecí. 
Hru môžete vďaka multiplayer-u hrať aj so svojimi priateľmi. 
Táto hra je ešte stále v predbežnom prístupe takže sa môžeme tešiť na ďalšie skvelé prídavky, ktoré nás ešte čakajú. Moje hodnotenie je 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061349163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2469, 'last_played': 1703024071}
review:
Parádní hra od super vývojáře, Honzo, tohle se moc povedlo. 
Velmi dobře zpracované herní žetony, které brání lehkému projetí hrou jen díky financím. Někdy si říkám, jaká bude budoucnost hry, zdali bude více vody a i jiný doprava než Mashinky. Chápu, že hra je hlavně o vlacích, ale je zde end goal na vlastnění cca 150-200 silničních vozidel, které, ale nemají balanc a jsou v podstatě nepoužitelné. Pokud hra bude více o vlacích doporučuji snížit body za silniční vozidla. 
Co se týká obtížnosti: jsem hardcore hráč, takže vím kdy je hra správně těžká a kdy už je přehnaná. Tahle hra vám nabízí super obtížnost a výzvu v podobě jednoho depa, které pak už nemůžete přemístit. Stárnutí vlaků a zvyšování nákladů (nebo spíše častější náklady) je dobře zpracované, ale ne omezující. Při hard obtížnosti si člověk musí hlídat efektivitu a výdělky, protože jednou se Vám něco zastaví a je těžké to opravit (mluvím o hard obtížnosti kde pokud nemáte prostředky tak se vlaky zastaví). Jinak hezká challenge, ale ne přehnaná.
Generace map: chtěla by dopilovat, někdy se města spawnují moc blízko k surovinám, neli budovy na suroviny ve městě, kde je pak problém. Někdy se generuje mapa, kde máte elektrárny jen na straně mapy, kde není žádné uhlí a je to pak nevyvážené. Někdy se na hard obtížnosti vygeneruje mapa, kde začíná člověk s výdělkem 10-20 žetonů za rok a to je pak dost nárořné a pozdě se člověk dostane do nafty (např až rok 1990:D), navíc meziměstské autobusy hru neutáhnou, takže pokud není generace měst dobrá nepostavíte ani jeden vlak.
Růst měst: krásně zpracovaný, pomalý, ale postupně se dá rozrůstat více druhy. Ze začátku drahé, ale úpozději se člověk rozhodne investovat a města vypadají skvěle.
Pila!: jediná věc která se generuje špatně nebo málo je pila, lde na menší mapě můžete mít i tři nářaďovny, ale jen jednu pilu.
Mód chúze: dobře zpracovaný a hezky udělaný, kdy si i vlaky i města člověk prohlédne z jiné perspektivy. Nejsou zde bugy a člověk neprochází budovama.
Grafika: parádní, krásně udělané vlaky a města. Krajina je trochu na vedlejší koleji, méně využití vody při generaci map.
Magické otočky vlaků a půjčky: půjčky nikdy nebyly problém, ale dokud člověk umí hrát tak mu těch pár tisíc pak už nikdy nechybí a na grad obtížnost při cca 300 vlacích už stejně ani pár tisíc nepomůže spravit špatnou ekonomiku. Půjčky nejsou moc omezující a docela dobře se jí dá zbavit. Magické otočky (to že se vlak otoči na rovné koleji a přemístí mašinu na druhou stranu) a jiné vylepšení obtížnosti jsou super a hezky fungují. Je pěkné i na lehčí obtížnosti tohle projít a zapnout co člověk chce a zpříjemnit si hru, nebo udělat trochu víc reálnou. Např při hard módu pak někde vycouvávat 5 vlaky je docela vtipné.
Celkově velmi dobrá hra a příjemná grafika. Vzhledem k tomu, že hru hraji už déle a vidím různé updaty, které vylepšují hratelnost a zlepšují ovládání a stavbu (ze začátku byla stavba trochu težší a více bugovala) mohu hru jen doporučit.
Ještě jednou, moc díky.
Ramkill (ramkill.cz)

author: {'steamid': '76561198443410088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 32240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1683, 'playtime_at_review': 3802, 'last_played': 1712351006}
review: Krásná grafika Mashinek, i terénu, příjemná a nestresující podkreslující hudba. Balancnutý ekonomický model který oproti OpenTTD nedělá hru nudně jednoduchou jakmile máte dost peněz, díky dalším žetonům surovin potřebným na nákup či provoz vašich mashinek.  A také zajímavé a těžké herní úkoly, komplexní propojení výrobního řetězce. Možnost multiplayeru včetně pronajímání vlatní železnice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038550400', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1615546838}
review:
Musím říct, že po hraní hry Mashinky jsem velice překvapen a zároveň potěšen. Jedná se o skvělého nástupce Transport Tycoonu, který má osobité kouzlo. U hry jsem strávil mnoho hodin a stále se rád vracím, protože je vidět, že do hry dal někdo srdce a také protože se skvěle hraje. Navíc mě vždy těší, když se vývojáři o své dílo starají a naslouchají komunitě. Tato hra je základní nutností pro milovníky Transport Tycoon a vášnivé nadšence a milovníky vláčků.

[b] 8,5/10 [/b]

Recenzi naleznete zde:
https://www.gamingprofessors.cz/mashinky-herni-recenze/

author: {'steamid': '76561198951257203', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1238, 'last_played': 1711168648}
review:
Серьёзных замечаний нет. Игра сделана хорошо. Подойдет любителям транспортных стратегий и любителям ж/д техники.

Я дошел до конечной эпохи развития и скажу, что играть в одного на картах 128*128 и 256*256 самое то. На больших картах проще развивать путевое хозяйство. На малых же приходится изощряться. Я еще не пробовал двухэтажные развязки, какие там присутствуют.

Развитие автотранспорта является второстепенным (лично для меня), т. к. я был сфокусирован на поездах. Само же развитие автотранспорта способствует развитию ж/д - оно упрощает доставку различных видов грузов* (пассажиров, товаров, почты), не делая кругов-оберегов вокруг городов

Так же в игре есть (как я понял) логистика (взаимодействие различных инфраструктур с другими), или мне это приснилось, и развитие городов.

В совокупности эти все возможности позволяют создать развитую транспортную компанию, как предположено сюжетом (ну или что-то типо такого)

*- под грузами имеется ввиду перевозимые вагонами типы груза и пассажиры в том числе

author: {'steamid': '76561198252242152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1709834267}
review:
Tohle se opravdu povedlo :-) Odehráno 7h v kuse a maximální spokojenost. Vrátilo mě to do dob TTD :-)
Děkuji za skvělou hru

author: {'steamid': '76561198102954520', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4485, 'last_played': 1708401092}
review:
It's a railroad tycoon game that's also like a model train set and it's great.

I wish that in-game time was just a bit slower though. It can take whole months for trains to complete longer circuits.
developer_response:
Hello and thanks a lot!

If you want to slow down time in the game (while keep the train movement, building rules ticking etc.), you can do it manually in setup.xml - time_speed. 

I will consider changing it by default, but just to let you know you may experiment with it already ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107713560', 'num_games_owned': 1107, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 2633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2633, 'last_played': 1671055938}
review:
[h1]È già stupendo e può migliorare ancora[/h1]

Mashinky riesce a portare tantissimi contenuti e una grande libertà mantenendo un bilanciamento realistico nelle risorse.

È il successore morale di OTTD, con il quale condivide alcune meccaniche del core principale del gioco, ma è di fatto un gioiello unico nel suo genere.

Il tutorial è assolutamente uno dei peggiori che abbia mai provato, per cui consiglio di sperimentare o di leggere un po' la wiki, facendo attenzione sia aggiornata.

Per il resto può sopraffare da quanti contenuti ci sono, ma ha introdotti molti strumenti per tenere tutto sotto controllo una volta presa la mano.

Super consigliato.

author: {'steamid': '76561199027303872', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 63853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 743, 'playtime_at_review': 24227, 'last_played': 1712449880}
review:
Review at 400 hours of gametime (2022):
The best train game there is. Because the gameplay and designing your train track layout with signals and driving trains around in the game levels is fun. I have played Mashinky for a year now and I am still not bored. There are already many custom mods to find in the Workshop and the future promises this game to be more than a very good game that is already really exciting and beautiful and customizable and stable.

Review at 1000 hours of gametime (end 2023):
After the latest airport content updates, my review still stands. This game is the best train game there is. The game is addictive to play, runs smooth and is very stable. There is excellent work done on addressed and fixed bugs. The manual has been extended, more work on the manual will hopefully be done. Wonderful new airplane and airport content has been added. There is so much to see and do on a 1024x1024 map. There are many Workshop Mods with extra game content for Mashinky. In 2023 there were over 3700 subscriptions to my Mashinky Workshop Mod content.

The game is developed by a single person, assisted by a few other people. 
My estimate guess would be that it may take up to 2027 or longer to complete the game Mashinky. 

You need a decent computer to run Mashinky. 
It runs on my i5 with UHD630 in-processor video card with low video framerates, a dedicated video card would be best to use. (Video) memory recommended to be 8 GiB (shared) VRAM next to 8 GiB of RAM to be able to play 1024x1024 maps. 

Yes, this game is an utopia of a game. Yes, it is like SimCity, but then a 1000 times better. Yes, there are hundreds of cars, trucks, trains, planes, buildings, and other Workshop Mods to add. Yes, you can build a rail and drive the train over it while choosing its path and speed. Yes, it may take you months or years to build out a full map over all eras.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995380276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1663680445}
review:
Currently in a broken and unplayable state for trying to set up any kind of railroad where more than a single train of the same type enters a station as the train loading code is incorrect.

Unlike all other transport games I know of this one very randomly loads trains. For example, if a train is in the station loading planks and a second train arrives to also load planks, it randomly starts loading the 2nd train even if the 1st train only needs another 2 planks to leave the station.

Further, to make it even worse, if any train leaves the station, such as for example a passenger train this too will cause it to reset the loading and randomly load a different train. It appears to be programmed to simply pull the first train off of some internal list it has and loads that train.

Ultimately you end up with a completely jammed train station with half loaded trains blocking the entire station.

Yes, you can work around it by making waypoints and parking stackers for each train type but this is just ridiculous. No other game in the genre that I have come across does this.

According to their official discord, the issue has been originally mentioned way back in 2018 and when I logged the bug the response is that it's a feature, not a bug and no, it's too hard to fix.

My opinion - not worth getting till this is resolved, if that ever happens.

Signals in the game are also very basic.

OpenTTD is a much better choice, and has been for many many years, and works properly in all these areas. This game isn't worth it for the added aggravation of stupid loading code just for a bit of better graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000653214', 'num_games_owned': 815, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1666215433}
review:
I'll keep this as short and simple as I can - this is a twist on the standard Transport Tycoon formula featuring resource management from the cargo you deliver, which is used to advance through eras and provide fuel and payment for more advanced trucks/trains. You can also add bits onto stations and industries to improve their effectiveness, size, and storage capacity. It's very charming in ways only an indie game could be, and perhaps has accomplished the 'modern TTD' look, feel, and sound (particularly in the great music) better than any other game in this genre both out or upcoming on the market. It's just different enough for a TTD fan to find it refreshing and provide new challenges, while still remaining approachable enough for newcomers who have never played a transport game before.

Long story short, this game is absolutely worth the asking price - particularly if you're a classic TTD fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095162542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4846, 'last_played': 1700544046}
review:
I first picked up Mashinky when former Hermitcraft member Biffa showed off the game several years ago in an early state. I have played it on and off since then, and recently decided to pick it up again after the latest explosion over in the Railroads Online! devs and community. In many ways, Mashinky while the older game than RO! still manages to scratch much the same itch with track building and commodity shipping, and the addition of a first person mode allows Mashinky players an option of exploring elements of their world on foot. 

I have to commend the Mashinky devs for their dedication over the years too, having been here since the early release days its always fun to come back every few months to play Mashinky just to see the new features. I have yet to play with multiplayer, but am trying to convince my friends to give it a shot; but solo play is still a blast with more and more trains and vehicles to choose from.

The only thing I can really fault the game for is the low detail environments falling apart especially on foot, and some of the quests being way to aggressive for the early game (has anyone ever managed to complete the deforestation challenge?) But the low detail environments does have a boon in helping the game have a small download size, and keeps it optimized for most PC's while also emulating the classic isometric tycoon games of the past.

Sure if you want to actually have a good experience driving trains, Train Simulator, Run 8, and a half dozen other train games are much better at giving you an in-the cab view. But Mashinky still manages to do corporate stuff very well as a tycoon game, and as Railroads Online! showed its difficult to combine that well with a first person simulator as well without the hype machine blowing up in the game's face. The Mashinky devs should take pride in their years of dedication and constant improvements to this game, and I can't wait to see it leave early access as the game continues to get regular updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048352731', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3782, 'last_played': 1698857797}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045741199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1706778494}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025925428', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2135, 'last_played': 1661152604}
review:
Mashinky is dangerously addictive, this is the first game I've played in a while in which I actually lost track of time due to how hard I was hooked. I picked this title up after knowing about it since its debut but never really giving it a fair shake. I recently got back into the transport/railroad management genre and boy was Mashinky one hell of a way to come back.

Fans of classic transport management titles like OpenTTD or Transport Tycoon rejoice because this game pays homage to them. Although the game is shown off in its natural beauty mode if you will, most of your gameplay will be spent in the construction mode where everything becomes clean, simple and feature tile construction, its easy on the eyes and makes building up your transport empire incredibly easy and simplistic. You're able to construct various stations, vehicle depots, rail lines, roads, manipulate the terrain to your liking, or even plant vegetation to beautify the world. All of this will be combined in order to connect towns, sawmills, refineries, factories, etc etc, slowly growing your empire across a randomly generated world.

The game's economy revolves around 'tokens', which are obtained by delivering specific cargo to specific destinations. These tokens are what you will use to further expand upon your transport company's infrastructure or purchase better vehicles/rolling stock.

The trains themselves are modeled and animated quite nicely, engines can only carry so many cars before they start to struggle, you can either double head with two or more engines or buy a single more powerful locomotive. Trains acceleration is dependent on their load and overall move/accelerate quite realistically. Understanding railroad signals is important, as you will have occasions where multiple trains have to share a line and signals are what allow traffic to flow consistently, not only that but be mindful as to how you lay your track, you'll eventually learn as things grow and expand how to better lay your rails and break them up into sections so rail traffic doesn't stall up. On top of all that, you can drive your vehicles/trains yourself if you wish which is quite fun as you have full control over it, must navigate to your destination, and stop at your designated stations/waypoints, and of course yield to signals unless you want to crash into another train.
Road vehicles are also available and are a good way of reinforcing your rail lines with extra goods/income, aircraft are also planned for the future.
A world builder that allows your imagination to run wild is present, turn a flat piece of nothing into your very own transportation haven.
Workshop support is present with downloadable vehicles/trains, rolling stock, buildings, maps, and so much more...

This game is worth every penny, buy it, play it, hopefully get just as lost in the gameplay as I did, and support the wonderful developer so this wonderful title can continue to grow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016864030', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18589, 'last_played': 1622616619}

author: {'steamid': '76561198199721914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1708942759}
review: Found myself playing Railroad games during the first lockdown here in the UK. New for me but trains were always my favourite way of travelling. Signalling & path-finding is the  key to get an organised player involved, strangely & deeply satisfying when things work out as they should. With Mashinky you get all this and more, last night I spent some time travelling around the network I had created ... get on one train in the mail carriage, move to a passenger carriage, sit down and watch the scenery passing by at 81 mph, or even drive the engine. Get off at the next station get on another train to somewhere else, have a walk around town, visit the pub, back on another train. Then back to work on the next part of the network. All rendered in picturesque graphic's, what more can I say ? Unique in this genre to my knowledge. Jan Zeleny has created a virtual world based on trains, maybe a social place with multiplayer, but have not tried this yet.  Basically excellent game, if you like trains you will love this. The industry setup is the best I have come across, far superior to Transport Fever or any game I have played, the production chains are very well thought out, and no trouble keeping freight & express trains separated. And once you get to the electric era you have another network to organise to keep the lights on and power your industries. I am just really impressed with this, no big game studio does anything close to this level of depth, for one man or a small team of people ... amazing. I have had no crashes or freezes playing on Win 10, and it's no problem playing while it's in development, in fact I'm very interested to see how it develops. Basically excellent, I take my hat off to Jan Zeleny, thanks for this work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088081065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1659778803}
review: Hra zatím v early accessu nesplnila mé očekávání. Každý, kdo hrál Transport Tycoon, bude okamžitě doma, ale prostě to není ono a hra je příliš podobná své inspiraci, včetně mírné archaičnosti a nezábavnosti, mínus nedodělky a nedotaženosti. (Proč se nádraží jmenuje "Nádraží 1" a ne "Ústí nad Labem - stanice" - jeden příklad za mnohé). Asi nemám chuť hrát znova TT/OTTD, u kterého jsem strávil svého času stovky hodin. Jste-li ovšem méně znalí hráči nebo prostě máte chuť na trochu staromódní zábavu, tuto hru berte, určitě není špatná.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043991646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1659304885}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057123321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1696966693}
review:
Great game, truly a gem. I would call this "Transport Tycoon reincarnated" for those familiar with OpenTTD and Transport Tycoon Deluxe from the 1990ies. 

Token system is a great spin on game economy, really encourages the player to build various transportation networks. The game eras progress, but nothing is left outdated, for example logs and lumber from Era 1 would be still useful at Era 6 for buying vehicles, wagons and building upgrades for industries, stations and towns. 

The isometric building system is a joy to use, everything can be planned and built so easily; railroad tracks suggest automatic connections at various angles, you rarely have to think hard how to lay them out.

1st person look is possible from any train or vehicle, it's possible to travel along with what was just built - an absolute killer feature imo. 

Heck, I spent 8 hours on my first playthrough and I didn't even touch road trucks :D 
And then there is also multiplayer which can be cooperative or competitive. And did I mention mods?

Would definitely love to see ships and planes if that somehow can be an idea for future development of the game, a dlc maybe? Also, some depth to financial and industry-building aspect of the game could be an interesting addition.

Overall, a solid 10 out of 10 for me. 
Thank you for your work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053596735', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 5777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3210, 'last_played': 1697143305}
review:
Nikdy jsem nehrál TTD, tak nemůžu srovnávat. Ale k Mashinkám jsem přičichl poprvé na Gamerpie 2 (2017), kdy byly více představeny a připraveny pro uvedení na Steam.
Dlouho jsem váhal s nákupem, nakonec jsem se k tomu rozhoupal a nelituju. Propracovaný tycoon s několika epochami a opravdu geniální grafikou. Přepínání mezi budovatelským a kochacím režimem společně s velkým rozsahem zoomu ze hry dokáže udělat relaxační nástroj.
Žetonový systém nemusí vyhovovat každému, ale myslím, že nutí více přemýšlet a dělá hru trošku těžší. V první hře se mi stalo, že jsem si nedal pozor, vyčerpal jednu surovinu a pak jsem musel ve velkém restartovat ekonomiku. Takový částečný blackout, kdy je přerušen kontinuální koloběh a není jen tak jej vrátit do kolejí. Bohužel, jako ze života....
Zajímal by mě multiplayer, hlavně na větších mapách, kde to v jednom hráči už dokáže být masakr.
Hru jsem dohrál dvakrát, pokaždé si ji užil. Respekt před Honzou Zeleným, do čeho se sám pustil. Těším se na vydání celé hry a malinko lituji, že jsem si ji nekoupil dříve, abych více sledoval vývoj.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348371052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15321, 'last_played': 1701424098}
review:
Mashinky is one of the best transport tycoon game out there. With a robust system and constant community feedback in Discord, Mashinky is an evergrowing game, even after 7 years of development. 

In terms of gameplay, Mahsinky offers "no style is the wrong style" gameplay. You can play it your way, building railway lines as neat as possible--with several mainlines and branchlines--and using trucks and buses to complement your railway, or you can do a "noodle" railway with railways to every corner of the map. This is the true dream if you wanted to play a game where the sky is the limit.

Once you got the game, there will be adiscord server that could be accessed through the button in the game. The community are very helpful and they have developed several mods to complement the existing game mechanism. Questions about gameplay? The community will answer and will give you guides and suggestions. Bugs and troubles? Report it on discord.

Overall, Mashinky is a robust game even in its current state, and with a helpful community, Mashinky is a game that you can play anywhere and anytime. Recommended this game soo much. 

Warning: Addiction to this game is serious!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016577002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1669250379}
review:
Jan is a genius. His team combined the best of transport tycoon, and train and bus simulators. Similar to transpor tycoon-like games, starting in 1926 your task is to build extensive rail and road networks to serve towns, farms, mines and factories. You can also drive the buses, trucks and locomotives yourself if you want to, from a first person view. Then switch to map mode to get involved in urban planning, and design your routes to serve the industry and the population. 

The graphics are beautiful, from a satellite-like view all the way down to a first person view. You can even walk freely and go inside buildings. Music is a great mix of jazz and blues. It feels like a solid AAA title. 

You can create your custom maps and recreate vast areas with a variety of world-building tools. Then you can download hundreds of free add-ons from the workshop, including locomotives, cars, and other items. 

I don't care much about the business development part, I mostly enjoy driving the trains across diverse terrains with complex junctions and signalling rules. 

I'd recommend it to everyone who likes transport management or train simulation.
