author: {'steamid': '76561198214129831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1792, 'last_played': 1659844794}
review:
This game piqued my interest as soon as I saw it.  Been waiting for a railway game that gives me as much fun to play as Sid Meier's Railroad Tycoon.  I've played many over the years and this game doesn't disappoint.
I have a mid-range pc, the weak link being the graphics card, running Windows 10.  I play on the smaller maps, just in case.  No cash in this game, but tokens, which you must earn.  Transporting passengers is easy.  You have to transport different cargoes to get the various other tokens.  Been said many times, measure twice and cut once.  Set up your lines, with signals, then send your trains out.  Think and plan ahead.  The game will reward you for this.  Side missions are optional but worth doing, as you may miss out on something well worth having, like a free locomotive.  You can play through the eras at your own pace if you want.  The game won't force it on you (set in options).
Well, what more can I say?  If you like trains and this sort of game, then get it.
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188063069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 4296, 'last_played': 1712440098}
review: It's an amazing game that challenges you to make the most efficient rail system, and it also has a side of effect of making new people love trains, which that's always a plus in my book. I got one of my friends into this, and now he can't stop playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992895187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6201, 'last_played': 1710880060}
review:
Mashinky is a transport tycoon game with a focus on trains. It is not only inspired by the great 'Transport Tycoon' from Chris Sawyer, but excels it.

Main Features:
Switch between a realistic and an isometric editor view. Get rich with passenger and mail deliveries and gain 'industry-tokens' by fullfilling industry demands, that are needed to upgrade tracks, trains, cities and industry. Evolve villages to Megacities. Travel through the history of Transportation by mastering the challenges of different technology-ages, like coal, oil and steel. Enjoy the wonderful soundtrack. Play with friends - collaborative or rivalry.

Controls:
Many train-games lack a decent editor for tracks. Mashinky does it very well, as it is easy to understand and to use editing functions. Only thing i was missing is a hotkey to close every window and reset the editing tool at the same time.

Graphics:
The combination of isometric editing-views and eyecandy panorama-views is excellent. Tilt-shift is used for a wonderful immersion into the scenery. Run through the landscape in a first-person mode, you can even jump into trains and control them - or simply watch the beautiful scenery through a window.

A masterpiece. Thank you very much Jan Zelený. Nobody could make me stop play TransportTycoon in the last 30 years, but you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076837519', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2102, 'last_played': 1688083227}
review:
Mashinky

An excellent little Transport Tycoon-style game.

In essence, you must design a transport network of road vehicles and trains that deliver goods from producers, sometimes to intermediate refineries, and then to destinations. These destinations can vary wildly, and the game does very well to avoid the "Just transport a shitload of passengers to earn a bunch of money" shtick that plenty of other transportation-focused games tend to fall into. While cash is used for many things, you need other types of 'tokens' (currencies) to afford certain things, particularly locomotives and cars for them to pull later in the game.

For example. In order to get a Wood token, the earliest type of token available that isn't just cash, you need to deliver wood from a forestry building, to a sawmill, which refines it into planks, before delivering those planks, to a Toolshop. Now, that toolshop will convert the planks into Wood Tokens- if there is also coal present, which you get from a coal mine building. Once a Toolshop has both planks and coal, it will then produce Coal and Wood tokens for you to use as needed. Whether that's station upgrades, or new locomotives, cars for trains to pull, etc. Later down the line, as you progress through each age, a new token or set of tokens unlock, along with their respective intermediate refineries and raw producers. Older resources will still see use, though. For example, to get Iron Tokens, which unlock a little later after Wood and Coal tokens, you must deliver coal and the newly-discovered raw iron to an iron mill. Etc, etc.

It's a pretty, small little tycoon game set on a grid that has a small, yet strong, core set of mechanics that expand and grow more complex as you progress through the game's different stages. In a way, it's very much so a train-focused sort of Factorio, though minus the impending threat of raiding, and more chill music and trains to watch chugging along.

As a sidenote- some of the negative reviews prior/around the time of this review were largely protests from Russian players in regards to Jan's open statement of support for Ukraine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281077018', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2572, 'last_played': 1697163149}
review:
Beginning with a TLDR statement here: Mashinky here is everything I wish modern transport tycoons and games in general could be. To me it brings that old world charm from back in the OpenTTD/early 2000s era. Quality dev team that really have a great concept and well thought out, achievable, roadmap for the game.

Getting into more detail:

- Graphics are fantastic and provide a great aesthetic for the game with construction mode really reminding me of OpenTTD.

- GUI is nice and intuitive to navigate with only some things that could use pop-up boxes when you hover over them so you know what they do.

- Overall the concept works out really well and the game is already well balanced with the multiple currencies in the form of Tokens mechanic *really* providing a lot more in depth and complex gameplay.

- Tutorial is good but not everything is explained. I especially think (since a lot of people for whatever reason have a lot of trouble with railroads in any game or form) that signals need to be explained within a tutorial too. As of right now the learning curve is steep and short, which in the end doesn't really provide you the information needed to build a good transport empire without prior knowledge of transport tycoon mechanics.

- I've not actually played multiplayer as of yet so I can't really comment on it.

Final statement: Overall to me Mashinky is a fantastic game which I wish I picked up sooner then I did. I've known about it for quite a while now and didn't realize what it was until later on when I was watching a Youtuber play it. Yes there are obviously things that need fixing or tweaking, but that can be done in time; I don't mind waiting for it.

More impressively, it is made by like one guy!  I cannot wait to see this come to full release and suspect I'll continue to put many hours into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075041144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1655492517}
review:
Decent visuals with the option to switch between a clean grid map for building and a 3D map for watching or even getting into a train engineers 1st person view. 
Unfortunately, this is where the good things end for me.

The interface is both old fashioned and awkward, some buttons are ambiguous, others just unclear. Tooltips exist on half of the interface elements at best. No ability (that i have found) to change the awkward binds for keys and mouse buttons. Quality of life options, that one came to expect are missing (boarderless window is a big one).

The game tries to automate a lot of the network logic, which is fine for simple setups, however mostly fails, when trying to do something more involved, than a simple point-to-point line. At the same time - because the automation is pushed in the foreground, the interface for fine controls needed to actually make thins work (like proper signaling) is obtuse and difficult to get anything out of.

I love train games -all the way back to Open TTD- and have some understanding (and expectations, i guess) of the mechanics. Unfortunately Mashinky fails to meet these. Can't even get past the tutorial - while it goes into some length about trivial things, i somehow fail to get any actual information out of it, before being run into a dead end, where it just stalls. 

Here's the final message, that made me quit the most recent attempt on the tutorial:
"Two trains have crashed. Train 1 and Train 1  !"
At this point in the tutorial, i only had Train 1.
https://imgur.com/a/XKeQhha

author: {'steamid': '76561198146180025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13765, 'last_played': 1691705131}

Jan

author: {'steamid': '76561198026398299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1654644383}
review:
Unfortunately this game puts micro managing and placing signals everywhere as very confusing and over complicated. There are a few quick guides to try and follow, most of them do not help with what your actually trying to do in game. 

You can follow the guide to essentially break up your rail lines into "blocks" of tracks and these "signals" are suppose to be intelligent enough to know when a train needs to stop in order to let another one pass. This isn't the case at all, at least not that I can figure out after spending an hour trying to get a simple signal system to work. 

There are practically no tooltips in the game - if you do see some info pop up, its delayed, and then only stays visible for a few seconds before vanishing. 

RRT 3 had a very solid system that set up train priority and allowed trains to pass by each other as needed. 

Mashinky works on a very highly complex system of some kind that just doesn't work using basic functions. You can set up signals that "make sense" but the game doesn't understand how to use them or let your trains pass still. 

No idea what formula or how to place signals for the game logic to actually kick in and see that "hey, the tracks are clear ahead, have Train 1 proceed to their track heading north!" - while you have Train 2 in the south heading up to the North and then West to share a small section of track to deliver passengers. 

Train 2 gets to its signal and stops, so now both Train 1 and Train 2 are just sitting at their signals indefinately.

Way to frustrating an experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031259352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 26845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19087, 'last_played': 1711200078}
review:
An excellent game about railroading. It need some polishment in detail, but I spent 318 hours with it having huge fun. Its strenghs overweigh the weaknesses by far. And there is nearly always a workaround for the weaknesses.

Strengths: 
- game starts small and becomes more complicated when you know the basics. The learning curve is therefore easy.
- the Token System is excellent. Something that I miss in other games now when I play them. And it is so relaistic: you have to produce Coal Tokens to provide fuel in order to run Coal Trains. This is just a simple and elegant design.
- scalable production units are just so cool: Not enough logs at the wood? Just add some of the cool addons to improve your wood. 

Weaknesses:
- Automatic Train Replacement should upgrade a train at the next stop. The current system just ruins every schedule. I just call back every train and send a new one out because otherwise it does not work for me.
- It is to easy to break down power lines when you place another track. Finding the broken power line is just work but no fun.
- Some things should have better balancing: I never have enough electric power in the late game so many industries are unused.
- The disability of building tunnels, tracks and climb mountains diagonally sometimes need to much building effort when the map is very crowded .

Overall I think it is one of the best train games in the market.

author: {'steamid': '76561198918539730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1498, 'playtime_at_review': 15416, 'last_played': 1712167583}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051440916', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6044, 'last_played': 1676138043}
review:
Mashinky is pretty hard to describe.  Here are some of the highlights:
- The isometric building grid makes laying tracks easy, yet the non-building mode is gorgeous, so you still get to enjoy riding your trains and cars in 3D.
- The token system adds a layer of depth to the gameplay.  It also takes away that feeling of "I've made a profit so now the only thing left to do is make even more profits with my now unlimited money" that many other transport sims tend to fall prey to.
- The age progression keeps things spicy by forcing you to rethink your layouts to accommodate new industries and incorporate new locomotives and cars.  The fact that different trains use different tokens as fuel also plays into the complexity here.
- The generated worlds are awesome, and you can go for something small and flat, huge and mountainous, or anything in between.  It takes a while to find just the right world, but once you do you can really lose yourself in the game world.
- All of the time-pressure features are totally optional.  By default ages will progress based on the date (or early if you pay some tokens to progress), but you can turn that off in the settings to give yourself as much time in each age if you'd rather perfect things before moving from age to age.
- The signals are nice and simple (as far as train sims go).  It's got chain signals and block signals.
- The developer seems plenty responsive, and he seems to make a point of patching any game-breaking bugs.

Some things to watch out for:
- A lot of players don't like the token system.  If you're all about realism and just want to deal with cold, hard cash, find another game.
- This thing chugs memory like you wouldn't believe on larger maps with higher settings!  You can bet that it'll eat up 8GB of RAM real quick on a max-size map!
- The graphics will put a lot of strain on your video card.  I'm not sure if it's an issue of it just not being well optimized or what, but the game seems to really consume a lot of GPU capacity even when not much is happening.  On the other hand, the GPU usage remains fairly consistent no matter how much is happening too.
- There are no passengers in the 3D display, so sometimes the world can feel a little empty, or like you're walking inside of a model train set.
- The 3D models are OK, but they aren't super high-res.  Don't expect modern train driving simulator quality graphics!
- The last age isn't implemented yet, so there is a sense of incompleteness once you get to the end of the game on a map.  Then again, you can spend hundreds of hours in just one or two ages, so depending on how long you spend on each age that might not be an issue.
- The UI is a little clunky at times.  Some things feel inconsistent (X to close vs Right click to close for different menus), but you can usually figure it out if you're persistent enough.  The tool-tips also act up a lot, especially after an auto-save.

Overall, I've had (and am still having) a blast playing Mashinky, and I'm really looking forward to future releases and content whenever Jan gets around to them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970368664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 19743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 654, 'playtime_at_review': 5042, 'last_played': 1712433330}
review:
Great game strongly recommend if you like logistical/train management games, the progression through the time eras, and how it makes you adjust your lines and supply constantly keeps it really engaging.  

The token system I found confusing and a turn off at the beginning and in the reviews I read, but It clicked and I really enjoy it now. Also love the amount of challenges it throws at you, and doesn't just leave you in a sandbox having to make your own fun (though they are optional challenges and most importantly you aren't against a timer) which I hate in games like these. 

Though its Still in EA My only main gripe is that you feel forced to be in 'strategic view' to get all the possible visual information (think eagle eye in the batman games) and that means you miss out on the very picturesque comfy graphics the game has

author: {'steamid': '76561198203701847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1697403099}
review:
Starting this game I wasn't thinking there would be that much to do, or it'd be just a short fun time,
But when it's five am and I'd been playing for seven hours I had a different opinion.

This is one of the best train games I've ever played, and multiplayer has just added on to that tenfold.
It's simple to start, but it rewards thinking outside the box, and when you get a bit farther in the game it really shows.

And while it has a handful of bugs, besides the occasional crash in multiplayer it runs very smooth especially for being an early access game.

Overall this game is a 10/10 For the Idea, The Execution, And the Dev Teams care for the game.
Definitely a good buy, and I'm looking forward to the coming updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358268819', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5830, 'last_played': 1708538643}
review:
Short review: I 100% recommend this game to anyone.

Longer review:
This is basically a childhood dream come true.
I remember being small fellow OBSESSED with trains and railways, desperately trying to find a free flash game where I can:
-Manage a train system
-Make train lines
-Manage cargo
-Control where trains can stop and where not
-Manage money to grow my railway company
-Logistics
-Etc.

And finally after all those years, this game basically fulfilled my 6 year old self's dreams.
Jan Zelený, as a 1 person team, made this game so enjoyable to play and also nerv-wracking in some circuimstances, which is good. It makes you THINK.
Highly, highly recommend.
And of course, occasional bugs and very VERY rare crashes. (at least for me)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031271216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 29793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27345, 'last_played': 1694808139}

author: {'steamid': '76561198314862987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2569, 'last_played': 1697959872}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960272801', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 8278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1703493381}
review:
I've played Railroad Tycoon 3 more recently and Mashinky feels in the similar vein early on with some key differences. First, I just want to praise the dev for implementing multiplayer. These types of games are fun but even more fun to play with friends/family so its nice to see when the devs put in the effort.

The main difference is signaling. Trains don't just pass through each other but will crash and burn if you don't properly route them. The train routing AI does a pretty good job of intuitively understanding how it reads your signals and created routes. Though the game allows you to get real detailed to maximize efficiency. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1160952202] There's a really good steam guides explaining signals (or blocks). [/url] There is a tutorial in-game and its better to learn by mistakes at first.

The economy uses a token system which hooks you in once you understand the basics.

The other thing is that there is no AI competitors which at first threw me off but then I realized RRT3 AI Companies were sorta dumb and just got in the way (or cheated when it was clear they were not competent). There is a lot of AI code going on in the background in Mashinky. Its extremely satisfying to tweak and improve routes and connections. 

This also runs great on the steam deck for those who have one. Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970704819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 337, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1651483920}
review:
[h1]Transport Management ระดับคุณภาพ ที่คนรักรถไฟควรต้องลอง[/h1]
อีกหนึ่งเกมแนว Transport Tycoon ที่เน้นการเล่นแบบ Rail management เป็นหลัก ตัวเกมถูกพัฒนาโดยคนเพียงคนเดียวแต่คุณภาพกลับออกมาค่อนข้างดีเยี่ยม เหมาะสำหรับคนชอบเกมแนว Tycoon หรือชอบเล่นกับรถไฟเป็นอย่างมาก แม้ตัวเกมจะยังคงเป็น Early Access แต่ก็สามารถพูดได้ว่าสถานะตอนนี้อยู่ในระดับที่เกือบสมบูรณ์มากแล้วหรืออาจจะเทียบกับเกมที่ทำจนเสร็จ แต่ก็ยังมีการอัพเดตระบบบางอย่างตามมาเพื่อเพิ่มความสมบูรณ์มากขึ้นไปอีก ถ้าคุณเป็นคนชอบเล่นเกมแนว Tycoon คุณจะไม่ผิดหวังกับเกมนี้ "Mashinky"

เกมเพลย์จริงๆ คงไม่ต้องอธิบายอะไรมาก ถ้าคุณคุ้นเคยกับเกมแนวบริหารจัดการระบบขนส่งอยู่แล้ว เพราะหลักๆ คือการเล่นกับระบบขนส่งเหมือนเกมอย่าง Transport Fever หรือ Railroad Tycoon อะไรแบบนั้น คุณจะได้ออกแบบระบบขนส่งทรัพยากร ประชากร เพื่อนำความเจริญไปยังเมืองต่างๆ ที่คุณต้องการ เกมเน้นการเล่นกับรถไฟและการสร้างระบบรางเป็นหลัก แถมคุุณยังสามารถเปลี่ยนมุมมองเป็นการขับรถไฟได้ด้วย เรียกว่าเอาใจคอเกมรถไฟกันไปเต็มๆ แต่การอัพเดตเกมในช่วงหลังที่ผ่านมาก็จะมีเรื่องของระบบรถขนส่งอื่นๆ ให้เล่นด้วย ทั้งรถบัส รถบรรทุก รวมถึงมีเรื่องของยุคสมัยที่ระบบขนส่งจะพัฒนาไปเรื่อยๆ เข้าถึงสิ่งใหม่ๆเมื่อเวลาผ่านไป  การเล่นรองก็เป็นเรื่องของการพัฒนาความเจริญของชุมชนเมืองต่างๆ ที่ระบบของคุณเองจะมีความสำคัญทั้งทางตรงและทางอ้อม (เกมไมได้เปิดโอกาสให้คุณพัฒนาเมืองโดยตรงแบบเกมสร้างเมืองปกติ) ความเด่นของเกมนี้คือเรื่อง "ความเข้าถึงง่าย" มากกว่าเกมอื่นๆ ในขณะที่ระบบของเกมเองก็ไม่ได้ตื้นเขินไปกว่ากัน โดยเฉพาะโหมดสร้างรางและเส้นทางต่างๆ ที่เกมจะปรับเปลี่ยนมุมมองให้คุณดูได้อย่างเข้าใจง่าย ทั้งการสร้างทางแยก ทางตัด สัญญาณไฟ ค่อนข้างจะง่ายกว่าเกมอื่นๆ แผนที่ในเกมเป็นแบบสุ่มสร้างซึ่งการันตีได้ว่าถ้าคุณสุ่ม คุณจะไม่เจอแผนที่ซ้่ำแบบเดิม การบริหารจัดการก็ไม่ได้ยุ่งยากจนปวดหัว แต่ก็แน่นอนเกมแนวนี้ผู้เล่นก็ต้องทำความเข้าใจกับระบบการจัดการอยู่เหมือนกัน

เนื่องจากมันยังเป็น Early Access ตัวเกมจึงยังไม่มีเนื้อเรื่องในส่วน Campaign ให้เล่นและจะเน้นไปที่การเล่นแบบ Sandbox กระนั้นในเกมก็จะมีภารกิจย่อยๆ ให้คุณทำอยู่เรื่อยๆ เช่น "ขนของชิ้นนั้นไปที่นี่จำนวนเท่านี้" เป็นต้น กราฟิกในเกมสวยงามมีสไตล์ของตัวเองและดูเรียบง่าย แต่บางอย่างก็อาจจะยังขาดรายละเอียดอยู่บ้าง เช่น คุณอาจจะไม่เห็นคนเดินขึ้นลงรถไฟ ไม่เห็นคนเดินไปมาในเมือง ซึ่งเอาจริงๆ มันก็ไม่ได้มีผลกับการเล่นอะไรเพียงแต่ถ้ามีมันก็คงทำให้ผู้เล่นอินไปกับตัวเกมได้มากขึ้น ข้อเสียอื่นที่พบเจอก็จะมีเรื่องบัคเกี่ยวกับระบบราง แต่ก็ไม่ได้เจอบ่อยหรือมีมากมายอะไร เช่น บางทีสร้างรางไปแล้วระบบบอกรางยังไม่ได้สร้าง (ก็ลบสร้างใหม่ก็หาย) หรืออย่างวางเส้นทางไปแล้วรถไฟไม่ยอมวิ่ง (ต้องมากดหยุดและสั่งวิ่งใหม่ก็หาย) เป็นต้น ย้ำว่ามันยังมีบัคเล็กๆน้อยๆให้เห็นอยู่บ้าง แต่พูดตรงๆ ว่ามีไม่เยอะและเจอไม่บ่อย จนบางคนที่เล่นเองอาจจะบอกว่าแทบไม่เจอบัคเลยก็ยังมี

หลังจากติดตามเกมนี้มานานและลองเล่นมาแล้วในหลายๆ เวอร์ชั่น ท้ายที่สุดแล้วคงต้องบอกว่าตอนนี้ตัวเกมเข้าขั้นสมบูรณ์และเล่นได้ค่อนข้างสนุกแล้ว และสำหรับคนที่ชอบเกมแนว Transport หรือชอบเกมที่เน้นไปที่รถไฟแต่ยังไม่เคยลองเกมนี้ ผมเชื่อว่าคุณจะต้องชอบมัน ถ้าพูดให้เห็นภาพระบบมันออกจะคล้ายๆ Transport Fever แต่เน้นความเข้าถึงง่ายและมีสไตล์ของตัวเอง เรียกว่าเป็นมิตรกับผู้เล่นมากกว่าด้วย ที่สำคัญเกมนี้พัฒนาด้วยคนเพียงคนเดียวและคุณภาพออกมาได้ในระดับนี้ก็ต้องบอกว่าไม่ธรรมดาจนน่าสนับสนุน ใครที่กำลังมองหาเกมจัดการระบบขนส่งคุณภาพดี นี่เป็นอีกเกมที่คุณควรลองครับ

*ตัวเกมมีแผนจะเพิ่ม Multiplayer เข้ามาในอนาคต หรือไม่ก็อาจจะเพิ่มมาแล้วตอนคุณมาอ่านรีวิวนี้

author: {'steamid': '76561197995757259', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1963, 'last_played': 1689614269}
review:
Kdo měl rád Transport Tycoon, tak je pro něj tahle hra povinnost. Spolu s obří moderskou komunitou je tohle teď nejlepší tycoon hra současnosti.
+ grafika                                                                      - zatim malý mapy
+ hratelnost                                                                 - chtělo by to větší nádraží
+ Český vlaky v modech.                                            - optimalizace
Celkově je hra skvělá a až se vyřeší pár chybiček, tak bude best of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030955128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 57018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45100, 'last_played': 1708175809}
review:
Bonjour,
Terriblement addictif, vraiment intéressant par ses aspects 'techniques', ce qui permet de jouer longtemps, il souffre cependant d'un certain nombre de défauts, de jeunesse j'espère. Je ne les citerai pas ici, cela relève du rapport de bug. L'aspect 'conduite de trains' est super intéressant et démarque vraiment ce jeu des autres tycoons. La 3D isométrique est très pratique pour la conception, mais j'aurais préféré un système ne dépendant pas de cases, ce qui aurais réduit les soucis avec le pathfinder, qui n'arrive (actuellement j'espère) pas encore à gérer les plus grandes cartes, ni les réseaux avec plusieurs types de rails.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975079413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1650410287}
review:
Looks like people review bombed this game over Jan's statement in support of Ukraine. Don't let that fool you, this is an EXCELLENT tycoon game, at the very least on par with good ol' Transport Tycoon if you ask me, with the added benefit of riding your own network in glorious 3D. Worth every penny.

Quick Disclaimer: I've actually watched more of this game being played than actually playing it myself. There is something magical about watching people build a transport network empire. Mesmerizing either way!

author: {'steamid': '76561198159234412', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1707816734}
review: Theres aspects to this game like the industries, growing cities and the token system, However there are things I dislike and those things outweigh the positives enough for me to not enjoy playing the game. First problem I have is mainly with interacting with the gui, its messy, bulky and at times unresponsive. Second is a problem not unique to Mashinky but its still an apparent problem with the game and that is fast forwarding time and the relative speed of the trains to that speed. While the trains DO speed up its not by much with how much the clock ticks forward, And I think the consumption of tokens is also disproportionately higher while playing at faster speeds but I'm not entirely sure on that more testing is needed. Its not a bad game but its not something I feel happy about buying right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022732261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1899, 'last_played': 1650229702}

author: {'steamid': '76561198283230418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2366, 'last_played': 1650316340}
review:
Fine game. I would say it's not for everyone, because this kind of game can get boring as it does not offer much variety, but I've spend a lot of time playing games like this (railroad tycoon, transport tycoon, simcity) when i was 12 to 15 years old.

[b]Difference from TTD:[/b]
But this game is somewhat different. It has 7 epochs (as of today) and nearly each of them adds new unique resource (money, timber, coal, diesel, electricity) and industry chain. It makes game kind of different, but linear: first connect two bigger cities close to each other, maybe repeat once more, you have enough money for the rest of the game (cities will grow, income too). Connect two woods into saw mill, then to tool works, you have (barely enough) wood plank tokens for next 30 years, because they are needed for upgrading everything (high speed tracks, station extension) and then there is the same problem with iron in mid game. When you earn enough to upgrade everything you realize that you reached year 1990 and electric age.
So unlike TTD where you build few stations and earn enough money to repay loan and in some point you earn money faster than you can spend them it becomes free building, there is something to do and some resources missing. Actually sometimes it gets interesting when you upgrade too many trains to diesel and production of refinery can't keep up. On the other hand it does not offer much freedom, on 256x256 map there is usually one or two ways how to connect industry.
Game offers some quests, but they are likely not worh the reward (like connect big and tiny city when you struggle to earn money.
[b]Technical stuff:[/b]
For early access, game never crashed in 20 hours, graphics ... i've spend 95% of time in building mode, but it seems somewhat demanding and maybe poorly optimized (LOD of distant trees too high?), Sound of industry is a bit repetitive and annoying. I would say there are some minor issues with vehicle path finding (like certain trains seem to insist on using always the same platform even when it's occupied by a train from opposing direction, even when they have plenty of time to choose free track segment.
Some game features are somewhat missing or unclear (how to pause the game including music, how to copy train orders, how to upgrade locomotive (my way was to buy new, add it to the train, sell old one), how to place one way signals (Click tile three times? No. Click half of the tile in the direction? Maybe ... ok, no. Click half the tile with signal - yes!), can i have speed in KPH on English Windows?

author: {'steamid': '76561197998616726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4895, 'last_played': 1650185564}
review: После того, как автору моча в голову ударила в связи с войной, то играть больше не хочется. Либо пускай всё убирает, либо пускай добавляет возможность вешать флаги всех стран.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990012850', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1650407826}
review:
C'est vraiment un jeu plaisant, je le possède depuis le début et c'est une redécouverte. Son fonctionnement est différent des autres jeux comme pourrait l’être Transport fever. Une plus grande simplicité de jeu et un système de jeton qui oblige le joueur à se diversifier, car tout ne s'achète ou ne s’améliore pas uniquement avec de l'argent.
Sa patte graphique est aussi pour moi un de ses avantages, mes yeux se fatiguent moins et ça devient rare devant des jeux aujourd'hui.
Ensuite il faut saluer le travail du développeur qui si mes souvenirs sont bon est tous seul derrière ce jeu. Il ne l'as jamais lâché et c'est plaisant à voir et à soutenir.
Je ne peu que recommander ce jeu pour ceux qui apprécient la gestion et l'univers du train, il parait qu'il y a aussi des camions mais en quasi 20h de jeu je ne m'y suis pas encore intéressé.
La prise en main demande un peu de temps mais une fois passé les formalités c'est une pépite.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995037276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1677384289}
review:
Mashinky is a one of a kind game. 

It pays hommage to the old days of Transport Tycoon and Railroad Tycoon, while spicing it up with different mechanics and features said games do not have. Mashinky is both beautiful and ugly (the old models require updating, admittedly) while still being incredibly addictive.

The recent update releasing multiplayer to the public has, quite frankly, given this game a breath of fresh air. I've been playing it quite a lot with my girlfriend of late, and we keep pulling the "one more hour" shtick. You think you're done and ready to sleep, but you're not. 

The economics of Mashinky are based on an economy of tokens. Tokens are used to buy, run, etc etc etc vehicles. It is not a purely cash based game. You will not progress running mere passengers. 

For example, should you wish to improve upon your steam locomotives you need wood and coal. Delivering coal to a toolmaker rewards you with coal tokens, as well as if you were to deliver wood to a sawmill and then to a toolmaker. As said previously, you cannot advance with just passengers and cash earning ventures. Industry is vital to success.

The game is early access but not without its flaws. While the game is indeed focused on trains, as in most games in the Transportation Tycoon area of specialty, there is a real lack of road vehicles. You start with a base vehicle, and upon the next age-up you get access to an improved version, but not anything past that. It's fairly jarring seeing 20/30s vehicles in a modern age with vehicles past the 1990s. I feel more variety in the road category would be quite useful. As well, more variety in vehicles in general would be quite nice. It feels like it has the same flaws as in most Transport games in that there is a 'definitive best vehicle', instead of fitting specific roles per vehicle. Having more locomotives and wagons, with a more clear showing of their roles would be quite nice indeed.

Currently only road and rail is the only type of transportation available. I would hope that water and air transportation will be available in the future, as it would feel somewhat bland working only on land. Variety is, as they say, a spice of life.


Jan is a wonderful person who has created a wonderful game, and I hope for more success in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998781124', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2698, 'last_played': 1590932015}
review:
Купил игру в числе первых, так как фанатею от тайкунов. Очень долго наблюдал за её развитием, но - устал. Можно брать только ради  поддержки разработчика и надежды на последующие релизы. Игра сырая, очень медленно развивается. Вместо того, чтобы тратить время на развитие проекта, Ян тратит его на свои политические мысли в комьюнити.
Ян, игры - не место для политики. Занимайся своим делом, а политику оставь политикам.

review: Je to skvělý návrat do starých dobrých časů dob Transport Tycoon. Má to můj velký obdiv už jen kvůli tomu, že to tvoří tak malý tým. I proto mám pochopení pro některé chybky, která občas hra nabídne, ale určitě si to zaslouží podporu a ohlas. Hra je malebná, ale nenechte se zmást svojí vizuální roztomilostí. Je to krutý mikromanagement od samého začátku takže se budete mít hodně co učit. Každopádně multiplayer s kamarády je to pravé ořechové, protože si konečně můžu užívat pohodovou atmosféru, stavění vláčků a autíček v novém kabátě.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964928431', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1681851299}
review:
Spieler starten das Spiel als Inhaber eines Transportunternehmens.
Sie müssen Schienen auf schwierigem Gelände verlegen, neue Fahrzeuge
erforschen und kaufen, Strecken verwalten und gegen wirtschaftliche Regeln
ankämpfen, um so viel Gewinn wie möglich durch den Transport von Passagieren
und unterschiedlichen Gütern zu erwirtschaften. Dadurch entsteht eine herausfordernde Simulation

Das Spiel ist eine einzigartige Mischung aus realistischen Grafiken, kombiniert mit
einem isometrischen Baumodus und brettspielartigen Regeln.

Du kannst Industriegebäude, Bahnhöfe und Depots auf verschiedene Weise aufwerten
und Züge durch die Nutzung modernerer Maschinen und Spezialwaggons verbessern.
Jedes Upgrade bietet einen einzigartigen Bonus

Mit den innovativen Azeigemodi kannst du in einem deiner Züge mitfahren oder den
Betrieb des aufgebauten Transportnetzwerks verfolge

Während der ersten Anfänge, wirst du ein weitreichendes Transportnetzwerk
mit Dampfmaschinen aufbauen und Fracht wie Kohle und Holz transportieren. Später
dann, - wird in der Zukunft ins Spiel integriert - wirst du Maglev Superzüge
betreiben, die futuristische Elektronikgüter transportieren.

review: Very fun game, definitely on its way to overturning RRT (if it hasn't already). Updates come out more often for this than some AAA games somehow and this is only 1 person as far as I know. The dev is quite the based workhorse and he deserves all the love and support!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041935412', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1544298808}
review:
Круто, когда люди из авторитарного государства, которое уже обладает фактически всеми чертами фашизма (за исключением идеологии, точнее идеология формируется прямо сейчас), ставят данной игре отрицательную оценку, потому что автор поддержал Украину, против которой ведет агрессию это самое авторитарное государство с чертами фашизма на уровне ГОСУДАРСТВА, а не маленьких закрытых групп. 
Запутаться легко, особенно когда очень много фейков, а все 8 лет пропаганда РФ была максимальна однобока, а теперь там нет никаких СМИ кроме государственных. Считаю, что переубедить людей невозможно. Им самим нужно поехать в Бучу и то, скорей всего они и там будут кричать постанова. 
Потому со своей стороны я поставлю этой игре положительную оценку, ибо в ней выходят обновления и новый контент. Игра не без проблем, но автор работает над ней. Вот недавно добавился мультиплеер. И в игре уже не 2, а больше этапов. Игра хороша как визуально, так играбильно. Рекомендую. 

П.С. а всяким фашистским ребята из РФ рекомендую читать информацию не только из государственных СМИ. Победить ZЛО можно только тогда, когда понимаешь, где это ZЛО. Слепо махать мечом тоже можно, но только можно и самому поранится. Будьте осторожны ребят из РФ и проверяйте любую информацию из независимых источников.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027409057', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1593, 'last_played': 1666499021}
review:
Despite some people's gripes with the token system, some will enjoy the economy initiatives!

I am one of those people! In Open TTD it is too easy to get loads of the only thing you'll need to build infinite infrastructure by simply making one or two 'back-and-fourth' trains between large towns, then hitting fast forward. For me the token system combined with the 'unlock era' progression are both complimentary game play objectives that encourage me to build more than two trains, and feel like I have nothing left to do other than just make more money.

If I want to get that fancy diesel locomotive (Or that very distant larger mail car...) up and running I can't just wait it out: I'll have to set up a planks line to get wooden plank tokens to progress in the early ages, get some coal tokens for the better steam trains, and that leads to getting iron tokens from the next era, then the oil starts, and so fourth! Next thing I know I'm left with railroad spaghetti that actually works because I had a REASON to make it do so!

Yeah It sucks having to do passenger lines first to get some money tokens, but eventually you'll grow fond of the towns you have to upgrade in an almost pseudo-city builder style later on. Not to mention some trains make snazzier passenger locomotives, and usually have accompanying costs your other rolling stock will take care of over time with the ages.

Oh! Signal arrows - colour coded, and very convenient. I wish Open TTD had them! So my small single-core brain can wrap around the various railroad spaghetti disasters I usually end up with...

The game runs well on my dusty ol' steam locomotive of a computer too! The 3D environment makes it so rather than watching your trains go back and fourth from above the isometric clouds, you can get right down and ride in them! I find myself personally overseeing the maiden voyages of all new train lines - taking the time to revel in the scenery, and watching how the trip across the map starts in the early spring and ends early winter!

My only gripes so far are personal ones. Like the lack of a 2nd-3rd era mail car that isn't the dinky wild west 7-piece mail wagon (or accompanying station upgrade that allows quicker mail loading/unloading). Or the fact I can't have slag ladle wagons for some kind of steel mill byproduct extension - but that's just me. If you've struggled with purpose in Open TTD, or are just looking for something with a different taste, definitely give Mashinky a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117689872', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58753, 'last_played': 1703369398}
review:
Great game for anyone. Game is relatively easy. I believe anyone can understand game mechanics with a little effort, while even strategist can choose game playstyle to enjoy it deeply. Really great game design, by changing playstyle you can get all kinds of experience.

About game trustworthiness - most of the game is developed by single man. He always listened to community, made promises only which he was able to fulfill later. While taking its time to keep game design at great level, game is making good stable progress towards full version. Game is quite open to modding and there is small but active discord community. I trust this game future so much that I've even learnt 3D modelling in past to make some mods for it. Also when I've started to learn programming, first apps I made are designed for this game.

review: The game is great spiritual successor of Transport Tycoon. I love the idea of spliting beauty mode and building mode. It makes the building and train modificatin so much easier. Train driving and Free walk is cherry on top.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249096942', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 221563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1150, 'playtime_at_review': 188855, 'last_played': 1712454951}
review:
If you love trains, you will love Mashinky. It is as simple as that. I have not seen such graphics in any other train game I checked. Actually, Mashinky graphics spoiled me to the point that other train games are unplayable for me, because - for example - if I look at the game such as oTTd my eyes literally hurt. 
Mashinky has awesome community on Discord, fantastic group of people who will help new players with any problems. And the devs actually LISTEN to the community. While this might be true for more games  than Mashinky, it certainly is not true for every game available here. 
In my opinion, the tycoon type economy is important but not the centre point of this game, playing with trains most certainly is.  And the 3D views... Did I mention the graphics? Unbelievable. 
While it is NOT train simulator (and never tried to be one), you CAN drive the train. And yes, you can crash it if you're not careful. 
Get it and have fun, I certainly do.

review: Velmi propracovaná a vymakaná hra, přestože není ještě kompletně hotová. Dokážete si nasimulovat české prostředí včetně lokomotiv, a to je prostě paráda. Můžu jedině doporučit

review: Nějakou dobu Mashinky hraju,je to super hra i pro mě starýho železničáře.Díky Honzo a Wade i ostatním testerúm,kdo se na ní podílí.Dík

author: {'steamid': '76561198028778153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10595, 'last_played': 1640468116}
review: Mashinky is a great tycoon like game. What stands out the most is the game's pace that let's you go slow and enjoy every moment of the game. Also, the games token system does not force you to rush for more and more money like in other tycoon games. Instead, it let's decide what type of industries and fuel you want to utilize to keep your fleet of vehicles going. Another thin to mention is the modability of the game where if you want, you can add vehicles, buildings, maps (via in game editor) or whole resource chains.

author: {'steamid': '76561199061018274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 127767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110324, 'last_played': 1707762497}
review: Best current tycoon. Every six month new bunch of features. Helpful community. Now also with multiplayer (which I do not care). And I love the most that game is logical with strong rules: If you want something you have to do something (you want replace the train, you have to send it - or drive it - to depot first). If you miss the time to buy some old model of loco there is no way to get it. Not so easy as TF2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049275283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6561, 'last_played': 1705318028}
review: Tato super česká hra nemá chybu. Fakt se u toho člověk odreaguje. Nejhorší že to je velký žrout času. Řeknu si, že si zahraju na jednu hodinu max. a sedím u toho  x hodin a připadá mi to jako pár minut. :D Tak kdo má rád vláčky a stavění infrastruktůry. Je to jasná volba. Do hry se stále něco přidává a dokonce i MP. : - )

author: {'steamid': '76561198085526817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1666434497}
review:
Jako Beta verze dobrý, ale už teďka mě dost štvou dvě věci:
1) Koleje jdou stavět šikmo, ale tunely, mosty a silnice ne. Dost by to ulehčilo hru, kdyby to šlo.
2) Tak jak je možná elektrifikace depa, tak to samé se mělo dát udělat i s mosty a tunely. Takhle musím tunel zbořit a postavit znovu.

Jinak dobrý počin, který se snad časem dotáhne do finálního stavu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028692041', 'num_games_owned': 1982, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 4733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4733, 'last_played': 1643489996}
review:
・・・正直に言えば、これを遊ぶくらいならOpenTTDを遊んだ方がいい
乗り物に乗車して景色を眺めることができる以外ではOpenTTDの劣化版でしかないので

飛行機や船舶が使えない（川はおろか、海や湖が存在しないのでどうしようもないが）
なぜかプラットフォームの長さが制限されてる（はみ出したくらいでは載せたり降ろすのに問題はないが効率が落ちる）
一応機関車を複数繋げての長大な列車も編成可能だが・・プラットフォーム制限があるため短い編成を多数走らせた方が効率的なので意味があまりない
電気の時代になると発電所に燃料を運び込んで送電線も繋がないと産業の稼働効率が落ちるなど余計な面倒が増える（なんで一介の運送会社が送電インフラも整備もしないといけないんだよ・・）
自動車の種類が少ないからほとんどの場合列車の使用を強制される・・など微妙な点も多い

まだ早期アクセスなので発展の余地はあると思うが・・いろいろ充実していてお手軽に無料で遊べるOpenTTDと比べ見劣りするのは否めない

author: {'steamid': '76561199228055389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1700390455}
review:
Opravdu nádherně propracovaná a pěkná hra, až na jednu věc - systém návěstidel. To je za mě totální zmar, naprosto nelogické, špatně použitelné... 
netvrdím, že se to používat nedá, bezpochyby s tím spousta lidí bude úplně v pohodě, ale mě to akorát celou hru znechutilo a už nemám chuť se k ní vracet. A je to škoda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007094296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1641240320}
review:
V hraní podobných her jsem začátečník. Myslel jsem si že mě bavit nebude ale je to opravdu hezká a zábavná hra. Jen mám tedy velké problémy s návěstidly. Za boha furt nechápu návěstidla. Věčně mi zastavuji mašiny a nebo posílají do protisměru a nepochopil jsem jak ovlivnit jejich směr a funkci. Na to jak postavit lepší koleje jsem taky nepřišel ale předpokládm že to bude souviset s těžbou rudy ke které jsem se nedostal. Vzhledem k mému problímu s návěstidly nejsem schopen postavit složitější trasy. Ale snad na to příjdu.

Ps. Mám jednokolejku spojenou uzavřenou v kruhu. Chci si dát návěstidla aby se mi nesráželi vlaky. Když si je dávám sám tak mě vždyck jedno návěstidlo dovolí jen doleva a druhé doprava. 
Když jich dám víc tak zase jedno doleva druhé doprava a furt mi zastavují vlaky. Když na ně klikám abych jim určil směr tak se mi jen do směru co chci udělá červená šipka. Funkční návěstidla udělám jen tak že je nechám udělat automatický tzn udělá se mi jich několik za sebou a tam pak mohu normálně měnit směr. Nechápu tohle prostě.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289199844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1701598763}
review: Naprosto skvělá hra, pokročilé možnosti plánování jízdy vlaků, autobusů (dál jsme zatím nedošli), a naprosto dokonalá grafika. Možná i ti lidi nakonec přibudou. S tím souhlasí i můj osmiletý syn, se kterým společně hrajeme a budujeme vlakové a autobusové spoje.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107656500', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 28051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2513, 'last_played': 1694552351}
review: Mais quel bon jeu... 20 ans que j'attends une perle comme celle ci. Grand Fan de A-train, rttd,openttd , Mashinky pousse le curseur encore plus haut. Je n'ai joué que 40 heures, mais il faut pas etre devin pour comprendre que c'est un petit bijou. Tourne parfaitement sous linux. Merci à ce dév qui nous fait vraiment un excellent jeu. (un peu comme minecraft , 7 day to die...). Je ne m'aventurerai pas a vous expliquer les mécaniques, mais c'est assez proche d'un openttd dans la gestion. Cependant un systeme de token rend le jeu bien plus amusant que d'être riche après 10 minutes. Chaque marchandise est importante et il est possible de privilégier des types de transport pour évoluer. Chaque partie est différente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239995954', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1640932861}
review: At first glance, it's OTTD with nice graphics. However, I was heavily disappointed by the lack of configuration and schedule tuning, not mentioning inconvenient contorls, GUI and questionable token system. And terrible optimization - FPS drops to 5-10 in realistic camera mode.

Thanks Jan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994138303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2223, 'last_played': 1681578585}
review:
This is a must-have for all tycoon lovers.
Though the game is still in Early Access, it works very well. Stunning graphics (incredible zoom) and very detailed play-through are just some of reasons why I love it. Ability to improve tracks, roads, town, industries, lay electric wires...
You can just hop on a train and enjoy the ride for hours or build a train empire. Even the token system makes sense, don't be pushed away by that.
For those who still hesitate - very well worth playing even now, worth every cent.

Jan, keep up the good work!

review:
игра очень понравилась! увидел ее не в первые конечно же дни, но можно сказать в первый год.. очень радует, что сейчас 2021 и над игрой продолжают работать: добавляют новые эпохи, новый транспорт.. сейчас вот сделали расширение городов.. 
делал не большой перерыв, но все равно время от времени захожу построить какие-то интересные развязки..
приобрел Steam версию и теперь вообще не переживаю за обновления - все сделают за меня.
для меня игра 9 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010077714', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1697205016}
review:
At first I actually found this game off putting with the token system. Despite this I continued to play and fought past the challenge associated with earning the various tokens.

I have to say that this game is extremely awesome once you've become accustomed to the token system. Very addicting and fun to play. It is a relaxing casual but challenging game to play. I also very much enjoy the aspect of being able to contribute to urban development as a great way to spend your profits.

Late game can be a challenge if one doesn't understand the basics of the game and as you progress you will find yourself constantly improving your routes as they become outdated by need for more efficient modern design.

My only complaint is a few minor bugs and glitches that I am sure will be addressed as I understand this game is in early access.  Overall solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991318178', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 162, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1712391590}
review: Although just catering to two of the four initial transport modes, Mashinky feels heavily like a Transport Tycoon / OpenTTD successor. Gearing strongly towards building networks, populating with trains and chaining industries, Mashinky does this creatively with the introduction of various types of coins, to be used with purchasing, upgrading and even running the trains. This makes it so that every era forces you to expand and improve, circumventing the basic dullness of late game that OpenTTD can often show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014323496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1703374278}
review:
If you're looking for something that's close to OpenTTD but more modern, and with enough innovation to not just be a clone, this is the one! I've been checking out various "spiritual successors", and none of them have come close. The only box this doesn't tick yet is multiplayer, but considering how well made the rest of the game is, I wouldn't be surprised if that aspect ends up being decent when it happens.

This game isn't for everyone, but if you're here, it's probably because you like building train lines, in which case you're in luck.

- Track laying is great.
- Signal placement is a little fiddly, maybe this area could be improved. It doesn't have the fine grained control OpenTTD but it does the job.
- 3D view is a bit of a gimmick that I don't use for actual gameplay, but I do enjoy riding on the trains occasionally. Optimal way to play seems to be to always have the construction view open. Construction view is also quite pretty in its way, I like the hand drawn style.
- I really enjoy the "token" system, think of it more like resources in some other building games. It's cool because different trains require different resources to run, so you have to keep balancing the economy.
- Talking of which, the progression already seems pretty well fleshed out for an early access game. It's cool how you can spend resources to advance faster and get bonuses, or just let time do its thing. Later items cost a lot more to buy and to keep running, so you can get caught out if you get too complacent in the mid game when your economy takes off. The quest system also gives you a lot to do, although it is quite optional if you just want to do your own thing.
- The UI is very similar to OpenTTD in that it can end up being a mess of little windows all over the screen, not very elegant but it works for this type of game.

Overall, if you're into transport games, this is a must buy, already very enjoyable, and the current quality gives me hope for the game's future. Already a valid competitor to OpenTTD for singleplayer, and multiplayer is listed as a feature that will be implemented, so if you need that, I'd recommend following Mashinky and grabbing it once that comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165889761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1703494706}
review:
[zl;ng] Mashinky ist das gelungene Produkt einer denkwürdigen Partynacht mit Transport Tycoon, SM's Railroads und MS Train Simulator. 
[hr][/hr]Das Spiel greift in Bezug auf Kartengestaltung, Gleissystematik, LKWs und Wirtschaftssystem das [b]Grundprinzip von Transport Tycoon[/b] auf und überführt dieses [b]ins 21. Jahrhundert[/b]. Untermauert wird das mit einer sehr detailverliebten Grafik, die dem Spieler für den Aufbau seines Eisenbahnimperiums drei Betrachtungsmodi anbietet. Einem Psydoisometrischen (mit starker Reduzierung der Details) für Planung und Übersicht, einem  freien Blick mit allen Details und einem Lokführermodus in dem man seine Züge selber fahren kann. 

Das zu Grunde liegende Spielprinzip lebt dabei von einer ansteigenden Komplexität, die - anders als in klassischen Tycoonspielen - auf Ressourcen-Tokens aufbaut, welche aus den von Zeitalter zu Zeitalter umfangreicher werdenden Warenkreisläufen herausfallen. Diese Ressourcen machen dann den Erwerb von immer besserer Technik möglich. Das Token-System stellt sich als interessantes Konzept heraus und sorgt für eine anhaltende Motivation im späten Spiel, frustriert aber auch mal wenn mit dem Dieselzeitalter plötzlich tausende Tonnen Kohle übrig sind. 

Zum Negativen: Leider fehlt bis jetzt ein nutzbarer Multiplayer. Das Gleissystem hat die selben Schwächen wie Transport Tycoon, was nervt, gerade in Momenten in denen man es bewusst kompliziert bauen möchte. Auch nimmt es das Spiel mit der Realität an manchen Stellen nicht so genau. Wie auch bei anderen Titel können die Züge ganz schön gut Bergsteigen und passieren verblüffend enge Kurven. Etwas das besonders im Lokführermodus auffällt. 

Insgesamt ein sehr gutes Spiel und eine unbedingte Kaufempfehlung; schon jetzt. Mit unglaublich vielen Details die auch noch nach Stunden für ein Schmunzeln sorgen. So rosten alternde Züge; Städte entwickeln sich organisch - was der Spieler aktiv mit gestalten kann; es gibt Jahreszeiten; und Umweltverschmutzung wird eine Rolle spielen...

author: {'steamid': '76561198018662128', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1645477821}
review:
Hra jako taková je krásná a asi by byla i zábavná, nicméně po pár minutách hraní narazíte na návěstidla. Sorry, ale je to hra, chtěl jsem se u ní odreagovat, nejsem konstruktér traťových systémů a nehodlám hodiny studovat jak ne/fungují návěstidla a podobné věci. 

Možná by nebylo špatné do hry přidat něco jako casual mód, kde bych nemusel dvě hodiny řešit každou výhybku. Zatím jsem lehce zklamaný. Update, trochu jsem to prostudoval, sice tomu pořád zcela nerozumím, ale už mě to tak neirituje.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181959059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1630817926}
review:
首先很感谢作者7年多的努力，个人开发者NB！
+++内置有中文，进游戏后可以调，大部分已汉化+++
+优化思路很好，  建设界面是简化的图形
+有第一视角，代入感挺好
+细节超出预料， 比如车厢的轮组并不是贴图，而是会跟着铁轨曲线调整方向的，不会因为转弯而看到部分轮子出轨的情况，驾驶舱细节也很到位。

-碰撞体积不准确，穿模时常发生
-车有点少，满足不了广大收藏家的胃口
-装饰物不够丰富，尤其那个公司总部像个牛棚，完全体现不出一个物流大亨的败家。
当然这些都是无关痛痒的，部分问题可以在创意工坊装MOD改善。

目前发现的BUG需要尽快改善，严重降低游戏难度：头等舱和餐车。
例如拼30节头等舱的车瞬间变土豪，因为收入翻了17倍，（1+10%）^30≈17
餐车同理，只是要等后期的科技才给力， 但是头等舱解锁一个时代就有了，成本又低，这完全没有了前期开荒的压迫感。
强烈建议改成每列车的头等舱和餐车只能各挂一节，要换必须拆下旧的。

FIRST CLASS and DINNING CAR very imba ! 
they have to change that each train can only carry one, thanks ！

author: {'steamid': '76561198146232214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1629244994}
review: I've messed around with the game a bit, all and all, not a horrible game. It sort of has that nice RRT2 feel to it, just with much much much better graphics. Some general dislikes I had about the game was the inability to choose from previous eras when "updating" your locomotives. It sounds a bit far fetched when you think about downgrading from the current era of locomotives at your disposal, but bear with me here. I'm personally a lover of American steam. The raw power, the the overall looks, and just the overall joy of watching saaayyy, the Big Boy thunder down the tracks. When you reach the diesel era, you do have SOME choices for steam, but they're bland and ugly European style locomotives... Ick, buffers... While I do realize that the game is not as widely known as RRT, Transport Fever, Railway Empire and a few other games I might of missed, I feel that it could do better. While yes, I did dump 17 hours into the game, I found it lacking an economy system, a trade market, and so on. I do like the idea of being able to control your trains in first person though. If I had to put a good comparison of what this game is like, it's Railroad Tycoon on a budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173267974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9576, 'last_played': 1640634824}
review:
Wer auf Eisenbahn Simulatoren steht, der ist hier genau richtig! Es war nicht lange her, da suchte ich in meiner alten Spiele Sammlung einen guten Wirtschafts Simulator... naja... es war halt alles sehr alt.

Also mußte was neues her. Gesucht und gefunden! Dieses feine Ding hier ist anfangs etwas tricky, aber mit der Zeit findet man sich rein (wie bei jedem anspruchsvolleren Simulator halt).

Ich hatte das Spiel tatsächlich noch für rund 23 Euro bekommen und habe bis heute noch Spaß dran. Andere Spiele dieser Art kosten fast das doppelte und bieten nur die Hälfte an Möglichkeiten. (Preis - Leistung ist hier also Erstklassig!).

Auch die diversen Einstellmöglichkeiten des Schwierigkeitsgrad begeistern mich. Die richtige Signalstellung an Zwölfgleisigen Kopfbahnhöfen zu schalten bzw zu stellen ist schon genial! (Zwölf Gleise = Mods).

Mod Unterstützung! Sehr Geil! (macht nicht jeder)

Ach, es sind so viele Dinge die hier beschreiben könnte.... Ich sag nur: Ausprobieren!

Klar: ich hätte auch Verbesserungsvorschläge. Z.b. Diagonale Tunnel und Brücken und/oder Mehrstöckige Bahnhöfe über Tunnel- oder Brückenbau. (siehe Berlin, Paris, London... und,und,und... ;))

An den Spielemacher ein großes Kompliment! Sehr Geil!

author: {'steamid': '76561198363036909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 376, 'playtime_at_review': 6851, 'last_played': 1711757640}
review:
Opravdu velmi zdařilý počin. Pro nás, kteří jsme vyrostli na Railroad Tycoon (ano, na jedničce - VGA, 256 barev), je to úplný balzám. Skvěle vymyšleno, dobře provedeno. Všechno funguje tak, jak má. 

Základní koncept je vlastně jednoduchý, začínáte od píky, s pár chechtáky v kapse. Ze začátku se zdá být všechno poměrně jednoduché. Postupem času však vychází najevo, že obstarat všechny potřebné suroviny pro provoz vlaků není vždy tak úplně snadné. Spotřeba motorů, ať už na uhlí, nebo na naftu, je neúprosná, navíc koncept odtikávajícího času poněkud zamlžuje, kolik žetonů vlastně všechno stojí. Zajímavé je, že se mi zatím ještě nestalo, že by se mi nějak zásadně nedostávalo elektřiny pro provoz elektrických vlaků. Možná, že jenom v době elektřiny je železniční síť tak výkonná, že „krmit“ elektrárny není až takový problém.

Dlužno dodat, že po absolvování tutoriálu získá nováček pocit, že je hra až trochu moc snadná. To je ovšem omyl. Stačí si zapnout některou z rozlehlých map a vše je rázem jinak. Vzdálenosti, na které je potřeba materiál dopravovat se do celkové efektivity systému zcela zásadně promítají. Což je samozřejmě dobře. Například taková mapa Posázaví s jedinou rafinérií, je opravdová výzva. A od stovky vlaků už to začíná být také docela hukot...

Chvíli trvá, než člověk pochopí, jak železniční síť stavět a jak správně používat semafory (pardon, návěstidla). Ale to je jedině dobře.

Vizuálně je prostředí zpracováno velmi pěkně, podrobně, i když tu a tam by některé detaily zasloužily ještě trochu posunout k dokonalosti, například skály, nebo pobřeží mnohdy vypadají poněkud prkenně. Ale hře to nijak neubírá :-). Je ovšem pravda, že z těch cca 110 hodin, které jsem zatím ve hře pobyl, jsem hrubým odhadem takových 80-90% koukal do „stavěcího“ módu. A tam si ten vizuál jeden zas až tak neužije. Ale osobně mi to nevadí.

Abych také jenom nechválil. Je pár věcí, které by dle mého názoru zlepšit zasloužily. Jednu z nich dokonce vidím jako zcela zásadní, a to je odpoutání se od rigidního čtvercového rastru! Musím říct, že limitace trasování železnic jenom v systému pravoúhle a šikmo, je mnohdy frustrující. Přitom si myslím, že dnešní výpočetní modely by to měly celkem dobře zvládat. Třeba to, že nádraží můžete mít jenom v kolmých směrech, velmi často vede k nutnosti dělat velmi kuriózní stavby. S tím souvisí také trochu nešikovný vztah železnice a šikmého terénu. Tam vidím velký prostor ke zlepšení. Další připomínky jsou už spíše drobnosti. Například by bylo fajn, kdyby alespoň malý elektrický sloup mohl být na stejném políčku jako koleje, hodně by to pomohlo u komplikovanějších rozpletů kolejišť u větších nádraží. Někdy zaráží velikost měst, kdy město s tisíci obyvateli má na mapě sedmnáct rodinných domků, ale to je malichernost. Osobně bych uvítal tlačítko „zpět“, přiznávám, že se mi občas stane, že se „ukliknu“ a postavím nesmysl. Už se mi i stalo, že při přestavbě rozsáhlejší křižovatky jsem si takovým ukliknutím zboural most a na nový jsem neměl dost železa – jako na potvoru to bylo na trati směřující do slévárny…

Také přiznávám, že mám vypnutou hudbu a pouštím si k tomu podkres z jiných zdrojů, ale to je věc osobního vkusu :-)

Závěr: Skvělá hra. Má výborně našlápnuto, myslím, že chybí opravdu kousek k dokonalosti. Kdyby se podařilo zbavit se rigidního čtvercového rastru, bude to absolutní špička! Děkuji Honzovi Zelenému a celému autorskému týmu.

review: the graphics is really pretty, you can't argue with that, however, this isn't really a game—in a sense that TT was—but more like a modeling tool, a simulation of toy train landscapes, if you want. the economy part is severely reduced and almost feels redundant. there isn't really anything that forces you to make the routes more effective or to make strategic choices about the vehicles you buy and you are free to build guided by your aesthetic preferences most of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561199161343724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5383, 'last_played': 1672823519}
review: This is a great railroad simulator. The sound and visuals are pretty good and it's immersive- giving you the total freedom to walk around and experience your railroad world. The only drawback for me is that I'm American so I wish there were more American locomotives in the game. Also, the currency/token system is a bit heavy-handed in terms of dominating the game play. I would prefer a system more realistic in nature. Overall, a superb game which I can lose myself in and enjoy immensely even with its shortcomings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051821162', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1629494625}
review: Po odehrání pár desítek minut jsem tomu moc nepřišel na chuť, přeci jen jako dlouholetý hráč TTD (které jsem pleskal ještě na stařičkých MS-DOSech, později OpenTTD, které jsem hrál donedávna, samo na WINech) jsem byl trošku skeptický. Je to něco staro-nového. Ještě ten den jsem si řekl, že tomu dám druhou šanci... A jelikož už už toho sedím třetí večer do noci, hra si mě získala. Je trochu komplikovanější než oba zmíněné tituly ale to je to čím se od nich liší a také tím čím si mě získala. Opravdu je vidět hodně práce na této hře. Jen tak dále!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037779181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1631218458}
review:
Отличный транспортный симулятор, наиболее близко развивающий идеи TTD. Базовые механики взяты полностью оттуда, но расширены и добавлен свой контент. Красивая графика делают игру приятной даже просто для наблюдения.

Проблема одна: это всё ещё ранний доступ (07/2021), хотя прям на странице магазина висит фраза, что ранний доступ закончится в 2020-ом. Игра я так понимаю разрабатывается одним человеком и является скорее хобби, чем бизнес-продуктом. Если релиз не планировать - он не случится. Человек делает, от души, качественно, но в свободное время и не планируя сроки. Наслаждаясь процессом, но не результатом. Если вы хотите наслаждаться процессом разработки - играть в бэту годами без законченного цикла разработки и давать свой фидбек - то возможно вам понравится. Но если вы ожидаете законченный проект - то я не рекомендую покупать. Вполне возможно, ранний доступ никогда не закончится, таких много, примеры долгостроев десятилетиями на слуху.

В целом игра хорошая, но нужен законченный релиз с обещанным контентом, а дальше можно уже делать DLC, развивать, полировать, делать плюшки и т.п. OpenTTD до сих пор релизы делает, это нормально.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244126794', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1700898073}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011057082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1670505836}
review:
I've only been at it for a couple of hours, but this game is the one and only true heir to the iron throne (of Transport Tycoon). If you grew up in the 90s and if none of the later transport management games have lived up to your standards, then this one definitely will.

The token-based economy may seem a little odd in the beginning, but it is the perfect solution to keep up your motivation throughout all the available eras once you've solved your initial money problem. Because Mashinky is not just about planning and management, it's also about problem solving. And that's what makes it feel like a grown-up game.

I'm particularly amazed by the stunning visuals that live in perfect harmony with the isometric base. Even though it's in early access, the performance is excellent and I have yet to encounter a single bug.

Mashinky is proof that you don't need a huge team with unlimited funds to create a masterpiece. Because even in its early access stage, Mashinky beats the Transport Fever series and all the latest train management games by miles.

And that's true even without the many things that are still to come (boats, planes, multiplayer, ...)

11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198859350081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 36537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23769, 'last_played': 1708209637}
review: O této hře jsem se dozvěděl od mého táty, který mi ji chtěl k vánocům koupit, ale nebyl jsem moc rád, protože jsem si víc přál jiné hry jako například Far Cry 4. Jelikož jsem chtěl zjistit o čem jsou Mashinky, tak jsem začal sledovat videa od Gamekeepers_cz kde hráli právě Mashinky. Po shlédnutí těchto videí jsem hned změnil názor. Strašně jsem se začal těšit až si Mashinky zahraji. Jakmile byla hra koupená a nainstalovaná hned jsem si ji musel zahrát. Byl jsem velice spokojený. Hra mě velice bavila a vždy jsem se těšil na nový update. Později jsem objevil Workshop. Díky módům mě tato hra bavila zase o něco víc. Opravdu mohu to tu hru všem doporučit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036474745', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2625, 'last_played': 1652729735}
review:
Очень правильный симулятор транспортного магната в удачном сочетании 3D графики и 2D ландшафта.
Способен надолго заставить потерять сон и аппетит, но так же быстро и отпустит. Ведь к концу первой партии уже не останется никакого нового контента, который игрок ещё не видел.
Вместо привычных денег в игре используются "жетоны" ресурсов, каждый из которых добывается в собственном производстве и требуется для поездов/машинок/вагонов/рельсов/дорог/мостов, да даже на топливо тем же поездам. Эта механика делает игру с одной стороны интереснее, заставляя игрока осваивать все возможности, с другой - не понятно как будет работать мультиплеер. Как игрокам соревноваться или взаимодействовать друг с другом, если всем нужно всё? Да и компьютерных соперников в игре тоже нет. Так что главный враг игрока - транспортные развязки.
Зато игра позволяет покататься на своих поездах с видом из кабины под стук колёс. И в целом оставляет крайне приятные впечатления.
9 Шелдонов Куперов из 10 возможных!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026088737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 10026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8331, 'last_played': 1658954028}
review:
One of my favorite games to play for a few days every few months to see how it's changed and grown. From a tiny little game with only a few eras and few trains to what honestly feels like a far more complete game(and still growing!), Mashinky is honestly worth picking up.

The stuff you can do with the locomotives and the track is fairly in depth and very enjoyable to build what essentially becomes your own train set, and they keep adding more and more things to do in the game. Very low pressure and very enjoyable to play. 

Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004356984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3933, 'last_played': 1684350233}
review: I first played this game back in 2018 and found it to be a fun little game for a time that was over fairly quickly. I've kept coming back every now and then as the game as been updated and I am impressed with how far the game has come. It's no longer "good for early access" it's just plain good. I am excited to see where the game is in another year.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993574799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5035, 'last_played': 1650812741}
review:
Hru vrelo odporucam
Ked hru porovnam s inymi budovatelskymi strategiami, tak k tejto som sa niekolko krat vratil.
Vzdy ma s odstupom casu prijemne prekvapilo, ze tam nieco nove pribudlo
Taktiez herna mechanika je proste jednoducha ale dostatocne challenging
Oproti vecne porovnavanemu OTTD to sice nema zatial uplne vsetky zakladne funkcnosti, ale grafika a cele UI je uplne niekde inde a OTTD som do 15 minut vypol lebo mi prislo ako nehratelne s tymi milion malymi okienkami.

Najvacsie plusy
Regulovatelna obtiaznost, hru hram na jedno depo a hard mode
Mechanika zvysovania spotreby tokenov za kratsi cas ako opotrebenie je super, treba to stale obmienat a premyslat ktora lokomotiva sa na co hodi
Velmi ocenujem rozsirenia priemyslu s rastucimi erami (napr elektricka tavna pec len na zelezo), mohlo by byt tohto techu viac
Dizajn vlacikov je super, cista nostalgia ako ked som maly chodil po stanici
Komunitne rozsirenia standardnych krizovatiek ci masinky s lokomotivami

Co sa tesim ze sa zmeni
Multiplayer, aj ked chapem ze vymysliet normalne tu mechaniku fungovania aby to nebolo o tom, kto koho skor zablokuje ale o prijemnej hratelnosti je dnes uz narocne
Nejaky rebalancing produkcie tokenov. Ingotov a ocele vozim 3x tolko ako ineho a aj tak je toho malo.

review: This game has come so far on Early Access.  Now up to the 6th Era (only one more to go), and with the new City Update (New at the time of this review) .. The game is very fun to play.  Stamps (like blueprints on Factorio or junctions on Cities Skylines) make the game so much better.  I have spent much time playing and feel I have very much gotten my money's worth on this game and it is not even finished yet.  I can't wait to see what else Jan has in store for us. author: {'steamid': '76561198897979135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1658935955}
review:
Muy recomendado para aquella personas que disfruten con los juegos Tycoon de lineas ferroviarias.

La verdad es que es sorprendente el trabajo que ha realizado el creador del juego, tengo entendido que es el único responsble de la creación y la programación del juego.


Con grafícos de estetica noventera, en este juego podrás crear infinidad de rutas ferroviarias en mapas personalizables y la verdad, cuenta con una buena gestión. A medida que va pasando el tiempo te reta y a su vez te engancha de una manera increible. Se pasan las horas volando jugando a Mashinky y poco a poco van apareciendo/creando nuevas y sofisticadas actualizaciones gratuitas.
