author: {'steamid': '76561197974371255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1705, 'last_played': 1703522651}
review:
pour commencer je n'ai pas cette habitude  de donner mon avis sur des jeux vidéos .
mais aujourd'hui je me lance pour MASHINKY .chapeau bas pour le dev seul au monde pour développer un jeu de cet tranche.
on se prend vite au jeu, le systéme de gestion est assez original avec ces trois "monnaies".la difficulté est progressive et la prise en main est presque immédiate. il y a des mises à jour régulièrement et notamment les transports routiers pas mal modélisés.
les graphisme sont corrects.la bande son est reposante.cependant il manque cruellement d'animation les conducteurs sont absents ainsi que les passagers.les villes se développent peut malgré le changement d'époque.en tout cas il y a encore beaucoup de travail à effectuer pour que ce jeu devienne un best seller dans son domaine  car la concurrence existe bel et bien
bon courage à Jan ZELENY

author: {'steamid': '76561198127572407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 5702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1424, 'last_played': 1699147860}
review:
I have a soft spot for railroad management games, even though I'm rubbish at it. I always seem to get to a point where things have evolved enough for me to sit back and go... " Now that is one fine mess". Either the trains get so stuck that its the ultimate entangled garden hose excercise or I feel like I am trying the pull several threads through the eye of a needle, as every kind of goods need to go to every one of the 30 cities on the map. 

Even though Ive spent nearly 300 hours on some of them, those hours were mostly spent giving up. 

This game however is the exception for me . Its quite complicated, but at the same time its very logic and cleverly designed so that its easy to keep tack of what you are doing. Its so well thought out, yet, its very forgiving and its super chill. 

I would say its definitely is the most fun Ive had in a transport management game since the days Railroad Tycoon was king.  Its really just one giant sandbox, and it allows you to do as you please. However, at the same time it sets goals so that you have objectives to chase.  But only if you want... That said, if they are turned on and you miss the objectives, its not like you are going to be sent you to your room.  Actually the goals help you to learn the different tiers of complexity as you progress, like a very subtle tutorial. The game teaches you how to play it as you go along. It assumes you have a brain and its not going to tell you  how to use the WASD keys or  rediscover what the middle mouse button does when gaming on a PC. 

Even though this is early access, it plays like a fully fleshed out game. I cannot remember the last time I have been so immersed. To me this is up there with classics like Banished / Factorio / Prison Architect. Its a superb blend of immersion, intelligent design, and replayability, that makes it the kind of game you would want to come back to again and again.  In short, its a future classic.  

On the flipside, I was reminded of the Early Access status as the game crashed unexpectedly a few times. Maybe four or five in the 7 hours Ive played.  That said, the autosave is set to 1 minute, so you never loose much, and its very discreet when it saves,  you don't notice it at all. A bit like getting back to MS Word when you shut it down prematurely to get out of the office.  Even though Mashinky is beautiful, it could probably run on an upgraded toaster and it loads almost as fast as Tetris. 

As an oldtimer who has been playing train sims since the 90s. this one is up there among the best. And for those who think its expensive... How many forgettable Skinny Latte's can you buy at that unmentionable Seattle Coffeee company..? Two ? Three?   This game is definitely more fun than seeing your name misspelt in annoying new ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096204979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 5738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1700343820}
review:
Drogi deweloperze, to niesamowita gra, przede wszystkim dzięki za tak interesującą grę fabularną, grafika jest na poziomie! Jedyne o co proszę to proszę naprawić koła w wagonach, koła w ogóle się nie kręcą, a z wagonów nie wydobywają się żadne dźwięki! Wystawiłem negatywną recenzję, aby Deweloper mógł to zobaczyć, ale polecam grę dla kolejarzy) Super!
Уважаемый разработчик это удивительная игра,спасибо за такую интересную в первую очередь сюжетную игру,графика на уровне ! Единственное что прошу Вас почините пожалуйста колеса в вагонах, колеса вообще не крутится ,и нет звуков от вагонов! Ставлю отрицательный отзыв чтобы Разработчик увидел,а так игру рекомендую для железнодорожников) Классная!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038364525', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 11861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9153, 'last_played': 1705357618}
review: Mashinky est l'histoire d'un jeu créé par une personne talentueuse et particulièrement motivée qui tient absolument à nous offrir la  table de modélisme ferroviaire la plus complète et la plus aboutie de tout les temps.Pour cela il nous faudra délivrer passagers et marchandises.Pour réaliser cela rails,ponts,tunnels et autres feux de croisements sont à notre disposition.Proche des premiers rail-road tycoon ce jeu s'en différencie par plusieurs aspects.Le premier est visuel.Le second dans la complexité de l'évolution a travers les différentes ères qui sont représentée par l'apparition des trains vapeurs,diésel,électrique et leurs reseau de rail spécifique.Pour les voir circuler il faudra également les fournir en énergie.Avec une foule de règle permettant de rendre le jeu très accessible celui-ci se met à la portée de tout ceux qui rêve de créer le réseau de leur choix.Toujours en développement,celui-ci à déjà 5 ères sur 7 la possibilité de voyager à bord de ses trains et est régulièrement mis à jours.Un accès au workshop est déjà disponible et je dois dire que moi qui aime jouer au petit train,je me régale.Un titre prometteur qui ne cesse de se bonifier et que je recommande chaleureusement aux amateurs du genre.Tchou-tchouuuuu!

review: 这信号灯坑了我几把。既然信号灯不行，那我弄独占吧。玩到后面又不知不觉把所有独占线路给连在了一起，结果又堵车了。不过现在还是EA阶段，先给好评吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198137395537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 29954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5964, 'last_played': 1696240160}
review:
Hra je pro všechny lidi, co milují vlaky a cestování. Je to logická simulace, kde jste nejen majitelem společnosti a snažíte se nezkrachovat, ale můžete si zahrát na strojvůdce a nechat se povozit v lokomotivě. Krásná krajina okolo, která ubíhá dozadu, je skvělá. 
Hra je rozdělena na (dalo by se říct) "budovací" a "pěkné" rozhraní. V "budovacím" stavíte depa, taháte tratě a silnice a posíláte vlaky a auta na trasy. V tom "pěkném" se můžete nechat povozit a kochat se krajinou.
Jako každá nedodělaná hra, má i tato nějaké chyby. Na wiki se pracuje a také není úplná. Přesto se najdou lidé, kteří jsou trpěliví a ihned nenadávají když něco nejde. Někteří se snaží pomoci v rámci svých sil a znalostí. Tahle hra a hlavně její tvůrce a lidé okolo si jednoznačně zaslouží pochvalu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020238261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1571713916}
review: Needs a better tutorial on how the railways actually work and a more intuitive mechanic for telling you why things might not be working. If this were improved I might be tempted to change my mind but for now I'd probably skip until further down the line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007410962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1571494297}
review: Si, un juego que lo hace una sola persona, vale, y se nota. Por los videos me esperaba otra cosa, la verdad, muy verde, la gestion de vias es una mierda, unos graficos penosos, y ausencia de diversion. Devolucion al instante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031323669', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1654430284}
review: Výborná hra. Už dlouho mě tak nic nechytlo. Je vidět, že dobrý nápad a provedení nenahradí jen načančaná grafika, halda slibů a nesmysly. Vývojáři AAA titulů se mají stále od obyčejných nadšenců pořád co učit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007868491', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1571150742}
review: Bisher für komplexere (einfach komplexe) Schienensysteme nicht wirklich spielbar. Es fehlen die entsprechenden Signale. Aus meiner Sicht der erste Punkt, der bei einer Eisenbahnsimulation erstellt werden sollte. Ich verfolge das Projekt weiter, aber derzeit fehlen Grundlegende Inhalte, die ein openTTD z. B. bietet. Schade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109894800', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1570836500}
review:
I don't write reviews often, but this one is so incredibly buggy that I just had to say something.  90% of the time I was playing this game, I was trying to figure out why the hell my train was going between the station and a depot without taking a railroad with no "one-way" railroads to another station. Or how multiple of my trains were locked inside my depot without being able to get out of it. To trains normally driving and crashing into themselves when they weren't. Incredibly frustrating.

And keep in mind all this happened within a spam of 33 minutes. Needs to be developed more before I can even think of giving this game a thumbs up.

Stay away from this one for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985778703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1570262339}
review:
Short version, Skip It.
- Absolutely no strategic depth I could glimpse.
- Very simplified economy. (Not in a good way)
- Tiny and cluttered map with bad graphics. Even the larger map on custom.
- Interface (Omg. what were you smoking!)

I bought this on a bored day stuck at home sick, and broke my oath, never to buy anything Early Access.
I like trains, I like strategy games, management games. I adore classics like RRT or Colonization etc from the Microprose days.
So, in theory this should be enjoyable. It was not, for me.
I guess if you are a fanatic trains afficionado, maybe... As far as I could tell, all the historic train models are available and I am guessing they are correctly modeled for 5 hex trips they make.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991447333', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1628628989}
review:
Больше всего ассоциаций Mashinky у меня вызывают с TTD и, думается, не только у меня одного. Это, пожалуй, довольно свежая, хотя и существенно уступающая по функционалу реинкарнация легендарного транспортного тайкона. В ее основе лежит все та же старая история про паравозики - одно из любимых развлечений мальчиков. Она также дополняется впоследствии введенными машинками, но их меньше. Строим инфраструктуру, соединяем города, налаживаем логистику. Суть проста: заработать денег. Правда, в игре есть ряд отличий от TTD. Первое из них - это наличие дополнительной валюты в виде спец. ресурсов, которые мы тратим в том числе на постройку зданий и путей, а также покупку и обслуживание поездов. Второе - это двойной режим графики: упрощенный для строительства и красивый для созерцания (строить в нем нельзя, но можно заниматься менеджментом). Наконец, третье глобальное  отличие - это возможность покататься в кабине паровоза или автомобиля. Автор также обещает режим прямого управления, но я ему пока что не верю.

Само собой, это довольно поверхностный анализ, на самом деле нюансов и отличий гораздо больше, просто я не вижу смысла перечислять все. Mashinky уже сейчас старается брать более современным внешним видом, удобным интерфейсом, более продвинутым ИИ (на самом деле он иногда тупит даже сильнее), ну и, само собой, никакой открытости. Правда, у "Машинок" есть поддержка Workshop с возможностью скачать новые виды транспорта и карты. Но о модульности и речи не идет. 

Геймплей у данной игры вполне себе приятный. Если вы в теме, конечно же. Прокладываешь рельсы, пускаешь по ним поезда, следишь за пассажирскими перевозками, внося коррективы. Ну и товарами занимаешься, само собой. Промышленность здесь работает по привычной схеме: у нас есть определенная цепочка ресурсов, усложняющаяся с каждой эпохой, которую нам надо соединять. Бревна в лесопилку, доски на завод. Где-то цепочка сложнее, где-то проще - вариаций тут достаточно. Сами объекты появляются рандомно и зачастую неудобно, что с одной стороны вводит сложность, а с другой выглядит крайне нереалистично (ни один дурак не будет строить лесопилку там, где лесом и не пахнет). Отдельные цепочки дают нам жетоны специальных ресурсов, которые, как я уже сказал, нужны для разных действий. Они, кстати говоря, нужны и для перехода в новые эпохи: "донатишь" нужное количество таких ресурсов и твой технический прогресс шагает вперед.

Что еще можно сказать про эту игру? ИИ противников здесь нет, поезда отличаются разными характеристиками, но о тонкостях вроде колесных пар здесь речи не идет, города развиваются довольно странно и потребностей в ресурсах у них как таковых нет, станции имеют область действия, которую можно увеличить постройками. Есть разные виды рельс (появляются с техническим прогрессом). Мосты и туннели строятся только в 4 стороны - по диагонали нельзя, что раздражает.

Хорошая игрушка, в-общем - можно позалипать в нее.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117116393', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1676227402}
review:
Я как человек который очень редко пишет обзоры напишу и на эту игру. Поиграл почти 5 часов в эту игру. Игра понравилась, очень хорошая графика, нравиться что можно сидеть вместо пассажиров. 
Почему поставил отрицательный, ну просто убогое  маршрутизирование транспорта. Светофор поезда может закрывать дорогу вечно если дорога круг поезда короткий. Дорогу нельзя построит если рельсы идут не ровно. 
Короче поддержать разработчика можно, но пока игра ужасно сырая хотя прошёл уже и год.
Надеюсь что всё таки он сделает что нибудь с этими минусами.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962771882', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2046, 'last_played': 1667706254}
review:
HEY! YOU! Do you like Tycoon-style games?! Because this is sort of like that but not. Do you like model trains?! It's more like that. It's like putting together a huge model train set in a living room the size of a continent while kinda being a tycoon... -ish.

Once you've got it together and have more money than you can imagine coming out of your ears, you can hop on a commuter engine and take a look at what you've done from ground level with a great aesthetic.

You want this. You really do. Just get it. The developer would probably appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087303794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1711284616}
review:
Боже, я не заметил как день пролетел. Игра затягивает, хоть она еще дорабатывается. Можно строить сложную логику движения поездов и можно делать многоплатформенные станции - только придется помучаться с логикой, чтобы поезда разделялись и заезжали на разные платформы, но в этом и весь смак! это очень очень круто! 

П.С. Были трудности со входом в игру(Steam must be running to play this game), пока не отключил в Comodo опцию Авто-Containment.

Нашел один маленький баг - когда поезд заезжает в тоннель, то издает свист. И вот этот самый свист потом зацикливается и постоянно пересвистывается.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019816374', 'num_games_owned': 1357, 'num_reviews': 1685, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1568724037}

There is a ton of depth in the game, from what kinds of trains you use, to where they switch to what they carry, it is dense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198990026034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1568755275}
review:
I have played a couple of railroad tycoon games and I need to say that Mashinky really is a promissing one. The game is currently in early access and the developers have done so much work on it. There are regular updates with bug fixes and community posts and suggestions are being put into the game! I've been playing it for a couple of hours now and despite that it's not a finished product and content is missing, I'm still having so much fun, that I had to put a review about it.

Here are some tips that I would like to suggest being added to the game:
1. Better Menu management
- Some menu options are hard to find and not always visible.
- Some times when you hover over an icon, no text pops up and you have to find out what it actually does. 

2. Growing cities & Adding people
- There are no actual people in the cities, but empty streets and platforms.
- The cities never grow in size.
- There are no visible people on trains, as well as the train itself is without a driver.

If you're a hardcore fan of the tycoon genre, then be sure that this game won't disappoint you, even though it's still in early access!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060007813', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1621179548}
review:
Ani nevím co napsat. Hře nemám naprosto co vytknout. Herní model je jednoduchý, snadno zvládnutelný i pro nováčka a přesto v pokročilejší hře dostatečně propracovaný. Nejednou se zapotíte, když hrozí srážka vlaků nebo se lidé nemohou dostat do práce :D


Vývojář aktivně na hře nadále pracuje a Steam workshop nabízí kompletní mapu České republiky či jiná rozšíření, takže na hodiny máte o zábavu postaráno. Do budoucna je plánováno rozšíření o vozidla a další.

10/10 fanouškům Transport Tycoon. V žánru zřejmě to nejlepší, co si lze v současné době zahrát.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088264980', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1567707946}
review:
Должен признаться, от паровозов, электричек, локомотивов и вообще железной дороги я держусь подальше. Если мне нужно кудато ехать то я б предпочел автобус, если куда-то поближе, то автомобиль, а если совсем близко, то велосипед или пешочком. Но когда появилась возможность поиграть в железнодорожный сим, то я все же решился ухватится за эту возможность.

На деле Mashinki выступают больше экономической стратегией. Игроку придется прокладывать свои маршруты, собирать составы, перевозить грузы и всячески пытаться заработать больше денежек.  

[code][url=store.steampowered.com/curator/11769719/] Еще больше обзоров на кураторской страничке Dreams of Genesis! Подписывайтесь, с нами весело!	[/url][/code]

Карты в игре процедурно генерируемые с довольно большим количеством настроек, которые позволят вам сгенерировать карту под ваши предпочтения и сложность.

В игре есть два режима, один представляет из себя упрощенное 3D для строительства, прокладки дорог и вообще фактически для всего менеджмента. Кстати кроме железных дорог вы в праве так же прокладывать дороги общего назначения. Второй режим это полноценное 3D, в котором мы можем созерцать все величие своего творения.

После того как вот вы вроде проложили дорогу и собрали состав, вы должны назначить своему поезду места остановок, задать места загрузок, разгрузок, разворотов и прочие мелочи. Разобраться по началу во всем этом довольно сложно и вряд ли выйдет с первой попытки, во всяком случае у меня не вышло.

Хочется отметить хорошее музыкальное сопровождение. Мягкие мотивы успокаивают, особенно когда эта паровозная гадость набрал полный вагон людей, но почему то не хочет выгружать их на перроне, но тут уж больше моя вина , чем игры. Визуальный стиль, тоже вполне приятный. Особенно если учесть что это инди, да и ранний доступ. Ну вы ж знаете какой “качественный контент” сейчас выходит в стим.

Игра разрабатывается уже на протяжении семи лет одним человеком, фактически перед вами инди долгострой и сколько еще точно потребуется времени что бы игра вышла из раннего доступа никто не скажет. Но планы у создателя Наполеоновские, вв будущем он хочет реализовать семь эпох развития, от зарождения парового двигателя до современности и возможно недалекого будущего. Пока что доступно, если не ошибаюсь, пять эпох. 

Так же есть небольшой бонус в виде мастерской в стиме, пока еще не слишком большой, но если игра расширит свою фанатскую базу, то и мастерская расширится. 

В общем, на самом деле это не совсем то чего я ожидал. Разобравшись в себе, я понял что больше хотел бороздить просторы на железно тяжеловозе, а не заниматься менеджментом. Но и тут игра смогла удивить, чуть позже нам дают доступ к управлению локомотивом. Так что моя остался доволен. Да игра по началу не слишком дружелюбной показалась мне, но чутка разобравшись, выполнив парочку заданий я смог освоится и начать потихоньку строить сво. транспортную империю.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993503645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 3020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1687081725}
review:
Si vous aimez OpenTTD a acheter les yeux fermées, la même chose en mieux sur tous les points, plus joli, plus réaliste, plus logique, plus tout ;) sauf peut être l'économie un peu moisis (mais bon même sur OpenTTD l'économie l'était aussi).

Le soucis c'est que là l'économie est basé sur chaque denrée qui fournis une monnaie différente, donc on est obligé de transporter de tout pour pouvoir avancer, c'est bien mais ça oblige certaines concessions. On ne va pas améliorer certaine partie du réseau pour devoir faire un autre réseau ailleurs pour une autre industrie.

Le support de GNU/Linux par Steam Play/Proton est pas trop mal, quelques problèmes de textures qui peuvent soit être oubliées, soit être désactivés en paramétrant les options graphiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963908939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1645620531}
review:
Na ten moment gra jest nudna jak flaki z olejem. Z pasażerów mamy hajs, a z drewna itp tylko jakieś, żetony potrzebne, by przejść do kolejnej ery. I tyle. Ot cały sens gry. To tak w skrócie.

Czyli za zarobione piniądze dokładmy do tego by wozić drewno, rude, węgiel itp.  Jednak Transport Tycoon nie pobity nadal. Tam niby tylko kase zbieraliśmy, nowinki technniczne pojawiały się same. Ale jakoś było i jest ciekawiej.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960410505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 9167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5706, 'last_played': 1699233561}
review:
Excellent Railroad Tycoon game in the style of old; in particular, I think the developer played a lot of the classic Sid's Railroad Tycoon 2 as a kid. 

This game is about building complex supply chains with railroads. The economy is a bit strange, but it works and is meaty.

The 3D and riding trains is fun for a time, but I found that whole side more gimmicky than useful. Out of my 90 hours, I probably have spent 89 of them in the more bland building mode that makes it easier to place and manipulate tracks. I'm not knocking the riding thing, just don't go in thinking that is a major gameplay aspect.

Bugs are noticeable, as expected of an early access. The most frustrating part of this game is the interface such as too many windows and subfolders with limited shortcuts. I am particularly annoyed about the unnecessarily complex manner to pick cars for trains. You also can’t clone trains once they are already out hulling which is super annoying. 
Granted, these complains are minor in the grand scheme of things, and I expect them to get ironed out as the game develops.

The biggest things I think this is missing is having an AI to compete against, business management, and any type of real missions. Without any competition, there is no sense of urgency. While some may like this, I find it can sometimes get boring after a while – particularly during the end game. As for missions, the game has them, but they are uninteresting things like a popup telling you to “move 100 wood to this lumber mill.” 

The developer is active, with regular updates and communication.

I know this review might appear a bit negative, but the game itself is already enjoyable enough for me to look past my gripes. If the game was called finished now, I would still be content with my purchase at $25, if not disappointed at a loss opportunity for a truly epic tycoon game. You can lose track of time in Mashinky which is always a hallmark of a good tycoon game, and when you finish the last era and look upon a complex maze of track and signals and dozens of trains, you feel a real sense of accomplishment. 

Currently as of Sep 1, 2019 I rank it a 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087598427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1567332929}
review:
Game tries to be something more than it really is. It's being advertised as a complex train tycoon game. But in fact it is a simple sandbox which is rough on the edges, with very simple gameplay and core game mechanics which is not working well. Pathfinding and signaling doesn't work well, trains often stuck even with signals placed. Waypoint placing doesn't work. No story mode only sandbox with simple fetch quests. Also the UI looks like from the 90s and really is user unfriendly. 
I can't recommend this game. I would have refund this game if not the fact I bought it 2 months ago. 

If you want to play a good and modern train tycoon game, go and buy Railway Empire which has much more depth that this game and is well polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089234992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2132, 'last_played': 1664041388}
review: Tato hra má skvělý potenciál do budoucna.Problém je, že právě do BUDOUCNA.Čím víc je herní plocha zaplněná,tím víc problémů ve hře nastává.Hra padá,pokud postavím novou trať a propojím ji kvůli depu se stávajícími tratěmi,tak začnou vlaky rázem zmatkovat.V podstatě je nutno tratě stavět na izolovanou kyvadlovou dopravu a depa stavět pro každou trať zvlášť.Plnění ůkolů ve hře je jeden zbytečný opruz...ale i tak je hra opravdu chytlavá,ale v současném technickém stavu jsem poněkud v rozpacích ji někomu doporučovat....

author: {'steamid': '76561198087475413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1851, 'last_played': 1702208169}
review:
I don't comment very often on games - Mashinky deserves it.

Already a very enjoyable game in spite of it's alpha stage!  Have been playing just over 27 hours. Takes me back to the days of Sid Meier - Railroad Tycoon series in many ways, just with much better graphics.

I am impressed with the "Isometric" planning  vs.  "realistic mode" aspect of this simulation. Extremely well implemented so far.  The planning mode allows me to work out the logistics / locations of resources, where and how to lay track to the various cities and varied industries while  monitoring train locations and resource levels.  Even though this mode is called "Isometric", you are not locked in to one angle. You can freely rotate to any camera angle required. Has a good feel to it overall. 

 The "realistic mode" is the highly detailed world that looks very good so far. I enjoy hopping on one of the trains and watching the world go by while admiring the detail of the locomotives and the towns and industries.

The game mechanics are a bit simplistic with track layout in some aspects (compared to other modern train sims), but doesn't detract from the quality of game play in my opinion. I can't decide if this is a "feature" or a "work in progress".

Impressive amount of mods for a game at this stage. Should be interesting to see what the modders come up with.

Overall this is an amazing game / sim with very much potential.  More polish than I've ever seen in an alpha stage program on Steam thus far. No buyer's remorse at all and with no discounts!  This is the kind of developer I am happy to hand my hard-earned cash to!

To the DEVELOPERS:  This game quality is what I hope for when looking for new game but rarely expect to find.  Pleasantly surprised! I look forward to seeing this game's progress with great anticipation! Amazing!

This is the sort of developer that deserves support from the community in my opinion!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974937902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1297, 'last_played': 1622307967}
review: I don't usually buy early access games, but I'm glad I got this one. Mashinky is a highly playable game as of August 2019, and it's fun to try and connect the various goods chains. The developer admirably keeps updating the game on a very regular basis, and the Steam Workshop already contains a nice selection of mods you can use in-game. Worth your support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251597496', 'num_games_owned': 6804, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1564275720}
review:
我很難對這款遊戲作出壹個系統的評價，就如同我不能在賞花時評價土裏的新芽。
說好，無疑是好：他的視角轉換非常酷炫，只要輕輕壹按就能從規劃者的身份轉換到旁觀者，從2D的圖紙中躍出看到3D的鐵路帝國；妳甚至可以跟隨火車，乃至轉到駕駛室的視角，體驗壹把自動駕駛瀏覽萬裏風光的癮；雖然有著火車原地掉頭等問題，但是起碼在這方面問題不大。景色很漂亮，BGM很魔性，隨著時代改變解鎖新資源的系統很有趣。
說差，那……更是有的說了。“現在讓我們在‘--未定義文本--’和‘--未定義文本--’之間開始運送旅客吧”——第壹次看見這個文案我楞是傻了壹分鐘。而這種文本問題就不提了，新手教程裏甚至還有指示錯誤。即使完全不提這些BUG，遊戲的新手教程也是極不合格的——它真的就只教妳了調視角，建鐵路，開動火車——沒了？信號燈這個問題，真的是誰玩誰知道。如果妳不想費心費力地在壹句話提示都沒有的情況下去研究信號燈怎麽掛才能讓火車有序通過，那我建議妳不要讓鐵路交叉，壹個都不要。我知道這很蠢，但是這是現階段最好的解決方法了，我說真的。
簡而言之，如果妳打算去玩壹款完善的鐵路模擬經營遊戲，《Mashinky》絕對是排不上號的。但是如果妳期待他的未來，或許可以嘗試壹下這款遊戲。它現在應該說是壹個漂亮的框架，潛力無窮但是仍待打磨，畢竟，STEAM頁面的EA可還掛著呢。

[quote]點擊加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/itgameap]趣遊鑒賞組[/url]，一同探索遊戲的樂趣~ 歡迎關註[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34803254/]趣遊鑒賞家[/url]，查看更多趣味性評測。 
讓我們用愛點亮遊戲之光，加入我們，共同感受更多趣味的遊戲吧！[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198160693238', 'num_games_owned': 10610, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1563782787}
review:
再次感谢好友@moupflowers的评测邀请，让我有机会能够体验这款非常感兴趣的佳作
[quote]
加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ADZZW#]爱の榨汁屋[/url]&关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34815366/]爱の鉴赏家[/url]，用爱品鉴世间作品，用心流淌真情实感。
[/quote]

[h1] 前言 [/h1]
《mashinky》是一款以铁路为主题的模拟经营类游戏，相比较于同类型游戏本作最大的特点莫过于2d/3d模式的一键转换，能够让玩家在2d模式下体验到对比同类型游戏更加方便快捷的管理和建造，同时也保留了3d模式下玩家尽情欣赏自己铁路帝国运转的乐趣。现阶段游戏还存在不少问题，不过总体来说体验尚可，未来潜力可期。


[h1] 游戏体验 [/h1]
游戏目前仅支持单人经营模式，玩家要从头开始运营自己的公司，经历多个时代的发展并维持自己公司的发展壮大。
过程中游戏会包含如下几种类型的任务：
教程任务：指引类任务，主要是让玩家了解某些功能的使用
沙盒任务：地图内随机生成的小任务，提供给玩家资源
事件任务：类似“主线任务”，周期长，回报大
时代任务：类似文明的发射火箭这种阶段性胜利任务，完成后会推动游戏内的时代发展，从而解锁新的车辆工具等。
从流程和各项操作上来看，本作大致属于“大亨”类模拟经营游戏，即让玩家充分体验在某一特殊领域成为巨头公司的乐趣。相比较于同类型游戏复杂的子级菜单和层层叠叠，让新手不知所措的复杂操作，本作在这方面严格来说...并没有太多长进，这类型游戏吃玩家耐心的地方也就在于此，除非做成毫无策略深度和模拟写实度的“小游戏”，否则只能让玩家来逐渐熟悉和适应游戏本身的操作..

当然，本作对于普通玩家来说，有一项堪称“必杀技”的出色设定，那就是2d/3d的转换功能，玩过这类游戏的玩家都应该知道，在3d视角下反复拖动摄像机，转动角度寻找合适的位置放置建筑物是一件多么痛苦麻烦但是又无法避免的事情，而本作的2d3d转换则近乎完美的解决了这个问题，玩家在建筑时可以非常轻松地按一下空格键进入2d模式，整个地图会瞬间以清爽的“格子”状铺设在你面前，无论线路规划还是选择建筑物地址都异常的清晰简单。而在进行完建设之后，我们又可以简单的再次按一下空格回到3d页面，尽情欣赏自己所规划的铁路帝国。可以说完全保留了“欣赏”乐趣的同时又大大增强了玩家在建筑和规划时的便利性，称得上是一次十分出色的创新。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1811180188
（事实上比起勉强合格的3d画面，简单清新的2d反而更让我觉得舒服..）
另外，本作还在近期的更新中加入了“坐火车”模式，即在玩家选择特定的火车后可以以第一人称进入坐在火车上的观光模式，虽然本作的画面称不上有多么优秀，但这种相对写实的摄像机视角依旧能给玩家带来一定程度的享受，特别是自己耗费许久规划好了一条艰难的跨山铁道，完成后自己坐上火车，跟着慢悠悠的穿行过自己打造的隧道...这种感觉对于代入感较高的玩家来说是非常让人沉醉的
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1811756389

当然，游戏里个人体验比较诡异的一点是.游戏中加入了很多塑造气氛的音效，例如马蹄声，人们交谈行走的声音等等，但是在3d模式下你去这些城镇逛是一个npc都看不到的，只有建筑，体验非常诡异..一边听着热闹的声音一边看得是啥也没有的街道..

另外在游戏过程中还遇到了一个小bug需要大家注意下：
初始教程部分，当玩家建造好铁路站和铁路后，下一步需要建立维护站以购买火车，但文本中给出的提示却是要玩家点击“站台”，这个明显是错误的，点击站台左边的维护站标志即可进行下一步
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1811756334

[h1] 优 [/h1]
1.独特的2d/3d转换，布置建造页面变得更加清爽舒服的同时依旧保留了让玩家尽情欣赏自己建筑的乐趣
2.整个游戏历程包含了多种类型的“时代”（并且制作者承诺未来会更新到7种不同的时代），丰富度很高
3.出色的创意工坊支持
4.坚持7年的开发代表着作者肯定不会放弃对这款游戏的打磨，虽然更新速度算不得快，但未来几乎可以确定制作者一定会实现自己的承诺，未来非常值得期待
5.加入了“坐火车”模式，没事可以看风景挂机

[h1] 遗憾 [/h1]
1.非常糟糕的中文翻译质量，机翻+大量未翻译文本，随处可见“未定义文本”这类莫名其妙的文本显示
2.字体太小，而且模糊，即使大屏幕下看着也很难受，而且部分文本采用了与提示框同样的配色，肉眼很难看清楚
3.新手指引部分太过于简单，仅仅展示了最为初级的操作，大量游戏过程中的重要常用功能都需要玩家自己在游戏中摸索，对于耐心不足的玩家来说很容易劝退
4.Bgm比较贫瘠，虽然听起来还不错但这种游戏通常游玩都是几个小时起，一直听那几个循环太容易腻味了，建议还是开启网易云歌单吧..
5.UI布局个人感觉并不是很舒适，几乎全部的操作按键都堆积在屏幕中下方，使用上十分繁琐，至少退出，存档这类型的功能应该转移到右上方啊..

[h1] 总结 [/h1]
目前来说，本作作为一款铁路模拟类游戏，大致的游戏框架十分完整，基础操作部分也保证了“扎实”，同时较为创新且体验上佳的2d/3d转换也让本作对比同类型作品有自己额外的竞争力。总的来说，现在购买本作已经可以获得非常不错的游戏体验，不过本作目前的更新进度还不算特别快，大量承诺的内容依旧处于开发中状态，玩家现在入手很可能遭遇玩到没东西玩弃坑，更新新内容之后又懒得回来玩的状态。所以个人在推荐上也比较纠结..不过对于国内玩家而言，目前阶段本作最大的问题就是中文体验实在太差，文本在翻译质量，显示，配色，字体上都有很大的问题，严重影响游玩的乐趣，建议各位等待几个版本的更新，到内容进一步丰富+中文体验上升后再行购入

author: {'steamid': '76561198134146269', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1624183206}
review:
[h1]Einleitung[/h1]

Ihr steht an der Spitze eures eigenen Eisenbahn Imperiums, ok ihr müsst es vorher schon noch aufbauen. Das Spiel beginnt im Dampfzeitalter und führt über die verschiedenen Epochen bis in die heutige Zeit. Neben Geld müsst ihr aber noch wechselnde Rohstoffe verdienen. Nur könnt ihr den Wechsel in die nächste Epoche schaffen. Lasst euch dafür aber nicht zu viel Zeit, die Uhr tickt!

[h1]Lets Play Folge 01[/h1]
https://youtu.be/C9dCwcUt-0I
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Die Karte, auf der gespielt wird, kann nach belieben angepasst werden. Neben der Geländebeschaffenheit lässt sich natürlich auch einstellen, wie viele Städte es denn geben soll. Mashinky erstellt bei jedem Spielstart auch eine neue Karte, aufgrund der geringen Ladezeiten kann man da etwas experimentieren.

Gleich von Beginn  an gilt es verschiedene Missionen zu erfüllen. Das Spiel unterteilt die zu erfüllenden Aufgaben nach Wichtigkeit ein. Die Aufgabe des Epochenwechsels ist natürlich eine Pflichtaufgabe. Das Tutorial abzuschließen steh dem Spieler aber frei. Je nach Schwierigkeit der Aufgabe gibt es entsprechende Belohnungen. Diese reichen von Geld über Rohstoffe bis hin zu Lokomotive oder Wagons.

Im Spiel können alle Gebäude, wie Bahnhöfe, Lokschuppen und Fabriken verbessert, bzw. erweitert werden. Dadurch kann, die Produktion gesteigert und der Gewinn maximiert werden. Wie schon angesprochen gibt es neben der Standardwährung Geld auch noch verschiedene Rohstoffe, im Spiel Token genannt. Ohne Token geht im Spiel nichts, hier muss die Produktion also immer im Auge behalten werden. Benötigt werden sie für Loks, Waggons und eben Gebäudeerweiterungen.

Besonders wichtig sind hierbei Kohle und Treibstoff Token. Denn wer hätte es gedacht, die Züge kosten, je nach Epoche und Leistung, entsprechend Unterhalt. Hier sollte man also auf die Produktion achten. Sollte der Vorrat nicht ausreichen, wird die Leistung der Loks reduziert, es ist also kein Weltuntergang.

[h1]Kurzinfo[/h1]

[b]Positiv[/b]
[b]+[/b] durch das Tokensystem hebt sich Mashinky von der Masse ab
[b]+[/b] sehr kurze Ladezeiten
[b]+[/b] einfacher Baumodus im Transport Tycoon Stil
[b]+[/b] Rohstoffe werden für Kauf und Unterhalt benötigt
[b]+[/b] optisch ansprechender Jahreszeitenwechsel
[b]+[/b] unterstützt Steam Workshop

[b]Negativ[/b]
[b]-[/b] die Musik ist zum abschalten
[b]-[/b] neue Fabriken erscheinen erst bei Epochenwechsel
[b]-[/b] das Spiel unterstützt keine Brücken

[h1]Wertung[/h1]
[*][b]Musik/Sound: 4/10[/b]
Wie schon erwähnt kann man die Musik nur abschalten, der Sound hingegen ist passend aber auch nicht überragend.[/list]
[*][b]Grafik 8/10[/b]
Der Baumodus ist einfach und übersichtlich und die normale Ansicht sieht besser aus als bei den meisten anderen Spielen des Genres.[/list]
[*][b]Spielspaß 8/10[/b]
Nach einer kurzen Einarbeitungszeit geht das Spiel ohne Frustmomente von der Hand. Es macht Spaß das Maximum aus einer Linie zu kitzeln und immer wieder auf einer neuen Karte zu spielen.[/list]

[h1]Fazit[/h1]

Mir persönlich gefällt es sehr gut, das Mashinky einen extra Baumodus hat. Dadurch wird das verlegen von Gleisen doch sehr vereinfacht. Ein weiterer Pluspunkt ist die Verwendung der Token. Da wo es bei anderen Vertretern des Genres nur darum geht Rohstoffe zu transportieren, werden diese bei Mashinky für Erweiterungen oder als Treibstoff benötigt. Die Musik lässt sich, Gott sei Dank, abschalten oder auch ersetzen. Dies trübt den Spielspaß also nicht!

[h1]Achtung EA Titel![/h1]
[*][b]Testzeit: ca. 7 Stunden[/b][/list]
[*][b]Version: 03.07.2019[/b][/list]
Zum Testzeitpunkt lief das Spiel ohne Abstürze oder Bugs. Allerdings sind noch nicht alle Epochen enthalten. Somit fehlt also noch etwas vom Spielinhalt.

[Quote][b]Hat dir diese Review gefallen? Dann zeig es doch mit einem Like oder einem Kommentar. Mehr Reviews wie dieses findest du auf meiner [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34574724/]Kuratorenseite für Early Access Spiele[/url].[/b][/Quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039827211', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1562735921}
review:
[quote=]
[h1][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36376191]点击这里关注我的鉴赏家 ▲

老K的游戏购买指南▼[/url][/h1]这是款铁路题材的模拟经营游戏。玩家在游戏中经营一家铁路运输公司，玩家可以自由编组车辆通过运送乘客和货物来为公司赚取利润。

相比同题材游戏，本作最大特点是可在2D和3D模式中无缝自由切换，玩家可以在2D直观的四边格下建设，在3D丰富细节表现下品味建设成果。加上精简的财务数字和操作步骤让玩家能快速理解游戏玩法，游戏的经营建设体验可以说是近年铁路题材游戏中最好的。

游戏为1人独立制作，虽然发布许久但截至目前（19/7/9）依然只有单机沙盒模式，并且也无法添加AI对手与玩家在地图上竞争，导致游戏内容有些重复 。

但作者承诺了未来的更新计划且更新频率较高，对地图编辑和创意工坊也持非常开放的态度，相信游戏未来可期！

PS：虽然没有显示在语言栏，但游戏已经加入了中文！
 [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198037011996', 'num_games_owned': 10159, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1562691387}
review:
Mashinky - это отличная железнодорожно-экономическая стратегия в жанре Tycoon.
Игра создана силами одного единственного чешского разработчика по имени Jan Zeleny, но по своему масштабу и уровню детализации может сравниться с крупными проектами по типу Railway Empire.

Mashinky находится в раннем доступе и пока не имеет широкой известности, но однозначно стоит вашего внимания!

[h1]"+":[/h1][list]
[*] Очень детальный и хорошо продуманный симулятор транспортной империи;
[*] Развитие, которое выражается в форме эпох и возможности улучшения фабрик, поездов, станций и т.д.
[*] Стабильность, отсутствие "вылетов". Довольно неплохая оптимизация;
[*] Простая, но приятная графика; 
[*] Возможность работы с рельефом;
[*] Активное развитие игры силами разработчика: добавление контента, исправление багов, реализация пожеланий сообщества, добавление локализаций и т.д.
[/list]

[h1]"-":[/h1][list]
[*] Не очень прозрачная и не очень развитая экономическая система.
[*] Отсутствие конкурентов (ИИ). Разработчик обещает реализовать мультиплеер и это должно решить проблему.
[*] Хотелось бы больше погодных эффектов, добавления природных катаклизмов, крупных экономических и политических событий.
[/list]
Здесь не учитываем мелкие недоработки, неточности перевода, ограниченное количество эпох и другое, - игра ведь в раннем доступе.

Mashinky - очень перспективный Tycoon, бережно поддерживаемый разработчиком.
Попробовав один раз, можно увлечься надолго. 7,5/10.

review: Schon jetzt ein sehr gutes Spiel. Erinnert an Klassiker wie Railroad Tycoon. Und macht auch genau so süchtig. Spiel bekommt regelmäßig neue Updates. Nur neue Inhalte dauern meistens etwas. Aber das warten ist es wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015991447', 'num_games_owned': 2649, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1654617590}
review:
So, I've been playing for 2 hours so far. 
And it's a great game. Reminds me of Railroad Tycoon back on the PS1.
Anyway, there's a few things I'd like to see in future updates.

1. A sense of life, civilians moving around towns. The world besides the trains themselves is extremely static.
2. Passengers and goods actually building up on platforms. (Harks back to point 1.)
3. Towns actually evolving, getting bigger as you progress onwards.
4. Slightly better UI. It took me a good 20 minutes to work out how to put carriages on trains. It meant for the first
attempt that none of my trains were carrying anything which confused me.
5. Competitors. The game is great, but, with some AI it would be even better.
6. Perhaps some rail that's dual linked and larger platforms. So, you can have more than just 1 rail line per station.
7. ...that's all I can think of for now.

So far it's a really great game, just needs a bit more. 
Will update in future as time goes on and the game gets further updates etc.


EDIT:
So, played more and I still quite enjoy the game. But, the lack of life within the game does
break my immersion quite considerably still.
I've not tried the cars as yet. But, I've seen them and they are pretty cool to look at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028936322', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2098, 'last_played': 1697272895}
review: I have lots of fun building railways.  The only downside I have seen is when you go to a new age and have to redesign it because a new resource has popped up and you need it to progress further.  I wish there was a way to see where all the resources are going to be so I can plan my railway a lot more efficiently and have to send less time ripping up rails to make it work better.
developer_response:
Thanks! For some players, this new era & redesigning of your network acts as a solid gameplay mechanic, but I understand your thoughts.

This could be easily solvable by playing some of many custom maps either prepared by us, or by talented modders on a steam workshop - use MAPS filter (each industry is placed manually to some reasonable map location), or you can optionaly check specific placement by loading any scenario in the editor first.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994658672', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2079, 'last_played': 1666167722}
review: Купил игру ещё по предзаказу, когда было всего 2 эпохи. Сейчас в игре их 6 и можно сразу апнуться до нужной. Разработчик(Ян) уволился из компании, где трудился раньше и бросил все силы на этот проект. Будем подождать, оптимизацию завезли, но одни и те же карты надоели...

author: {'steamid': '76561197983985361', 'num_games_owned': 1656, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1606792271}
review:
This is the perfect sandbox transport game, IMO. There are objectives with every era, but you can make your own goals and play the game as you want. For example, I love watching cities grow and will go FAR out of my way to stay in the second era and just watch my cities grow.

Building huge loops to ensure efficient industry supply is also possible, then later delivering goods to towns, but you can avoid that if you want.

This is not the replacement for OTTD. It's just a different kind of game, more like a board game. This is not railroad tycoon, either. It's really its own thing. Every time I see that an update is available, I get back into it for hours upon end. I can't recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048622568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 49520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26854, 'last_played': 1689382614}
review: Skvělý český simulátor (transport tycoon), velmi komplexní, i když stále ve vývoji. Nádherná funkční grafika, mnoho vývojových etap se spoustou vláčků a vagónů. Do budoucna mají přibýt další druhy dopravy. Pomalý růst měst závislý na dodávkách potřebného. Dva různé vizuální módy - jeden stavební, druhý 3d-echberoucí :o) Hra má skutečně vymakaný systém stavění tratí po políčkách, semafory, směry jízdy, vlaky neustále prověřují průjezdnost trasy. Chvíli trvá, než člověk pochopí tento komplexní systém stavění. Ale složité to není... Have fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198240675248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2608, 'last_played': 1627145343}
review:
Great game for all train and logistic fans 
My first gameplay was on the largest map (which is not recommended for beginners , but I'm not a beginner ) and I absolutely enjoyed that , in fact like 80% of my recorded time is from that one gameplay , already have like hundreds of trains , stations and depots and still plenty to build , connect , tunnels there , bridge here and so on :) 
Best is my biggest train route which connects like 10-15 cities and just watching that road from cabine is simply amazing , you can build decorations like trees so scenery around routes can be even more lovely 
game is still in development so more features will come lately but in this state , respect to Jan for his amazing work so far ! 
Deffinitely worth your money

author: {'steamid': '76561198103039014', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 37230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11336, 'last_played': 1695155530}
review:
Manažerských her s vláčky tu bylo už dost. Mashinky jsou však jedinečné svým spojením videohry s mechanikami deskovek. Musím především pochválit skvěle promakaný engine a inteligenci, jejíž pathfinding mě až zaráží svou genialitou. Je také skvělý princip rozdělení dvou módů - stavěcí a kochací. Vypíchnou se také musí možnost stažení komunitního obsahu z worshopu.
Hra má ještě své mouchy, ale jsou to spíše mušky, které v předběžném přístupu musí každý tolerovat!
Až to bude hotové, bude to bomba. Osobně se těším na multiplayer.
Pro milovníky vláčků a stavění a logistiky momentálně jedna z nejlepších voleb za slušnou cenu..
[b]95%[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198019935801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1642272418}
review: Я как заядлый игрок в OTTD был очень рад появлению этого проекта и очень его ждал, но попробовав понял, что это все же другая игра. Да и это только к лучшему. Игра делает больший упор на реализм, повороты должны иметь приличный радиус, что, в свою очередь, затрудняет строительство в условиях ограниченного пространства. Классная игра, не хватает множества семафоров как в OTTD, один комбинированный - маловато.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974396757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 16064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8031, 'last_played': 1688978087}
review:
Excellent game still in development, yet already more complete then some so called "finished" products. 

Most annoying thing is lack of pathing / path signals, however can be worked around. 
* Pathing has been fixed

Best thing is seeing how many trains you can jam through a single station without a single train jam. 

Would love to see the ability to effectively start in a complete sandbox, but sure it will come. 

Guy making this just keeps adding more, was not expecting more error's & road vehicles, or terrain help tools - but boom there they are! perfect game for "easy to use" but hard to master type gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198050002564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9597, 'last_played': 1621565917}
review: I got this game from near the beginning and loved it.  It is the most fun I have ever had on any game. Great concept and procedural game growth. The ONLY drawback that I can see is that with all the new industries that are added as you progress through the game it will not be long before space becomes a rare commodity. What this game now needs is the option of a much bigger map to play on. If you love riding trains and tooting train horns then this is a must have game for you. The problem solving is mostly a fairly easy exercise and enjoyable. I am an older pc gamer having started in the old win 95 era and am over 60 now. I got tired of games where the more money you throw at a game the better chance there is to win. That concept is for losers IMHO. I much prefer a game where achievement is its' own reward. And this game delivers very well. Even taking SS for your wallpaper is great. Keep it coming Jan and Please Please can we have a much bigger map to play on? Thank you in advance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963602169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1615237496}
review:
In one sentence: If you love Transport Tycoon or Railroad Tycoon, then you will love it!

Pro: 
- You can switch from classic mode to modern 3D mode 
- You can drive in first person in your trains (Best feature! I always wished this for TTD)
- Time periods with increasing industrial demands
- Nice variety of trains
- Nice ressource system 

Con:
- Menu optics not always nice. Buttons often hidden
- Often there are too many subfolders or secondary menus
- Pathfinding of railroads can be frustrating

Overall this is a very nice game for this price. You feel, that this is early access, please do not expect a finnished game. BUT, for tycoon building fans this is already a must buy! I will spend tons of time in this awesome game! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198028730138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1696969938}
review:
Good:
A very well made game. Lots of attention to details.
The game mechanics/train management complexity is high level and might end up competing with openTTD 

Bad:

Music gets annoying pretty quickly.

No AI

Bottom line:

author: {'steamid': '76561197972056778', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1670666957}
review:
Guten Tag, Freunde des gepflegten Spielvergnügens!

Mashinky vom tschechischen Entwickler Jan Zelený, vertrieben von Jan Zelený, designed von Jan Zelený, supported von Jan Zelený.

Was soll ich sagen, das ist mal ein richtig ambitioniertes Projekt eines einzelnen Entwicklers. Hut ab! 

Haltet Euch fest, bereits nach 3 Stunden Spielzeit bin ich voll des Lobes. Tolle Umsetzung, einfache, intuitive Spielmechanik, hübsche Grafik und ein klassisches Level-System in dem man durch die erfüllten Aufgaben und ins nächste Bahnzeitalter wächst.

Den Update- u. Verbesserungseingaben aus der Community nimmt sich Jan Zelený fliessend an - liebe Freunde - was will man mehr? Falls einem aus dem Standard-Spiel das ein oder andere Prefab nicht zusagt, der Steam-Workshop hält tausende schöne Bauteile, Züge und Waggons parat. 

Preis/Leistungsverhältnis ist Bombe.

Klare Kaufempfehlung für Freunde des Eisenbahnverkehrs und guter Strategiespiele!

Macht's gut!

Euer Survivalstevie!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975605174', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8088, 'last_played': 1689598804}
review:
If you have ANY fun in playing transport games like Transport Fever and Transport Tycoon you simply have to give this one a try.

Although several features are still missing it is already one of the- if not THE best transport tycoon game I have ever put my hands on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042473562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1647120524}
review:
The game looked fun and I thought it would be fun, but I just can't get into it.   The world seems dead.  I get that it is early release and features have yet to be added, but for me the game is e - chloroform.  Nothing is happening that even makes me want it to get better or completed.  One of those games that make me wish that if you try an early access game you can refund it up until release.  This game is a big reason why I stopped buying games in early release.

The game itself is glitchy in spots.  There have been several times where I find that the tutorial quest stages do not advance properly.  Also have noticed problems with spelling.  Not a fan of not being able to go beyond a 512x512 map.  Trains need to be more customizable.  It looks bad to have a train with a Colorado railroad name driving into Koln.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218240912', 'num_games_owned': 11214, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1560338825}
review:
Erken erişimde olmasına rağmen mükemmelliğini koruyan nadir oyunlardan diyebilirim.

Oyunda aslında yaptığımız şey tren ile yük taşımak ya da yolcu taşımacılığı da diyebilirim, Büyük bir haritaya sahip olan Mashinky'nin gerçekçi bir haritası mevcut ama tek tuşla 2d bir haritaya geçiş yapabiliyorsunuz. Alıştırmayı tamamladıktan sonra sizden ilk istediği şey yolcu taşıma hattı kurmanız aslında oyunun şu an için eşi benzeri yok diyebilirim ve güvenle alıp oynamanız gereken oyunlar arasında olduğunu söyleyebilirim.

Oyun erken erişimden çıktıktan sonra daha ne kadar güzelleştirilebilir bilmiyorum ama 39.00 TL ile alabileceğiniz en güzel oyun olabilir.

Oyun incelemeleri yaptığımız küratör sayfamızı takip edebilirsiniz, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32620391/] MoonStarGaming Küratör[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198004579630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1666866661}
review: Excellent game! The successor to TTD and Chris Sawyers' Locomotion that I've been waiting for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002652436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1634921938}
review:
What a great little game already, even in Early Access!

I've not really tried this genre before, City Skylines aside, as my usual taste is Football Manager and the Paradox grand strategy games, but this has been sat on my Wishlist for ages so looking for something different I took the plunge. 

I am so glad I did. 

The concept is so simple, yet can become complicated and very busy quickly but the game really builds you up slowly in an intuitive way which just works so well for me. 

Stunning artwork, a lot of fun and the hours skip by. What more does a man want or need!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969907665', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1560545632}
review:
Well isn't that a pleasant surprise, i have a couple hundred hours in TTD, Transport Fever and similar games and play those on and off over 20 years now.

Mashinsky has an extremely good interface and is just so much simpler in many regards that i'm wondering why noone else had these ideas before. The fact that you can build the way you build stations here is so much easier and convenient, the tracklaying works, signals are working out of the box, it's just in general slick. You built a train with just 2 stations ? Don't bother with giving it orders, it's gonna do the right thing automatically, just send it on it's way (opposed to most games where you have to click stations together).

The economy is also very cool, just because you have money doesn't mean you can buy everything, some of the advanced trains actually require you to have other ressources in stock, which turns the one dimensional game of the other games (either you have money or you dont) on the head.

There are some very advanced features missing but overall this is very close to replace my favourite logistics games. Good flippin job, the 92% ratings of this are very well deserved, i didn't hear about it before and thought it's possibly another generic railway game. If you love these kinds of games, play it for 20 minutes and you'll know what i mean.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013132245', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 11534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1697307287}
review:
I absolutely recommend this game.  It is a must-have for any railroad enthusiast.

- BEGIN FALSE STATEMENT -

Mashinky won't currently let you implement this (awesome) scenario of 2 city depos that have 4 tracks each and 7 trains total:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1662083305

It's impossible with the current signalling, and most players implement unidirectional "to" and "from" parallel tracks across long distances - they never set up a single track that can run in both directions, because the current switches always eventually get 2 trains stuck facing each other due to race conditions.

BUT - if I had to bet on a railways sim that will eventually be capable, my bet would be on Mashinky, as it comes very close to getting it right.

Sections of tracks are separated into "blocks" as block semaphore signals are placed, which are recommended they be unidirectional.  Well then how did Sid Meier figure it out?  I don't know!  In SMR those signals are generated automatically whenever you add sidings!

In Mashinky, no signals are automatically generated and it's up to you to come up with a working scheme.

Here's my attempt, but it still runs into more than one train getting into the same block - so far it seems you really can only have one entrance and one exit for any given block, so that's why everyone uses unidirectional.  I can hardly hold this against the game:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1764140175

Even if they never figure it out - the game has a certain engineering purity that I really appreciate.  The UI is a little odd, but so far the gameplay has left me with no regrets, and I'm fairly certain this will long be my "go to" rail sim.

- END FALSE STATEMENT - 

UPDATE:
I am really happy to see that with the automatic signals and with the trains eventually timing out and reversing after being frozen long enough - all these jams never persist for very long, and you don't have to go in with a bulldozer anymore, at least not in this test scenario!  BRAVO!!!

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2127691282

I can just watch this for... well not for hours.. but minutes certainly!  It's quite mesmerizing.  It feels like a real train layout in your basement.  I am thoroughly tempted to make such a thing some day,  now that I've been hooked by this game.

It's also enough to just take the game as it is - there is a lot of enjoyment to be had here, and it still behaves very autonomously (unlike AHEM I'M LOOKING AT YOU THE RAILROAD SIM WHO SHALL NOT BE NAMED)...  Oh... sorry... excuse me:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1764420823

------ 

Stamps in Workshop:

What else?  Well, the granular map using square tiles that can be angled in altitude, and the track laying designed around these tiles allows for publishing stamps on the workshop.  Or downloading stamps other people have published and learning what you think of the design.  I spend a HUGE amount of time thinking about how to publish these stamps, and looking at other people's designs.  Here's my favorite so far:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2273168354

This feature of workshop stamp sharing is exclusive to Mashinky - I haven't seen it anywhere else in a railroad game, though it resembles Railroad Tycoon 2 (which had the same tiling, just no workshop support).

author: {'steamid': '76561197999978438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2689, 'last_played': 1589038255}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965637100', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1558050414}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128470023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1619047623}
review:
Fantastic...I already sense this one will be a classic.  (Expanded review after 12+ hours of gameplay)

Frankly, I think the game designer is a genius. He has maximized the good*...fun trains, the feelings of satisfaction when you set things up well, and when you accomplish missions, etc., and minimized the silly hassles.  He has even managed to make the time pressures not hurt that much. 

I am almost always pausing RTS games in that I feel like I'll miss something if I don't, or I don't have enough time to get everything done. Somehow, that concern is not present here. Usually, I avoid games that deal in complexity because of the various kinds of hassles that arise.  I've been playing video games since DOOM in 1994, and Civ II was my first RTS game with compounding complexity.  Since then, I tend to avoid RTS games because of the hassles from bad design, balance, etc. So it might be saying something that I feel that I can manage the complexity of this game without too much effort. For me this is a rare treat. 

*Here are some specific examples illustrating why you should give this game a try:

1. Very easy to add tracks and signals, and remove them. Hassle factor is minimal.

2. Vital tracklaying feature:  You can add, then delete, track as much as you want until you get it right, and are charged only for the final layout. There was another, similar game that I won't mention here, that was difficult to get the track right...and if you deleted anything you didn't get any money back.  I thought, what good is a computer tool if it doesn't help you find a workable design, but penalizes you while you try and learn how to use it? Mashinky gets this important feature right.

3. Train pathfinding is quite good, and instantaneously updates when you make track changes. When there are errors, it's almost always your fault, not the game's having a bug. There are so many ways to setup a track network, and some of them are, like my first setup, really bad!

4. The game jumps in complexity, but only when you want it to. That is, you can choose** to deliberately pay to advance to the next "era" where new trains, industries and product are available. If you like your optimized setup as it is, then you can just let it run for a while, and you can marvel at how efficiently and nicely it works.  **In settings, before starting a new game.

5. You can seamlessly (yes, really) jump from "build" view to "scenic" view, and watch a train from any angle. Even from inside the locomotive or the cars. The artwork style looks...arty, kind of like an oil painting. Pretty, naturalistic.

6. Missions actually help you improve your rail and industrial network.  I think the game senses what you ought to be doing to prepare for the future, then prompts you to find a way to do this, through missions.  Even seemingly wasteful missions have a payoff that come in the future.

7. Doesn't stutter or pause. Doesn't make my (average for 2019) video card overheat, either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963975492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2523, 'last_played': 1641969220}
review:
Pros:
Polished for an early access game, no bugs encountered. Trying to come up with efficient layout/routing and setting things in motion is fun. Graphics are pretty good, especially for what appears to be a one person effort. 

Could be improved:
Gameplay is rather repetitive. In your early game, you're establishing an base stream of income and resources and once you've got enough, the game basically is just connecting new places and moving stuff around, with some occasional remodeling to accommodate heavier traffic. I know there are people who enjoy this, but I personally need more variety and challenge to keep me engaged. 

UI annoys me at times with having to open and close everything. Would benefit a lot from a "template" feature that allows you to define a layout and place them repeatedly, like for common station and junction designs, instead of having to manually create the same thing over and over. 

Economy is simplistic. Cities grow, you can add extensions to stations and resource producers/converters, but that's it. Your ability to influence and therefore plan for future supply chains is basically nonexistent. Would like to see more complexity in this area. 

Trains are mostly straight upgrades over one another. You might settle for a train that has money upkeep instead of a resource currency, but like half of them are just deadweight. They need more differentiation in terms of top speed, acceleration, max freight, etc so there's actually a choice to make instead of spamming the highest throughput train.

review:

Previous Review -

It's ok. Nothing special yet. It needs a lot more content. I wish i knew this before i bought it because there is no real way to know until you actually try it for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043534199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4688, 'last_played': 1612043393}
review:
tl;dr: Mashinky is a great strategic game and I highly recommend it to all, not only to genre fans.

[b]Positives:[/b]
+ very addictive and well-thought gameplay
+ stunning visual presentation - simple build mode for easy orientation, excellent 3d mode for relaxing
+ able to build pretty complex things, definitely aimed towards tycoon fans

[b]Negatives[/b] (please note this is early access - probably going to improve in the future. And I still think positives are way stronger than negatives even at this point)
- lack of fuel in later stages - unlike coal, only one type of factory delivery produces diesel tokens
- passengers do not have target destinations = motivation for large networks is lower
- occassional signaling issues - adding platform choose signal would help?
- simple tunnels and bridges: editable tunels and elevated bridges with curves / or at least diagonal bridges would add more building possibilities

Thank you Jan - Keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987565903', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 3296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3066, 'last_played': 1587482938}
review:
Very enjoyable train track building / resource management game.

The concept is simple and effective. Tracks are easy to lay-out and signals can be placed and configured to direct trains towards the correct tracks. With a bit of exercise and experimentation, you can create a fully automated railway network with multi-platorm stations and bridges and tunnels where you deem necessary.

Give your trains orders to go to certain stations and, if your layout and signalling is setup correctly, the AI will make sure they pick up the right materials (if they can carry them) and deliver them where requested, using all lines available on the network.

The game starts with an easy to understand resource and industry system, but gets more complex once you unlock the next age. The key (and fun) of the game is to keep expanding your existing network, trying to supply all industry buildings with the right materials so you get the resources to build more tracks and use new and better engines and wagons.

And if you're tired of building, just hop into one of your trains and enjoy the ride. And yes, you can also blow the whistle :)

As of writing, the game is still in early access. Several ages are not yet available. Yet, it's already a fully functional game. Maps are randomly generated and have a lot of tweaking options from very flat to a map full of lakes and mountains, so there's plenty of replayability. It should also be possible to make your own maps, but I haven't tried this yet.

This is one of those games where "just a few more minutes" regularly turns into a completely different meaning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001606803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1697078775}
review:
I can't recommend this game enough if you're interested in the genre. Not only is it gorgeous to look at, but the gameplay is fun, rewarding, and unique. I have been looking for a spiritual successor to the Railroad Tycoon series for years and, so far, Mashinky is the only game that comes close. 

I loved the Railroad Tycoon franchise. Transport Fever looked really nice but fell way short in terms of its gameplay and the economic system. I feel like Mashinky combines the best of both worlds to make a really worthwhile experience. The game is just complex enough to be fun and challenging, while still being straight forward enough that it can be approached by wide audience.

If I was going to make a comparison, I would probably put the gameplay somewhere between Railroad Tycoon and Transport Fever. The former focuses more on economy and financials, whereas the second focuses on more logistics, routes, signal and track placement, etc. Mashinky employs a unique economic and progression system where the player doesn't only need to generate revenue, but also generate resources in order to advance and operate. The "build" vs "non-build" game modes is a really unique and interesting way to provide players a way to enjoy the beauty of the game away from all the HUD elements that are needed to play. I am surprised I haven't seen that used before.

The developer working on this project is very active with the community. He is completely transparent, and has provided a public road map so everyone in the community knows what direction the game is going in and the timeline for getting there. I don't usually back Early Access games anymore because I feel like too many independent developers on Steam's Early Access platform have taken advantage of backers by not delivering on their promises in one way or another. Sometimes it is features, their timeline, or seemingly abandoning their projects altogether after they make a certain amount of revenue built on the hype their game generates. I am confident this will not be the case with Mashinky and am happy I backed the project. I am already enjoying the game and have faith the finished project will be great once finished as well.

I don't have any cons about this game and am happy to give it a resounding thumbs up right now as it sits in alpha. 


PS: One thing I would like to say, which isn't a reflection on Mashinky at all, is just how unfortunate that it took this long to get Mashinky after Railroad Tycoon 3. I would also like to one day see a game that is just as in-depth financially as Railroad Tycoon was. I really enjoyed being able to run the company financials in that game-- Attempt mergers, change dividends, purchase stocks as a player, issue/buy back stocks and bonds, and even declare bankruptcy and start a new company within the same scenario. No tycoon game to date has come close to having that level of financial depth. Pop-Top Entertainment made a masterpiece with that series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038658726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2730, 'last_played': 1669149974}
review: It is a fun tyoon game with an new dimension of money and material. First you have only money to build and run trains. Then you have to get wood as an second material for build more advanced railcart and buildings. Then coal and then oil and iron. This gives the game an new way to play. All old railroad tycoon games it's all about money. It's hard at start and then the games gets pointless fast as you make more and more money with that the game gets boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025581235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5587, 'last_played': 1600764763}
review:
想到哪儿写到哪儿。（这竟然是我第一篇评测！）
先说缺点。最大的问题是抢先体验版的内容太少，虽然已经增加了一些东西，但是仍然太少！场景仍然单调，火车以及车厢贴图粗糙，想跟着火车旅行，却没有风景看。此外，桥隧不能转弯是个遗憾。
优点当然有不少。游戏相当容易上手，建设模式和欣赏风景之间的切换很有趣。风景虽然单调了些，但是毕竟还是能看一看，至少看个几分钟总是可以的，顺手还可以鸣鸣笛，过一过火车瘾。
不过优缺点不是我想说的重点……我其实是想说一说某些评测提到的“缺点”。
首先，没有中文并不是问题，真正需要“看懂”的英文很少，绝大部分时候看图就够了。
第二，我没有发现信号有什么问题。我玩的都是512*512的地图，几乎没有桥隧全是平交，也没有采用某些人建议的环形线路，就是普普通通的双线，所有的交叉路口都通过信号进行控制，并没有碰到任何问题。关键还是在于信号设置要合理，线路设置也要合理。
第三，地图上的标志看不懂、火车原地掉头会顶死、货运不挣钱……这些不予评价，呵呵一笑就好。

author: {'steamid': '76561198357677297', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1682266279}
review:
Mashinky jsou ambiciózní projekt od českého autora Jana Zeleného o přetvoření Transport tycoonu ve 3D, tak jak by si ho autor představoval. Zatím je stále v early accesu. Pokud při tomto slovním spojení vidíte červeně, mohu Vás uklidnit. Hra je plně funkční a nepůsobí nedodělaným dojmem. Ve hře jsou k datu 22.2.19 přítomny čtyři epochy z sedmi, sám autor uvedl, že poté bude čas na další druhy dopravy, na což se osobně moc těším. Pojďme si nyní rozebrat jednotlivé aspekty hry.

Začneme grafickou stránkou hry. Jan Zelený si pro hru udělal vlastní engine, který i během vývoje samotné hry nadále updatuje. Hra vypadá krásně. Má dva módy, stavící a realistický. V realistickém módu vidíte stromy, jezera, skály, hory atd. a můžete se svou tratí, jak běží v krajině. V druhém módu můžete stavět tratě, nádraží atd. na mapě rozdělené na čtverečky. Ačkoliv nemůžete vlaky přímo řídit, můžete nasednout na místo strojvůdce (je v přípravě) a nechat se vést. A je to bezpochyby krása. Můžete mimochodem i troubit. 

Jak vlastně můžete ty tratě pro své mas(h)Inky stavět? Na začátku na Vás čekají nějaké tutoriály, které vás uvedou do základu hry. Nicméně na taktiky stavení si budete muset přijít sami (nebo si prostě přečtěte nějaké Steam návody). Buďte připraveni na srážky vlaků, nebo alespoň budou proti sobě stát na návěstidle jako tvrdé Y. Ale dostanete se do toho, věřte mi. Co mi například někdy trvalo hodinu, jsem zvládl poté za 15 minut. Hra má skvělou učící křivku. Můžete stavět tratě, stanice (ve městech i u pil, lesů, uhelných dolů atd.), různé typy návěstidel, tunely, mosty, silnice (prozatím docela useless, ale to se snad změní), a další věci. Také můžete zasadit pár stromů nebo měnit terén.

Co třeba ovládání a UI? Hra se ovládá velmi příjemně a v prostoru se tak po pár minutách už rozhodně neztratíte. Mapu se můžete různě otáčet a přibližovat. V tomto jistě třetí rozměr zazáří. Hra má uživatelsky přívětivé rozhraní. Všechno je uloženo na malém, ale přehledném panelu na spodu monitoru. Můžete si spoustu věcí (např. vlaky, stanice, nebo města) rozkliknout a přejmenovat nebo vylepšit. Hudba je příjemná a velmi relaxující, ale po nějaké době se oposlouchá.

Nesmíte zapomenout, že hra je v EA. Spoustu věcí chybí. Např. multiplayer, jiné typy dopravy nebo nové epochy. Ale do hry pravidelně přibývají větší i menší aktualizace, jako ta nedávná se stárnutím vlaků. Pokud máte o hru zájem, nečekejte na verzi 1.0, protože hra zcela určitě změní cenu, a to směrem nahoru. Ale pokud lidé nemají problém se zaplacením 80 $ Ubisoftu, tak  nevidím důvod, proč nepodpořit české vývojáře za sympatických 23 eur. Však za ně dostanete tolik kontentu. 
9/10, ale pokud tvůrci dodrží slovo, nemám problém s přidáním jednoho bodu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073041865', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1591368457}
review: Отличная игра

author: {'steamid': '76561198066258609', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1672218132}
review: Stává se z toho pomalu čím dál větší pruda. S každým updatem se do hry něco přidá, což by bylo fajn, kdybyste to nemuseli hned začít povinně používat. Přidaj se elektrárny a najednou koukám, že nemám diesel tokeny. Proč? No protože můj průmysl, který je generoval, najednou potřebuje elektřinu, takže musím všude natahat dráty a samozřejmě úplně upravit infrastrukturu, abych do elektráren dovážel víc materiálu na výrobu. Už tak bylo složitý vydělávat x různých tokenů. Ze hry, kde se celkem pohodově stavěly vláčky, je opruz, kde po každém updatu musíte všechno předělávat, abyste se jakž takž uživili. Nebaví mě to! Chci stavět vláčky, ne se starat o odpadky ve městě! Zlatý transport tycoon. Tohle je tak překombinované, že to ztratilo veškerou zábavu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001679105', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 560, 'playtime_forever': 5351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1697133333}
review:
Il existe des jeux remplis de promesse mais qui peuvent décevoir finalement (comme train Fever).
Mashinky est un jeu sans grande prétentions mais qui offre une bonne gestion de trains, pas très complexe, encore assez buggé et un peu vide, mais très simple, sans être simpliste.
Le jeu est stable mais en cours de développement, donc, ne passez pas trop rapidement les époques, vous ne pourrez pas, pour le moment, avoir autre chose que du diésel.

Si vous cherchez un jeu comme train Fever mais sa vous prendre trop la tête et avec un coté gestion sympa, alors foncez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067252127', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1619720599}
review:
I really like it, my computer is not good enough to handle this game smoothly without lag so I play it in construction mode and it's still very enjoyable.  I love that you can build one-way corridors and it actually works. I also love you can build lots of extensions and build a really complex rail network that will actually work once you understand how to do it :) 

I purchased this game to support the amazing work of really talented Czech developer (as you may or may not heard, he worked on this game alone for more than 7 years alone and he really did an amazing job. 

Looking forward to new eras.
