author: {'steamid': '76561198044678395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1554203467}
review:
MOST POTENTIAL USERS WILL ASSUME MASHINKY IS IN BETA. IT'S NOT , IT IS ALPHA AND IT SHOWS. YOU MAY WANT TO THINK CAREFULLY BEFORE POTENTIALLY SPENDING YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY. DEVELOPER(S) NEED TO WORK HARDER. ALSO BE AWARE DEVELOPER COULD SUDDENLY GO ON HOLIDAY - PERMANENTLY - YES NEVER TO COME BACK - MAYBE LIVE ON A BEACH IN BARBADOS OR JOIN SPACE X ON A ONE WAY TRIP TO MARS.  THERE IS UNLIKELY TO BE AN INTERNET CONNECTION BACK TO EARTH.
LACK OF EDGE SCROLLING MAKES GAME UNSUITABLE FOR MULTIPLE MONITOR SYSTEMS. IF YOU HAVE A SECOND OR THIRD MONITOR YOU'LL FIND THE GAME MOST LIKELY UNPLAYABLE. YOU WILL NEED TO PHYSICALLY DISCONNECT MONITORS OR DISABLE THEM IN WINDOWS PRIOR TO BOOTING GAME.
NO ROBUST 2K ( DCI 2048 X 1080) SUPPORT MAKES TYPEFACE AND ICONS DIMINUTIVE, DIFFICULT TO USE, AND OF POOR QUALITY.  UI NEEDS LOTS OF WORK AND VERY BASIC. 
SINCE ITS EARLY ACCESS RELEASE IT DOESN'T APPEAR TO HAVE MOVED ON AS FAST AS ONE HAVE WOULD LIKED, GIVEN THE EXTRA FUNDS GENERATED FROM EARLY ACCESS. SO IT COULD BE YEARS BEFORE GAME IS PROPERLY FINISHED FOR GENERAL RELEASE BY WHICH TIME ELON MUSK MAY HAVE RETIRED ALONG WITH HIS FALCON 9 (NOW FALCON 64), AND THE STARSHIP IS A STORAGE SHED ON MARS.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994156561', 'num_games_owned': 1146, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2737, 'last_played': 1707826988}
review:
This expands on the train logistics gameplay of titles like OpenTTD. It goes something like this:

[list]
    [*] Connect producing station A with consuming station B
    [*] Station B also produces resources, so connect it with station C
    [*] Upgrade station C so it gets a boost production boost
    [*] The production boost needs resources from station A, so connect it up
    [*] All of your trains need resources to run, and you now have a whole bunch of trains going between stations, so... add more trains to get those resources!
    [*] Oops, there's a deadlock. A train can't leave the station, because the exit track loops around and crosses over the entrance track, and there's trains on both the entrance and exit tracks.
    [*] Resolve the deadlocks, add trains, and repeat until your network is saturated and the stations cannot produce/consume any more.
    [*] Add another station to accept the extra resources.
    [*] Add more stations to produce more resources for the new consuming station...
[/list]

The addition of resource tokens is a great mechanic, it encourages you to keep delivering as many resources as possible, it's a great gameplay loop. Compare it to other titles, where you're only limited by money, which becomes easy to acquire.

I end up spending most of my time in the "build" view, so the pretty graphics are wasted on me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071527849', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1507400550}
review:
Honestly, I've give my best hopes for this game and it's developer(s). But seeing that with every update it's getting things like "water shaders", "acacia tree", "new terrain" and other sheat.. Those hopes are crashed like I've bought some EA seasonpass and see their new DLCs. This game is in early access and it would be forever, because developers either don't want to actually develop or don't have experience to understand what's really importand and what's not. Gameplay is barely for a few hours, complexity is slightly above some shooter, modelling is good, but it's not what for I love management games, it's something that could make good management game a better one. Also, ground grid is.. something that totally breaks this game's decent modelling, it's really poor developers choise in contemporary construction game, unless devs want to make something deep and complex to compensate this construction simplification (like in factorio, which doesn't make accent to graphics at all).

All in all, developers just don't have good game development experiense and I can see it in every aspect and every update, so I gave up my hope and now regret for buying this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148260954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2029, 'last_played': 1667943346}
review: In my opinion this is the best tycoon and railway builder game. Thanks to of full 3D and isometric build mode views you can fully enjoy amazing look at your trains and scenery, but in the same time time building of your railway empire is clear and eazy to understand for players who never played transport tycoon games before. Unfortunately for railway enthusiasts like me, Mashinky are designed to be more like a board game, so you can't realy build real scenarios with signals because there are only simplified block and chain signals so far. So the train behavior feels more like model railway, but hopefully new signals will be added to the game or modded by community. So I can recommend this game to anyone interested into trains, railway building and transport tycoons at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026705354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2487, 'last_played': 1628745921}
review:
Great game. I've had pretty bad early access experiences in the past so I am very reluctant to try other EA titles. I tried this thinking I'll give it a quick go see if it meets what I'm looking for (OpenTTD meets Sid Meier's Railroads!) and if it didn't I'll just get a refund.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198029020994', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 8331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1708293851}
review:
Skvělý simulátor (nejen) mašinek.

Řekl bych, že je to vcelku hezká hra co si tu a tam bere inspiraci z různých simulátorů dopravy a přepravy materiálů.
Co je horší, je optimalizace. Při velké zátěži (víc vlaků, zastávek, průmyslu) se hra výrazně zpomaluje a padá.
Jinak je to ale solidní hra, kde se "zábava" skrývá za plánováním a optimalizacemi svých tratí.
Hru hraju na největší mapu co jde, a všechny nastavení herní plochy na "Středně", mimo vody a hor.

Na začátku přepravujete jen lidi, sem tam i dřevo nebo uhlí.
S postupem hry přepravujete poštu, ropu, železo, zboží, mimo vlaků taky auty.
Za přepravené zboží do správné budovy/nádraží utržíte odměnu ve formě tokenů:
Lidé - peníze, dřevo - token dřeva, uhlí - token uhlí, železo - token železa, atp.
Za tokeny (a peníze) se vše kupuje od kolejí, přes mašiny po vylepšení a vagóny.
Od počátků s parními mašinkami (ne sice jako v RailRoad Tycoonu, od opravdu prvních "mašin" na světě) přes dieselový, po elektrický věk, je na výběr dostatečný počet strojů.

Herní pravidla jdou trošku šulit a  ale jinak je hra vcelku vyvážená. Obtížnost je horší, protože rozdělení průmyslu (na moje "Střední") je tak sporadické, že občas nezbývá než táhnout koleje přes celou herní mapu, nebo přes značnou část mapy. Generování měst, které se vytvoří do písmena 'H' je těžké efektivně pokrýt stanicí a některé vlaky prostě odmítají jezdit společně do jedné stanice, zde nabrat cestující a zase odjet - musí se trať na chvíli přerušit a potom znovu položit.
Tutorial/některé herní questy nejdou přeskočit (Zchátralý kostel, který se vyskytne na opačném konci mapy, kam nemáte přístup vlakem, nebo v okolí není potřebný průmysl) jsou k vzteku. Silniční doprava se zdá být neuvěřitelně neekonomická, při pohledu na "spotřebu" a výsledek jejího provozu.

9/10 - jen po chvíli omrzí

author: {'steamid': '76561198314675685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 14988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5657, 'last_played': 1697383083}
review:
What can I say, I play this game more than any other game in my library. Can't wait for new content!

EDIT: I was excited to play the new updates, but the path finding has become buggy. I played two different games. In the first one, a train just wouldn't go even though it had a clear path as noted by the blue path outline. I thought that maybe it was just a glitch or it was me. So I started a new game and the same thing happened. This time the train was hanging out at the depot (for some reason). Even though there was a clear blue path outline, it just wouldn't budge no matter what I did. And I tried EVERYTHING!

FWIW, I have played this game for 240 hours plus, and even featured it on my channel years ago. So for me not to be able to figure out why a train isn't moving is just odd. 

Fix the bugs and I will recommend Mashinkey again. But for now, not a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970544416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2103, 'last_played': 1668860423}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078773953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1699821446}
review:
Have you ever yearned for a big train set where all manner of trains go chugging around a table amidst realistic scenery? Well if you can't afford one or don't have the space, then this is the game for you!
It's only early access but already there is a solid game to be had with lots of differant locomotives and wagons, and more will be added over time right up to the present day and beyond, along with more industries etc. A very nice feature are the two game modes; realistic and building (but still with moving trains). In the building map it's very easy to build new lines and stations etc. to serve commuters and industry, whereas in the realistic mode it's relaxing to just watch your trains come to life, and even jump into the cab to see what your newly constructed line looks like. 
The signalling works fine too, and if I can use it anyone can! Graphics are top notch and the game is already very stable - no problems at all. The Dev is a very open guy and keeps you informed of what he's doing and answers any questions about the future you may have. It may not be reduced in the steam Xmas sale, but it's still cheaper than another railway game that is 50% off, so you can't really complain. Buy it and support the Dev who is obviously working on a labour of love here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997201239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1708454804}
review:
[h1]Love it.[/h1] 
[b]Short version:[/b] 11/10 - greatest train tycoon/simulator ever.

[b]Long version:[/b]
I started enthusiastically with building connection between 2 cities and withou waiting other parts of industry. Ended up without money to operate trains. So started new game.

Now I was bit more caucious about how to build and where to put tracks. I made it to 2nd era, but then 3 trains crashed into each other, because I wasn't using Routes of the trains and railway signal, which makes the trains stop, when there's another train crossing. So ended this game with many complicated routes and finally without money. 

But since then I was caught on it, so next new game I was being very caucious, starting renaming each train, train station and using Routes in train menu. Now I'm entering 4th era and basically love the game! 

In conclusion - this is the train tycoon/simulator everyone wanted as small kid, so get one yourself too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198451301303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1584132073}
review: Wychowałem się na grze transport tycoon i nie mogłem przejść obojętnie obok mashinky. Po 20 godzinach gry muszę przyznać że jestem z gry bardzo zadowolony, wygląda to obiecująco. Gra zachowuje ducha swojego pierwowzoru i wprowadza ciekawe nowości, czyli te żetony, usprawnienia stacji, fabryk itd. nie mówiąc już o grafice która prezentuje się bardzo ładnie. Po ukończeniu finalnej wersji gry liczę oczywiście na wprowadzenie kolejnych środków transportu (ciężarówki, statki, samoloty). Fajnie byłoby też pograć z komputerowym przeciwnikiem (offline), a nie tylko realnym ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977146636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 2349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1666912107}
review:
Most promising Transporting Game available on PC.
But dont be put off by the word "promising". That doesnt mean the game cant deliver right now, because it can.
At the moment there are about three games of this kind available. Rise of industry, Railway Empire and Mashinky. Of all three Mashinky is already the best by design and could easily become even better once all core features are implemented.
What gives this game an advantage are several intelligent design decisions and on top the potential implementation of multiplayer.
As for multiplayer: It is planned for up to 8 players and is part of the core game concept because there is no competitive AI involved. So all the competition would come from the multiplayer anyway.
As is, the roadmap indicates that there are still a few things to come before multiplayer gets involved. It might take a while until the implementation happens, but even now the game is richer than its competitors.

Why is that? The intelligent design decisions made change a few partly fundamental aspects of these games overall. They make Mashinky a game you know and love from previous similar titles, but also a game that comes with innovations.
One of those changes to the core formula are the tokens. Every resource in Mashinky is represented by tokens. When you transport passengers, you gain money tokens, that you use to build railroads and various other things.
When transporting and successfully delivering goods like coal, wood and many more, you gain equivalent tokens of those.
You use these tokens to pay different improvements, buildings, actions or vehicles.
For example when getting into a new Era that comes with new trains you are allowed to buy those with spending coal tokens, they then also need and consume coal tokens to move on your railway.
Later in other eras/ages you get new ones that then consume other resources. Sometimes a new wagon needs you to pay with wood aswell as coal and money, or a new locomotive that runs with oil needs you to have a steady income from oiltransports.
This is basically simple, but works like a charm. 
Mashinky kind of combines several games together.

If you know Ticket to Ride, Settlers of Catan and Transport Tycoon, then you have various mechanics of those mixed together in Mashinky. The token-system basically works like getting resources as in Settlers of Catan, to spend those building or buying something new. Including station upgrades.

Another interesting feature is the camera change between building (Transport Tycoon-View) and scenery.
Further building your railway network is on one hand very well done, on the other a bit clumsy at times, because you can only build one lane per square. Not a big problem, especially when looking at Mashinky more as a real-time Boardgame rather than only a successor to Transport Tycoon.

It is rather that, which has the potential to become a very social game later with multiplayer.
But even now there is enough content to allow a few dozen hours playtime and different approaches. Its a deep game already, with a lot to do and working design. Something i cant say about its competitors that even sometimes fail at basic mechanics of the genre.
Mashinky not only successfully makes them work, but also developed them further into something special.

This game is not your generic transporting game, its a special transporting game with boardgame influences that improve the formula. If you want to get a nice game of this genre and so a bit of fresh air and a new interpretation, give Mashinky a go. I cant find anything negative about it other than it is still not finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341518576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 26959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3604, 'last_played': 1704631462}
review:
Nadejny nastupce Transport a Railroad Tycoona - navykovost je stejna :)
Nejvice ocenuji moznost nasednout do libovolneho vlaku a moznost kochat se tratemi a postupne se rozrustajici prumysl na mape, spolu kazdou novou erou, kdy prijdou i nove stroje.

Na co se tesim je multiplayer a rozsireni dopravy - v tuto chvili jsou pouze samotne vlaky, autobusy a letadla tomu trochu chybi.

Stejne tak doufam, ze do hry se vrati moznost postavit si sidlo spolecnosti, sochu majitele spolecnosti, ci nejakou tu trochu politiky mistnich zastupitelstev - uplaceni radnich, reklamni kampane, investice do rozvoje mest, prumyslu, aj. jako tomu bylo v (O)TT(D).

Na kazdy pad, vskutku slibna hra, drzim vyvojarum palce a preji ji mnoho budouciho rozvoje!

author: {'steamid': '76561198210268136', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1608465358}
review:
Většinou recenze her nepíši, ale tady udělám vyjímku. Koupil jsem si minulý týden Mashinky a jsem kvalitou hry velmi potěšen. Skvělá hratelnost a hlavně český produkt. 
Libí se mi, že i přestože mám poměrně složitou trasu z bodu A do bodu B, tak si vláček najde vždycky správnou trasu, jak jsem mu to zamýšlel. Nemusím mu tak zadávat průjezdní body. 
Ocenil bych možnost kopírovaní (ideálně i uložení) části trasy, např. složitých křižovatek nebo vlakových nádraží, a nemusel jsem je pořád dokola znova vytvářet, když jsou to většinou kopie. Ušetřilo by to dost času nebo bych mohl zkusit návrhy křižovatek jiných hráčů. 
Těším se na další aktualizaci. Dobrá práce...

The Trello roadmap published by the developer is also amazing in terms of transparency of what he will be working on in future. Take a look for yourself if you want to know what kinds of feaures the full game will have!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035852921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1786, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1711730140}
review:
Für eine Alpha Version, ist das wirklich schon ein tolles Spiel.
Es dauert ein wenig bis man die meissten Kniffe  bei der Steuerung raus hat. Toturial ist da eher wenig vorhanden, aber es jetzt nicht so das man überhaupt nichts erklärt bekommt.
Es  stört mich das für jeden Zug, den man anklickt, genau wie bei jedem Bahnhof oder Zugdepot, ein separates Fenster aufgeht, so das irgendwan fast nichts mehr vom Spiel zu sehen ist vor lauter Fenstern.
Oft klickte ich auch im falschen Fenster auf Zug wenden , da nur schwer zu erkennen ist welcher Zug gerade angeklickt ist, oder welcher Zug zu welchem Fenster gehört.
Sicher es gibt da eine Zugnummer die dem Fenster mit der gleichen Nummer zugeordnet werden kann, aber eine Optimale Lösung ist das denke ich noch nicht. Irgendwie sollte man eventuell versuchen , das durch Farben ein wenig übersichtlicher zu gestalten.
Den Modus mit der realitätsnahen Grafik benötigt man eigentlich überhaupt nicht. Ich spiele zu 98% nur im Baumodus, da es irgendwann zu unübersichtlich wird, da immer mehr Industrie etc. dazu kommt und irgendwann auch eine Menge Züge gleichzeitig am laufen sind.
Aber troz der Mängel, ist Mashinky bis jetz schon ein Spiel das mich wirklich mal wieder so fesselt, das ich 4 ...5 Std ohne zu merken wie die Zeit vergeht am PC sitze. (Das kommt mittlerweile wirklich selten vor)
Ich bin auf jeden Fall gespannt was für Verbesserungen noch kommen, und wie sich das Spiel noch weiter entwickelt.
Ich finde die 20€ ist es auf jedenfall jetzt schon wert, wenn man Spiele dieser Art mag.

ca. 1 Jahr danach.....es eist wirklich noch um einiges interessanter geworden, das Spiel , und macht immer noch spass zu spielen.
Seit dem letzten Update sind jetzt noch Autos dabei, (das ist eine tolle Idee) .Aber die neue Funktion das sich beim Signale setzen die Gleise einfärben ist ja sowas von unnötig und eher störend, fands vorher besser,aber ich könnt mit dem Käse leben wenn seit dem letzten Update Mashinky sich in unregelmässigen Abständen (zwischen 10min und einer Stunde)ins Windows verabschieden würde,wohl  z.Z. leider unspielbar auf einigen Systemen.
Schade war mein lieblingsspiel z.Z.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356651148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1638995150}
review:
A high potential game！And the same as  Railroad Tycoon. We need Chinese

author: {'steamid': '76561198126304450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1576178580}
review:
Großartig!

Für mich ist Mashinky eine schöne Mischung aus dem guten alten Transport Tycoon (natürlich nur mit Zügen) und Train Fever.
Das Umschalten zwischen Baumodus (die klassische TT-Ansicht) und dem 3D-Modus ist sehr innovativ und gelungen umgesetzt.
Die etwas andere Herangehensweise an die Finanzen mit Tokens unterscheidet dieses Spiel von den vergleichbaren anderen Spielen.
Wer solche Spiele mag, wird mit Mashinky viel Spaß haben!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030018280', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 9501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1646262825}
review:
Mashinky mag noch nicht ganz fertig sein, aber ich habe jetzt schon jede Menge Spaß damit gehabt. Mir gefallen besonders das "Mit dem Zug mitfahren", die grafische Darstellung des Baumodus (erinnert schön an frühere Spiele wie Locomotion) wie auch des normalen Ansichtsmodus.
Anfangs hatte ich noch Probleme, die Fahrtrichtung der Züge festzulegen, so dass immer wieder Züge in die falsche Richtung fuhren. Nach ein paar Stunden hab ich die Signalsetzung begriffen und dann lief's wie Butter.
Mashinky ist ein feines Spiel ganz nach meinem Geschmack :-) .

author: {'steamid': '76561198190031461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1702540331}
review:
Luxusní hra, která se může pyšnit především skvělou hratelností, fyzika hry je také na velice vysoké úrovni, ohledně grafiky tak ta tu nehraje žádnou roli, hra má neuvěřitelnou rozmanitost můžete si dělat cokoliv, zaměřit se na průmysl nebo na cokoliv jiného , hra bude mít ještě spoustu updatu hlavně v éráh lze udělat největší pokrok, počítám že hra přinese ještě hodně nového, protože i já osobně stahuju tuto hru 4-5x do roka abych zjistil co je nového a vždy u té hry strávím více a více času.

Honzo doufám že tuto hru dokončíš jako svoje mistrovské dílo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006852025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1623583541}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073601667', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1696868449}
review:
Nejdříve bych chtěl říct, že hra se stále vyvijí a roste, tudíž může být moje recenze již mimo mísu, záleží kdy jí čtete.

Mashinky čerpají z to nejlepší z tycoon strategií. V této době hra nabízí pouze jeden dopravní prostředek - vlaky. Ostatní mají dorazit časem. 

Vlaky jsou hezky propracované. Samotné rozhraní budování železnice je vzhledově velmi podobné tomu z OpenTTD, ale ihned po dostavění se dá hra opět přepnout do realistického vzhledu. Ale osobně pozoruji, že stavitelský mód téměř nevypínám. S vlakem můžete houkat, koukat se z jeho různých částí - kabina, vagony... Jednotlivé lokomotivy jsou poměrně dobře vybalancované, tedy až na tu mrchu, která lítá neskutečně rychle, jezdí na uhlí a utáhne spoustu vagónů. Stavění železnice je velice intuitivní, nenchte se odradit, ze začátku se to může jevit lehce zmatené. Je velmi zajímavé procházet jednotlivé technologické éry a postupně se učit jak pracovat se zdroji. Dále je poměrně svěží mít několik měn (peníze, tokeny dřeva, uhlí, oceli...).

Na samotné hře dělá jen několik lidí. Ale i tak je možné s autory lehce komunikovat (např. FB) a sdělit jim připomínky. Nesmím také zapomenout pochválit za viditelnou péči o tuto hru. S takovýmto přístupem se máme do budoucna na co těšit!

+ po dlouhé době nový tycoon
+ intuitivní stavba železnice
+ stavitelský/grafický mód
+ krásné modely
+ fajn úkoly
+ technologické éry
+ několik měn
+ vylepšení stanic
+ vylepšení budov
+ vylepšování měst
+ v budoucnu MP
+ na hře dělá hrstka lidí a vede si lépe než kdejaké velké studio
+ o hru se velmi pečuje

- zatím nevyutitá depa
- dočasná absence zbytku dopravních prostředků
- do oka lehce štiplavý sníh
- zatím malé mapy
- uvítal bych pouštní biom
- nemožnost bořit průmysl (měl bych na to kapitál, ale nejde mi to :D )

author: {'steamid': '76561198017901605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 7501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1614116161}
review:
Strikes a perfect form for train management games. Not too much micro or upkeep. My favorite task to get is to "take a break" and just ride around in one of my trains. Instead of fighting with shareholders, purchasing properties, and betting on stocks, this game is wonderfully simple, yet full of depth with the sole task of creating a good self-sustaining system. The economic model helps this mindset, instead of the chaotic market economies of other similiar games, the set command economy in this game allows for a less risky approach.

I'm looking forward to future development, the ability to drive the locos and workshop integration are key on my list.

Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045335016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2573, 'last_played': 1623963424}
review:
Игра понравилась, упор сделан не столько на экономической составляющей, сколько на организации логистики. Добывание жетонов скорее придаёт осмысленность проложенным маршрутам, куда большую значимость имеют правильные развязки, семафоры, интервалы между составами и их скорость. Очень порадовала функция запрета мгновенного разворота на станции, уже не получится просто соединить веткой две платформы, надо предусматривать развороты. 

Если сравнивать с TTD, то от неё игра взяла стилистику и механику прокладки путей, тут, конечно, сходство есть. Однако с точки зрения экономической модели, это разные игры. На промо ролике показан ребёнок, который играет в железную дорогу, в принципе, это отражает суть игры - прокладывание путей и запускание по ним составов. Если нужен вызов вашему менеджерскому гению, то игра не зайдёт, если хотите попробовать себя в роли логиста, то скорее всего понравится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052656459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1684524884}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003406791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2058, 'last_played': 1623086326}
review:
Wer noch die guten alten Tycoon Spiele von früher kennt, der wird mit Mashinky seine neue Liebe gefunden haben. :)

Viele Elemente aus den Transport Tycoon spielen wurde übernommen und lässt den spieler sich an die gute alte Zeite erinnern. Dank eines Tutorials findet man sehr schnell ins Spiel hinein. Das Tutorial läuft nahtlos ins Spiel über. So kann man gleich zu begin anfangen zu Planen und sein Imperium aufbauen. 
Mashinky bietet viele Möglichkeiten wie man sein Imperium aufbauen kann. Zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt ist es allerding nur mit Eisenbahn möglich. Später sollen aber noch Fahrzeuge für den Straßenverkehr dazukommen. 
Auch hat man wieder die Möglichkeit verschiedene Rohstoffe zu transportieren, die für das gesamte Spiel wichtig sind. Auch wenn ich persönlich der Meinung bin das man es hätte anders lösen können, da es schon recht nervig ist wenn zum Beispiel die Kohle oder das Öl ausgeht, und die Züge nur noch im Schneckentempo fahren, ist die Idee dahint aber echt gut. In anderen Spielen habe ich es vermisst das man einzele Rohstoffe für den Antrieb einzelner Züge oder Fahrzeuge braucht.
Es gibt jetzt schon viele Züge mit unterschiedlichen Eigenschaften. So kann man Züge mit einzigartigen Skins bekommen oder anhänger die Bonus auf Kaperzitäten geben. Gerne mehr davon.
Was mir allerdings nocht zu wenig Aufmerksamkeit bekommet, sind die zwei Ansichten, zwischen die man hin und her wechseln kann. Es ist möglich das Spiel im Baumodus zu spielen. Die Oberfläsche ähnelt dem der alten Trancport Tycoon spiele, oder aber man spiel im (ich bezeichne es jetzt mal so) Livemodus mit schöner Grafik und toller Optik. Leider bekommt man nicht alle Information nötigen Informationen in den Spielenmodies so das ich hauptsächlich nur im Baumodus spiele. 

Ich kann Mashinky nur empfehlen. Es macht einfach sehr viel Spaß und hat einen Suchtfaktor. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006860342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4797, 'last_played': 1650179303}
review:
Tak jsem za posledních 14 dní sjel všechny dostupné éry (ranná pára, páda, ranná nafta, nafta) a stále mně to baví.

Oproti jiným tycoonům zde nejsou jen peníze, ale i žetony surovin, které přepravou získáváte, a za které si můžete koupit vylepšení nádraží, továren, lepších lokomotiva později i vagónů. Žetonů budete mít stále nedostatek a tak budete stále přemýšlet, jak některé přepravní řetězce vylepšit nebo kde pospojovat další doly/továrny/města.

Navzdory prozatím krátké doby (obsahu hry) a soustředění se na železnici mohu doporučit. Vývojář se opravdu snaží své dílo přivést k dokonalosti a reaguje na nápady i hlášení chyb.

Verdikt: prozatímní 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198153511122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4585, 'last_played': 1667246171}
review:
Perfect reincarnation open TTD.
For the economic concept to be complete, passengers need to choose their destination. And developer said that he would think about that. In any case, the game is good now. In short, you build a large, complex network, and then meditate on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010128020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1650395160}
review: Pro pamětníky a fandy Transport Tycoonu je tahle hra hotovým darem z nebes. Přestože je již nějaký ten měsíc v Early Accessu, o přidávání nového obsahu v čele s dalšími érami není nouze (obzvlášť poté, co vývojář Jan Zelený odešel ze svého zaměstnání a začal na vývoji hry pracovat na "plný úvazek"). Již teď tak nabízí hromadu zábavy, jak ve stavěcím 2D modu, tak v překrásném 3D režimu, v němž můžete usednout do kabiny lokomotivy a za jízdy se kochat okolní krajinou. Ekonomický model založený na žetonech (inspirace v deskovkách) je inovativní a zajímavý a rozhodně mi ve hře nechyběly peníze jako takové. Komplexní provázanost výrobních řetězců potěšila. Podle plánů, co vše by se nakonec ve hře mělo objevit, se máme opravdu na co těšit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069365533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1542491009}
review: Первый раз вернул средства. Спустя месяц решил дать игре второй шанс. В других отзывах перечислили достаточно плюсов и минусов. Я для себя увидел один главный минус: игра скучная. Да, тут есть паровозики, чух-чух, вся фигня, даже плевать на убогую реализацию экономики, потому что она всё равно приведёт... ни к чему. Через несколько часов  я понял, что увидел в игре всё, что она может предложить. Графика тут ни к чему, да и не фанат я графики. Процесс простой до тошноты. Второй раз возвращать деньги не стал, но свои 450 рублей она не стоит. Рублей на 200 и на пару-тройку часов времени.
developer_response:
Hello, I am sorry you don't like the game and I still thank you for buying it!

If you could spend few minutes, would you please explain these issues to the email? (info@mashinky.com). I am improving the game as much as I can, but your oppinion may help me to identify issues and fix it.

Thanks!
Jan

author: {'steamid': '76561198293506896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2628, 'last_played': 1601567532}
review: Výborný český tycoon simulátor, který si ihned získal mé srdce. Ti jenž mají rádi žánr tycoon transport strategy games určitě doporučuji koupi. Malá rada, nenechte se odradit pomyslnou nedokončeností, neboť tvůrci stále přidávají nové a nové vylepšení. Přeji tvůrcům spoustu spokojených hráčů a úspěšné pokračování s vylepšováním a plným dokončením této fantastické hry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093256728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3568, 'last_played': 1623164489}
review: Ja vám nevím ale nějak mě to zas nezaujalo. Když už to s modama bylo zajimavé, tak to s nema nefunguje a pada. Dnes jsem tomu zas dal denkvůli aktualizaci a nikam jsem se moc nepohl. Na začátek málo peněz, někdy mají vlaky vetší spotřebu peněz než výdělek. Busy bez řidičů, vlaky a města bez lidí. Nevím za mě by to mohlo být víc doladěný po tak dlouhé době. Dával jsem tomu hodně nadějí a vracel se, ale uninstall a teď už na vždy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121536221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 31524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12275, 'last_played': 1707587035}
review:
If you have ever played any of the  Transport Tycoon games and are a fan of Chris Sawyer, then your going to like this. Simple Idea to the game, your given a randomly generated map with towns on, and industries on. Your job is to run the best rail service you can. Cargo and passengers await. You earn money tokens, you see the game is all about the tokens. Green is yeh dolla, your main currency ! but you also earn others. Let me try and explain. Say I've got a load of wood that needs turning into goods. I've first fot to take those logs from the forest to a lumber mill then to factory, if you do this then you get your wood tokens. You also have cole, steal and so on. Simple!
The game will go through different time lines of rail and engine developemnt so your always looking for the best trains and wagons to hall your cargo. Well that's it it sounds simple and to some extent it is but boy is it addictive and you really have to think about your routes and signals as there not the brightest of train drivers so they need good guidence.   Good sound fx/ music, Graphics and the detail are lovely. But it's the way it plays. Just amazing.
Mashinky is still in early access so bare that in mind. BUT the dev is amazing and always talking to the community and reacting to bug fixes and requests. The game does get regular updates and is still in development. ......  10/10  and would smash trains up again as I forgot to put in signals....... doooohhhhh...........

author: {'steamid': '76561198249358020', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1852, 'last_played': 1642958353}
review:
Ви колись мріяли про створення власної залізничної імперії? Якщо так, то ласкаво просимо в Mashinky! 2 режими: реалістичний та спрощений для розбудови своєї імперії.
Ізометричний вигляд зверху - не єдиний спосіб наглядати за своїм дітищем. Ви маєте можливість сісти на місце машиніста та посигналити наче ви спражній водій локомотива. Або ж відпочити від всієї метушні та посидіти в затишному вагоні або висунутись з вікна, щоб оглянути краєвиди.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393972159', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2258, 'last_played': 1669270089}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086180013', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 3111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3048, 'last_played': 1551538755}
review:
Непоганий симулятор будівництва залізниць. Радує наявність української мови та українських назв міст, хоча світ процедурно генерований, то ж Черкаси можуть опинитися під Харковом. Довго вчився налаштовувати стрілки, щоб не було застоїв, а так та ж схема як і Train/transport fever: ресурс везеш на виробництво, а потім клієнтам готовий продукт. 
Радує наявність епох і починаючи з паровозів можна дійти до... сам не знаю до якої епохи :). Ще великий плюс це камера, яку можна наблизити і детально бачити гарну анімацію руху поїзда. Також є вигляд із кабіни та пагонів. Недоліком можна вважати, що грати треба досить довго, ресурси повільно збираються

author: {'steamid': '76561197982636113', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6509, 'last_played': 1654308294}
review:
Just take a look at how much time I've been playing it. 

I can't add much more about the game. If you read some reviews you'll see this game offers you a lot (and will offer you much more). I've specially liked those taking in consideration that this is a game under development.

I'd only like to mention that the developer is awesome. I've tried to help in other games under development and some of them had terrible communication teams. Instead, here, Jan does everything, and he's always nice answering to people!

If you didn't know that this game is being developed by just one dev, you haven't read enough reviews. Start taking a look at [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/michalrehacek/recommended/598960/]MichalRehacek's review[/url], so you can know a bit more about this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026014934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1630231772}
review:
A really cute sandbox railway experience, simple to use with a quirky multi economy model where you need to create several different kinds of tokens to progress.
The mechanics can be made simple or complex depending on your preferences including signaling tunnels, bridges etc....

author: {'steamid': '76561197972118190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1709408783}
review:
I picked up Mashinsky on a whim; I love train games and have sunk a significant chunk of time into OpenTTD. I also avoid early access on principle. Rarely is an early access game "good" when it launches. Instead, they usually require a significant amount of polish to get to a playable state.

Mashinsky, in a nice turn of events, bucks this stereotype, bringing both something new to the genre, but keeping close enough to the roots to be familiar.

Tokens differentiate Mashinsky from the usual rail tycoon games. Instead of simply buying everything you need and needing to maintain cash flow, the game introduces tokens representing different materials, and adds more as time progresses. These are used for construction of nicer wagons, better trains, and add-ons to your station or other buildings. You gain them through successfully chaining together supply lines, and each successive token requires more or different materials to craft.

This shifts Mashinsky's focus from optimizing cash flow to the delicious puzzle of building new lines and stations as new structures are added to the map. The new buildings are added procedurally - if you're lucky, one of them will appear near a station you've already built; if not, you'll spend time re-routing your network, hoping that the precious house of cards you built doesn't come crashing down as your trains gridlock.

Eventually, this becomes the core gameplay loop, as you constantly build and rebuild as your increasingly aging fleet props up your economy and you scramble to support the hottest new thing on the map. Inevitably, though, you'll make a mistake: trains might collide or everything grinds to a halt because you built a train too long for a station and it blocks the engine of your empire.

And herein lies the beauty - on the surface this is like OpenTTD, but pulling back the covers, it resembles Factorio more, a puzzle to be solved. Money quickly ceases to be a constraint, but the more complex resources never seem to generate as quickly as you want them to. Your main limitation, then, is space.

Gone are the turns in three squares. Bridges require three squares on either side of the track to be built, and tunnels require height differences that you may need to manufacture for a significant chunk of change, which you may not have. Suddenly, a change in your network might require a train to travel halfway across the map to turn around, and you don't have the space to build a turnaround. Meanwhile, it's blocking signals left and right as it strays from its intended destination.

If space is the constraint, signals are your marker to partition that space into increasingly-cramped blocks. Following logic set out over more than a hundred years of train history, you can partition your rails into blocks that trains occupy, with signals preventing another train from entering a block. This sounds trivial in theory, but in practice, as you add additional lines, passing lanes, depots, and turnarounds, they quickly become both a hated and loved tool. Gone are the lovely path signals of OpenTTD, in Mashinsky, you have to keep in mind that the entirety of an intersection might be blocked by a single train, reminding me of Factorio, again.

And much like Factorio, you can ride your trains, but unlike Factorio, you get a first-person view, able to see the rolling fields and burgeoning industry of your map as it grows. While the developer intends to add driving the trains at a later date, right now it's just a nice way to kick back and watch the machine of industry turn.

I have high hopes for Mashinsky's development. This game was absolutely worth it, even with it in early access, and I'm excited to see what else the dev does with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048860341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 9662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3974, 'last_played': 1591421062}
review: It would be impossible for me not to retain the 100% recent rating for this as it is truly an exceptional game. Like many others I have played most, if not all of the other railway games that have been pubilshed over the past years but none of them can compare to this masterpiece. I bought it around a week ago and have already spent nearly 50 hours of enjoyable gaming time on it and it's still only an early access game with lots more to be added. Gameplay and graphics are outstanding and the degree of difficulty is just about right (well at least for me) to keep you thinking about how to plan ahead all the time. Well done "Jan" your years of hard work and dedication to this project have been well worth it, thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020377573', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1644150927}
review:
Może i wczesny dostęp, ale widać ciągły rozwój i pomysł na grę. Co jakś czas update poprawiający błędy i wprowadzające to mniejsze to większe zmiany na lepsze. Błędy się zdarzają, ale są na bierząco poprawiane.
Gra ciekawa i wciągająca. Na początku można mieć problem ze zrozumieniem zachowania się pojazdów, ale nie jest to coś co zajmuje dużo czasu aby zrozumieć. Brakowało mi właśnie gry w tym stylu. Jeśli ktoś lubi takie klimaty to na pewno będzie się dobrze bawił.

review:
na tenhle klenot všichni čekáme až bude hotov jak sáňky v létě...samozřejmě zatím samé plusy protože hra je stále ve vývoji, ale vše nasvědčuje tomu, že hra je na dobré cestě a komunita pomáhá s vývojem tak dobře, že výsledky nenechávají dlouho čekat a jsou tu další updaty pro lepší hratelnost :) thumbs up Jan Zelený a testeři :) (y)
update 2022:jde vidět, že ten progress neskutečně skočil dopředu co se týče různých vylepšení do hry, nové budovy, vozidla, tak také plynulost hraní a odstranění některých bugů.Nejvíce ale teď čekáme na přicházející další éru a hlavně s letadlovou dopravou :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198158585447', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1539706840}
review:
《Mashinky》——值得期待的铁路模拟经营类游戏
全文见：https://steamcn.com/t432605-1-1

首先感谢steamCN的鉴赏家短评活动提供了我接触这款游戏的机会。
 
提示：
本游戏目前还处于抢先体验（Early Access）状态，游戏的后续更新可能会与现在的评测内容有所不同。

游戏简介：
         本游戏是一款类似《铁路大亨》系列的模拟经营类游戏，从命名方式可以看出，作者的开发目标是完成一款类似于《席梅德尔的铁路大亨》的游戏（本游戏在游戏界面显示的全名为《Jan Zeleny’s Mashinky》，同样的命名方式）。
         作者在游戏中说明，自己已经独自开发这款游戏7年，目前推出抢先体验阶段并预计再花费1至2年的时间，将游戏完善成为一款最好的大亨类游戏。
作者表示，在最后的游戏成品中，将包含以下内容：
-从蒸汽时代进入到未来的7个时代；
-16种不同的货物类型与21项工业设施；
-超过25种的火车引擎与40种车厢类型；
-更多的故事、任务、挑战及游戏事件；
-玩家可直接操作列车；
-多达8人的多人联机模式；
-支持steam创意工坊的Mod功能；
-以及更多可能的计划与运输。

目前游玩中能体验到的功能：
       -从蒸汽时代起的4个不同时代；
       -该4个时代对应发展的货物、工业设施、火车引擎及货物车厢类型；
       -故事内容尚少，随机任务与事件类型重复较多；
       -尚未实现操作列车的功能，但可第一人称进入驾驶视角观赏行车路途；
       -目前仅支持单人沙盒经营模式。

游戏各方面评测

画面：8/10
游戏是可以在两种游戏类型中切换，在建造模式中，游戏是以类似2D的网格形式展现的，视角为限制为俯视固定视角。而在非建造模式时，游戏画面将以更为精细的3D模式呈现，且不限制视角，你可以将画面拉到最近，感受火车从身边呼啸而过的体验，或者在车厢中，以第一人称视角观看车辆的运行（为将来的开车模式做准备）。
可惜的是，本作的画面效果并不能比得上类似《铁路帝国》这种等级的逼真与精细，我将各项显示的设置都开到最大了，效果还是没有商店提供的截图那么精细。但对于一款单人制作的模拟经营类游戏已经足以让我满足了。
目前车内的建模还感觉比较粗糙。跟模拟火车系列没得比。不过现在开发者的重心应该还在模拟经营这部分，对于模拟驾驶还比较粗糙可以理解。
（PS：有一个成就需要一驾驶视角完成任务才能解锁，只要看风景就可以了）

音乐：5/10
         游戏中的配乐我颇为喜欢，但是同一首曲子听多了总归是会腻的。在游戏中，你可以看到仅有8收曲子作为背景音乐，造成几个小时的游戏时间里，只能反复听那几首音乐，最后只会关成静音游戏。作为一款模拟经营类游戏，长时间的反复游玩是必然的，而贫乏的BGM无疑是一大缺点。如果能根据时代发展的不同、季节变换的不同增加变换曲目会更好。（PS：目前可以通过直接在对应文件夹置换或增加OGG格式的音乐来自己手动换曲）

系统：7.5/10
          就像简介中提到的，本作是款类大亨的模拟经营类游戏，游戏系统在构建“建造——运行”这部分可以说中规中矩，与一般的模拟经营类游戏基本一致，有玩过类似游戏的应该都能很快上手。
          各个按键在悬停后也都有对应使用提示，便于理解按键功能。（但有的虽然能理解功能，在如何操作使用仅仅靠那点提示还是不够的）
          
操作：6/10
         2D3D视角一键切换十分方便。
        但教程过于简单，对操作的指导不足。尤其是对于交通信号指示灯的设置操作仅凭提示不够详细，让人难以正确放置交通信号。
        桥梁、隧道的建设只能以地图的南北东西四个正向方向放置，无法斜角放置，导致前期如果有大量的斜角的轨道建设，将导致桥梁与隧道无法建设。

目前存在的一些问题

新手教程过于简单，指引功能不足
          目前游戏中的教程仅提供了如何变换地图视角、如何放置新建物品等基本的操作，对于很多操作都只能通过自己不断试错摸索出来。
          尤其是对于交通信号灯的指示教学不足。
          交通信号灯是火车单条轨道运行防止碰撞的重要工具。它用于指示下一段铁路上是否有车辆在运行，如果下一段铁路上有车辆，信号灯就会显示红灯禁止通行，让开到灯前的车辆停止运行直到下一段铁路上的火车开离了才放行。没有设立好信号灯的话，要不就是车辆面对多条可通行铁路不知道怎么走，要不就是会出现追尾撞车的情况。
          而对于这个需要详细设置才能好好使用的工具，本游戏竟然没有专门的教程任务进行详细介绍，只能靠自己一点一点试。

公司经营管理部分游戏内容尚未完善
          目前的游戏体现的内容还主要集中在铁路运输的建设与工业发展，在玩家公司的经营管理方面只有一个收支表功能，此外就是个毫无用处的变换经营人头像的功能，没有具体的游戏内容。
          在《铁路大亨3》，玩家可以通过购买其他对手公司股票，达到兼并对方公司，取得相应铁路的经营控制权。如果游戏希望成为一款超越《铁路大亨》的模拟经营类游戏，在公司管理方面的内容更新也将是下一步需要完成的任务。

游戏中仍存在一些BUG
           在游玩本游戏时，我遇到了两次不明原因的游戏未响应而不得不关闭程序的不明BUG。游戏中已完成的部分成就，未正常跳成就，在steam成就中也没有显示完成。（我现在就有至少三个成就是已完成但未跳成就的）。

在设定车辆路线的不合理
           本作游戏在设定车辆线路时，需要先购买了车厢。而玩家在同样的车头牵引力下，而为了减少空箱载重的浪费，必然会导致只购买同一种车厢，只装载同一种资源。
           像在《铁路大亨3》里面，火车仅需要购买引擎，设定线路后，在一条线路上的不同的路段火车可以自动选择挂靠不同类型的车厢，装载不同类型的资源。
           而像本作这样限定了车厢，每次换车厢都要回到车厂进行的情况，必然导致为了最求利益最大化，车辆挂了什么类型的车厢，就只用于跑一种资源最近的两个点，不利于建立长途线路。


游戏经济体系需要再调整
          如前文介绍说的，游戏经济体系有各种资源货币。各类资源货币基本都是相应工业产业链的最终端产物。（除了“货物”这项产物会最终成为钱以外）
          但由于各种货币的出现是随着时代的发展、资源的出现而产生的，照作者游戏目标的时代算，应该还会增加更多的货币种类，形成一种过于繁杂的经济体系。
          而且有的货币在一段时间需求量较大，但一旦过了这个时代，又成为了毫无用处的货币资源，只作为一个数值在不断累积。像工具厂，会接受木板+煤+钢材成为三种资源货币，但是在后期铁材货币与木材货币仍有需求的同时，煤货币就完全无用了，最后会累积出大量的煤货币。

总评：7.5/10
（仅为目前评分，随着游戏的不断完善，相信分数能更高）

优点：
+游戏中能自由2D、3D视角切换；
+按钮直观，有使用提示；
+随着时代变化的多种多样列车及车厢；
+相对成熟的产业链；
+选择达成目标的任务系统；
+基本每月都有更新内容，能看到作者不断在根据玩家的反馈修复BUG，更新内容；
+介绍中的未来成品值得期待。

缺点：
-无中文；（据坛友反馈，作者有在准备增设中文）
-教程不够详细；
-经济体系存在问题；
-存在仍需完善的一些小BUG，如游戏达成部分成就后steam成就中仍显示未达成。

         作为一款以结合《铁路大亨》和《模拟火车》两类游戏模式为目标的模拟经营游戏，在目前的先行体验版本中已展现出了一定的模拟建设游戏性，但是在距离作者承诺的大亨类游戏还需要一定的内容更新。目前游戏的类型与其说是模拟经营类，更像是一款沙盒建设类游戏，经营部分与经济体系还需要再打磨。
         如果你喜好《铁路大亨》类游戏，我强烈建议你将本作加入你的愿望单中。

author: {'steamid': '76561197994706603', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1749, 'last_played': 1600932567}
review: When I bought this game last year, I only played about 10 minutes and was done.  However, random chance got me to try the game again last week and I was instantly hooked on it.  Obviously, the game has progressed in it's development since then -- and still has much to come, but even now in it's current state it's a fantastic and fun game.  It's a great merging of older transport/train games like Transport Tycoon/Railroad Tycoon and more moden train simulators.  I highly recommend it to anyone who has had even a passing interest in railroad building games.  Its both nostalgic and refreshingly new.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068881338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1623514348}
review:
Dlouho jsem zvažoval , zda si hru pořídit pouze kvůli podobě OTTD které mi vzalo svojí důmyslností spoustu hodin. Nakonec jsem si hru pořídil po shlédnutí rozhovoru s Janem Zeleným, který na mě opravdu zapůsobil jako sympaťák co hru vyvíjí opravdu pro lidi a až druhařadě pro nějakej ten zisk. A opravdu toho nelituju. Kdybych věděl o co jsem se ochudil , koupil bych si hru dříve. Nechci srovnávat s OTTD ale přesto si neodpustím říct že hra si bere inspiraci pouze v tom nejlepším co v ottd bylo. A ten zbytek obsahu co se absolutně odlišuje je něco co tomu dokonale padne. Je tam vidět obrovská inovace. A obdivuji spoustu pěkných nápadů které mě opravdu potěšili. Jako příklad uvedu , nalezenou rezatou parní lokomotivu , která je ke všemu krásně naskinovaná takže ji kdykoliv na trati najdete. A vždycky si řeknete , jo tohle je ta co sem našel a nenechal ji ladem. Super nápad. V tomhle momentě kdy píši tuhle recenzi mám 34 souprav na obrovském kolejišti a jsem teprve ve 2.Eře. A už ted řeším problém jaký jsem v žádném tycoonu neřešil , a to se mi velmi líbí jak to Jan Zelený pojal.. A to je provozní náklady.. V momentě kdy jsem přesedlal na lepší parní lokomotivy , mě náklady přešli z peněz na uhlí a já to nevnímal, do té doby než zjistíte že 34 parních mašin žere neskutečný množství. A pokud hrajete na na Hard tak jak vám dojde poslední kousek uhlí, končíte. Takže najednou stojíte před problémem a říkáte si jak málo stačilo v době páry k tomu aby se celý kolos zastavil.. A tak musíte zastavit provoz všech mashinek co nepotřebujete a začít okamžitě stahovat uhlí s celé mapy, jinak končíte.. A to je teprve začátek hry.. Ovšem co mě docela mrzí je vzdálenost kolejí od sebe.. V momentě kdy máte velké kolejiště a hrajete na střední mapě , tak tím jak jsou koleje roztahané od sebe , máte zabranou skoro každou volnou půdu a vypadá to , divně.. Ale věřím že s tímhle vším se určitě v budoucnu počítá.. Hlavně když na tom dělá programátor-grafik. A ještě k pár záporům co nejspíše patří k Early Acces hře: Při přepínání oken ALt-Tab mi hra nenaskočí, skončím u černého okna ve kterém ale hra běží. A jako poslední zápor mi docela vadí že jelikož hru semtam hraji v práci nemůžu rychle jedním tlačítkem vypnout zvuk a zapauzovat hru.. ESC do hlavního menu by stačilo, ale není :)

Takže díky za super hru.. Máte můj obdiv a jsem hrdý na to že takovéhle hry vznikají díky lidem jako jste vy i u nás.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073824354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1628281458}
review:
Иногда накатывает ностальгия и хочется поиграть в игры, за которыми протирались штаны перед монитором в юности. Так, примерно год назад, в поисках ремейков любимых игр я наткрулся на геймплей игры Mashinky. Когда я увидел режим строительства понял, что автор вдохновлялся игрой TDD. Приобрел я ее спустя год, после выхода 4й эры (всего заявлено 7). Все таки первая альфа, игра была довольно сырой и я опасался разочароваться. Справедливости ради стоит сказать, что и сейчас это только половина контента и только поезда. И хотя Mashinky позиционирует себя как игра про поезда, в roadmap заявлен автотранспорт, самолеты и, возможно, водный транспорт.

При всем сходстве с TDD игра предлагает новые интересные механики. Например система токенов на ряду с деньгами, что, на мой взгляд очень разнообразит игровой процесс. Чтобы дать некоторое понимание о чем речь: в TDD было все равно что перевозить - пассажиров, сырье или готовые товары - по итогу вы получали деньги. Таким образом вы могли заниматься чем-то одним, например, лишь пассажирскими перевозками и забить на остальное. Тут же вы не уйдете далеко в развитии, т.к. для покупки и обслуживания поездов нового типа будут требоваться соотвествующие ресурсы-токены (уголь, нефть и т.п.).

По моим прикидкам до полноценного релиза этой игре понадобится еще от 1го до 3х лет при текущих темпах, но уже сейчас я могу рекомендовать ее к покупке и ознакомлению, и не только любителям серии Transport Tycoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072117565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 9836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1711817305}
review:
Great beautiful game.
Pure beauty of old but good Tycoon 1990, made in new form with nice graphics. This is something I was looking for long time. A lot of dfferent games failed short, not having this climate and soul of old brillant tycoon.
It needs more updates of course, with more content, but this is already very playable, with some good replayability. Building empire is always different, cuz depending on player imagination. As far, they placed 4 era's, from 7.
Also, variety of maps is not big yet. I mean, there is random generation, which is ok, but biggest map is 512x512 (not so big if you like huge empires) and set of tiles types is not very differentiated. Only grass and trees, and some of buildings.

Graphics and views
3D models are in game, possible to be viewed in real time, from close range. Like view from train, view from any building, view from station etc. It gives feeling of being in countryside. This is charming.

Music
Music in this game is ideal. Chilling and with nice pace. Its even similar to old tycoon in term of tempo and instrumantation.
if you close eyes, you can feel it ;)

Gameplay
From economic point of view, it is rather chilling, not challenging. Nice, slow pace of steady grow with rail network and trains. Not punishing player for making mistakes, such as building and destroying much of rails etc. So, building and constructing in this game, is biggest plus.
Economy is steady. In old tycoon there was two modes, steady and fluctuated economy. I hated this fluctuated because factories were closing and moving. This one, have set up steady economy.
Cities are static, without growing and expanding. They are same all the time, and not growing aroung with new roads/buildings. Cities should expand as game progress, but not. I still hope they will add this into the game at some point.

Interface
There is building mode, and gameplay mode, which differs how world is shown. Building mode is very clear, with tilesets, showing with transparency how tack are laid, and how trains are movings. Much more visible for routes, and planning tracks. And it can be used as actual gameplay. You can play in building mode long time, as actual game, in real time, seeing all details of moving trains, semaphores etc. Visual mode, is just showing world in 3D perpective with all details as it should be, trees, grass, buildings, and all beuty of countryside.
This is really good combination, giving smooth and easy switch between those modes any time.

Overall
Not all content is yet there. Missing few era's of trains. Not too many updates for stations yet, just few.
Gameplay is rather not challenge. More construction, in creative way, and slow grind of money.
Visuals are good, music is very good. Interface is clear and very well done.
Missing more challenge, like competitions, and more variety of maps, and more variety of choices.
Missing also other types of transportations (as it was in tycoon, bus, place and boat). Maybe they will add, since possiblity of building roads is there already.
For easy and fun gameplay it is perfect. But for players which like challenge, it is not there yet.

For me, it is 8/10
(because it grabs my heart, and because devs are updating game from time to time, and because finished product will be really good)

author: {'steamid': '76561198108015755', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1568201904}
review:
[h1] Mashinky [/h1]    [b] How to not crash your trains [/b]   


[h1] 📋 Premise [/h1]   
"Mashinky" is a transport strategy builder game developed single-handedly by Jan Zelený. Although the game isn't completed yet and there are many features to come, Mashinky still offers an enjoyable experience. It's fairly easy to learn the basics but, while it resembles titles such as Transport Tycoon or Sid Meier's Railroads, it lacks the difficulties and challenges that would make it a powerhouse in the genre. 

[h1] ✅ Pros: [/h1]    
• Construction mode relays on a simplistic and easy to understand grid-style view
• You can switch between the cameras masterfully placed on trains, or even in the cities and houses
• Incredible attention to details
• Realistic sound effects
• Procedurally generated maps 
• Randomly generated quests to keep the gameplay from becoming extremely stale

[h1] ❎ Cons: [/h1]    
• Lacks proper management features
• The game gets really easy once you have a steady income
• Frequent crashes
• The train AI often ignores orders

[h1] 🎮 Gameplay: in depth [/h1]    
[u][b] General information [/b][/u]   
Keep in mind that Mashinky is still in development and it's far from finished which is definitely something to keep in mind when deciding whether it's worth investing in or not. Despite this, it is still capable of offering many hours of gameplay. 

Before starting a game, we can choose what difficulty to play at and each of these has different characteristic. The most impactful one is our starting money, through which we will manage almost everything in the first Era of the game.

Currently, there are 4 Eras (out of the 7 Eras planned) that we can play through, and all of them can be unlocked by investing in advance or waiting. When advancing from an Era to the other not only will we be able to unlock different types of trains and wagons, but more industries and facilities will be added to the map. 

Our objective is to run a successful and prosperous transport business by upgrading our services and vehicles accordingly to the new technologies available. Since every great business has to start somewhere, let's talk about our first steps in Mashinky. Notice how, upon starting, we have nothing but a few funds. That means we need some kind of income. This is done through building stations in each city and adding railways to connect them, so to allow our trains to transport either passengers or goods. To connect cities we will be given more means than just railways. We can also make use of bridges, tunnels, and even bulldozers to remove roads or manipulate the terrain.

While transporting people gives us compensation, money alone is not enough. There are certain requirements to be met in order to buy better vehicles or upgrade our factories and stations. These requirements are known as tokens, a type of currency that is craftable through the many factories available in the game. Another way to gain tokens is by completing the randomly generated quests that the game has to offer. They often vary from visiting cities, to bringing materials to destroyed facilities or even collecting a certain amount of goods from the factories.

It's thanks to this currency that we can buy our pass to the next Eras' technology. Deciding whether to buy it or not makes no actual difference since there's nothing for us to compete against that requires having all the best tech.

There's no computer-controlled AI to challenge. Even if there was, the game has to face one of its biggest issues. As tempting as it is to build the greatest transport empire that there ever was, Mashinky is not able to withstand the amount of memory required to keep more than 100 vehicles running at the same time. The crashes that this problem causes might happen very frequently, one after the other, even while loading the game itself.

[u][b] Content [/b][/u]    
A bit lacking if we compare it to what the final product should be, Mashinky is nevertheless a good gaming experience that is embellished by the high replayability value that it holds. 

[h1] 🔬 Technical Analysis [/h1]    
[u][b] Graphics [/b][/u]    
The cameras that bring us directly into the world of Mashinky have the spotlight here. It's through those that we get the most of Mashinky's incredible graphics and remarkable attention to details. From the dust on coal collecting wagons to the logs being carried on lumber ones, everything has been masterfully created. Mashinky's world is painted as close to reality as possible. Jan Zelený has stated that others have contributed in the making of Mashinky's art, doing a magnificent job.

[u][b] Sound [/b][/u]    
Particular praise must be given to the sound effects. All the noises, even the tiniest ones, are sounds that we're already accustomed to: the trains on the railways, the train's horn when traveling through tunnels, the chit-chat of civilians waiting at the platforms and even the noise coming from functioning, working factories. 

[u][b] Performance [/b][/u]    
It tends to stutter a lot. Not only does it become clearly slower when there are many trains running, but it also frequently freezes when placing too many railways altogether.

[u][b] HUD [/b][/u]    
The HUD is fairly easy to understand. Everything you need to know to navigate it is found through a very easy-to-follow tutorial, which happens right at the start of the game. 

[u][b] Bugs Encountered [/b][/u]    
The game isn't able to handle too many trains running at once, which has resulted in it crashing way too frequently. Thankfully the game has a great auto-saving system that happens once every few minutes.
Another big issue at hand is the AI ignoring orders and block signals.

[h1] 🎬 Wrapping up [/h1]    
Mashinky is definitely a game that harbors incredible potential. If you're looking for a game to shelf after hitting endgame content then this isn't for you. An overall funny and entertaining experience, I personally can't wait for new content to be released. In its current state its price might seem to high but it is well worth it.


[h1] 📈 RATING: 7.5/10 [/h1]   


[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7871885/]Follow our curator page,[b] OCG-Curations[/b] if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198037809811', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1539345685}
review:
[h1]In Short[/h1]
Mashinky is a train tycoon game about creating a successful train company. You progress through several "ages" in the game.
When you reach a certain age you will gain rewards such as new technology and resources.

[b]🔵Pros[/b]
+Several trains and wagons to choose from.
+A good amount of quests to do.
+Great soundtrack
+Great core mechanics

[b]🔴Cons[/b]
-Not a lot of uses for money after you've upgraded everything and your railway is done.
-The game feels a bit overwhelming in the beginning since the tutorials don't explain everything well.

[h1]🎮In-Depth Gameplay Analysis[/h1]
When you begin the game you are given a few starting quests like telling you how the camera works and how to construct your railways.
Once you've done the basic quests and got your railway transporting people from one city to another you can start expanding your railway so it goes to many other cities so you get more money and passengers.
You also have the choice to start delivering resources like logs or coal to sawmills and tool works. You start building your railway by building a station near a city once you've done that you need to build rails between the stations so your train can move.
If you want to make a station for resources like wood, for example, you need to put a station near a forest and the wood from the forest will go straight into your station for your trains to load on them.
Once you've got the railway done you need to make a depot near your railway. You can buy new trains and wagons from the depot. Once you purchase your first train and some wagons you need to set the orders of the train. There are several kinds of wagons in the game and they all serve a different purpose.
There are wagons for passengers and also for resources like wood or iron, for example. You can have your train go to as many stations as you want and in any order, you want by using the orders tab. There are several kinds of buildings and rails you can make for your railway such as stations, depots, bridges, tunnels and high-powered rails.

Your first trains run by taking money from your total balance, but your more advanced trains in the future will run with oil, electricity, and such. Of course, the better and more advanced your train is the more advanced resources it will need to run as well.
The game has these "ages" which set the level of technology and resources you can use and find. The game currently has 4 ages ranging from steam to early diesel age, but the game is going to have 7 ages when it's out of early access. You have two options when it comes to getting to the next age.
You can either wait until the age starts by itself or deposit resources of the current age in the quests tab and start the next age earlier. I always waited until the next age started since I wasn't fast enough to get all of the resources in time since it's really hard to gather the required resources.
Once you unlock a new age several new resources, and industrial buildings on your map. You will unlock new resources like iron and oil, but also new industrial buildings like the refinery and the factory. 
The new trains and railway upgrades you unlock are all very useful. The new trains can go faster and are more powerful so you can carry more resources or passengers at a time. The high-powered rails you get allow your trains to go at faster speeds, unlike your older trains that have a lower maximum speed.

You can upgrade each of your buildings to increase the number of resources or people you can have on them, loading speed and all kinds of other stuff to improve your buildings. The first upgrades are cheap and you only need money to purchase them, but the later upgrades require high-level resources to get them.
You will get several quests along the way about companies asking you to deliver them some resource, transporting a set amount of people from a city to another or even just boarding one of your trains and being there for 5 minutes. You will gain several resources like money, wood, iron and even new trains or wagons by doing these quests.
Doing the quests you are given is important since they speed up your progress by a lot. So make sure to do your quests and if you don't like them then just refuse to do them and you will get a new quest after some time
You also have the option to edit your character's face and view balance sheets and all kinds of other stuff to see how your company is doing and how much you're making profit.

[b]💰Content & Pricing[/b]
The game costs 23€ and is a pretty good game for that price. There just isn't a lot of content and features in the game yet since it's still in early access.
The game has the potential to last as long as you want. You could choose to end the game when you have the best trains available or keep going until you're rich.

[h1]Technical Analysis[/h1]

[b]🎥Graphics and 🔩Performance[/b]
The game's graphics are alright and simple. The ground textures and models are comparable to older games so you can definitely see some individual pixels in some textures, but they still don't look bad so they're not amazing, but still looks alright. The ground textures also had some crosses and dots in there which were very weird and didn't look very good.
The game is currently pretty unoptimized especially since the game's graphics aren't really good. So if you have older hardware you might need to lower the settings to get a stable 60 fps. The game is still in early access though so the performance should improve over time. (I7-7700K, GTX 680, 16GB DDR4)

[b]🔊Sounds and Music[/b]
The game's sounds are all right, but the game has a very good soundtrack. The songs have a kind of jazz and old school feeling and are pretty good overall.
It's definitely, something I would listen to even without playing the game so it would be a nice addition to buy the soundtrack as a DLC or something.

[b]🐛Bugs[/b]
I encountered a few bugs during my playtime such as the train getting stuck on one path and only repeating that one path forever, but I could always fix those by deleting a part of the rail and fixing it.
I didn't encounter many other bugs though.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1] 
Mashinky is a great tycoon management game. The game is still in early access so there's not a lot of content and features in the game currently, but they'll get added over time.
I would recommend it to someone that really likes management and tycoon games.

[h1]Rating: 7.0/10[/h1]
[b]This copy of the game was received for free for review purposes.[/b]

[b]Review based on the build released on 6.10.2018[/b]

review: Just want to say : what a fantastic game. I can really see passion in the continued development of Mashinky. The little things really pop. I love the view angles from high to low and there is just so much detail. I know this is a completely different game to compare to, but for fans and immersion this game is right up there with SCS Euro Truck Sim 2 and American Truck Sim. The only games I truly get lost in (in a good way). Thank you Jan Zelený, your hard work and love shows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116077880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10516, 'last_played': 1641302345}
review:
LE: the bug is not exactly a bug, i found out what is happening and therefore I have nothing more to complain about it :D 
maybe just to complain that i don;t have enough time for this game :D :)))) 


i like this game. i am finding it as a true descendant of TRANSPORT GIANT. having played more than 100 hours on this game, i can appreciate the pros and cons of this game. being in EA i would not insist on them because at this moment they might change which each new update. 
i see great future for this game BUT..
but i like big maps, with big number  of industries and stations and trains and micromanagement. 
and I can't play it as I want to play it because it seems that i have the luck to have one bug, one annoying little bug which is preventing me in using station's expansion to their max possibility ( i can't put from a certain point in game any expansion sto stations which means less passangers aka less income and less storage space for production which means bottlenecks ).
and this is killing my desire to play this game for months now.
until this would not be solved, i can;t recommand a game which i can't play the way i want to play.
maybe some other time in future.
developer_response:
Hello and so sorry for such issues. If I may ask you, since it seems that it is quite rare bug, could you make a video of it for me and send to info(at)mashinky.com ? Or maybe save file could be enough, since this issue will not be HW dependent I guess, with this, I may be able to reproduce it and fix it finally. Sorry again for issues and thanks in advance for you time!
Jan

author: {'steamid': '76561198065476921', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1591333832}
review: A stellar attempt at a railway based tycoon type game. I like it except its on a square grid. Square grids are so 1990s. Would love to play a game like this on a less geometrically restrictive world. I've tried a few that do that, Train Fever,  Railway Empire, but none seem to get the mechanics of switches as well as Mashinky. Unfortunatley, the geometrically challenged layout is a bit of a turn off for me. Oh, why can't I find the ultimate train sim?

author: {'steamid': '76561198003284246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1710571110}
review:
J'ai longtemps attendu un jeu de train qui me rappelerai mon enfance(Même si je ne suis pas super vieux 31 ans)
Mais étant petit j'adorais jouer aux petits trains dans ma chambre et là de voir ce jeu m'a intrigué... je l'ai acheté et une fois l'avoir essayé je me suis senti replongé dans mon enfance...
Ce jeu m'a apporté beaucoup de satisfaction et j'espère qu'il va beaucoup évolué car il est vraiment chouette.

Premeir abord il faut prendre de faire une partie pour au moins essayer et comprendre le fonctionnement d'un bon starter.
Il y a moyen de se faire plaisir avec les différents train disponibles ainsi que les wagons.

Je souhaite que plus il y ait plus de contenu dans le et peut être plus de stratégie niveau développement des villes et autre :)

Et j'espère de tout mon coeur pourquoi pas un mode multijoueurs :)
Ca peut être super de jouer avec des potes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998683084', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1604615235}
review:
Titolo (sviluppato da una sola persona) con notevoli prospettive future, Mashinky sembra avere le carte in regola per essere un degno erede di Transport Tycoon in versione ferroviaria dunque io vi consiglio di seguirlo nel suo lungo sviluppo.
Oramai dopo 7 anni è arrivato a un buon punto e il suo creatore ci tiene tanto alla sua buona riuscita dunque sicuramente è un titolo sul quale scommettere. Multiplayer fino a 8 giocatori in un gestionale, tante ere che vanno dalle locomotive a vapore a quelle attuali e un innovativo uso del motore grafico per costruire l'infrastruttura!

Vedere per credere!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TdIn9878S40

author: {'steamid': '76561198058112767', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1624296173}
review:
Po kilkudziesięciu godzinach rozgrywki na kilku mapach jestem pozytywnie nastawiony na dalszy rozwój.
Przyjemna dla oka grafika plus klasyczny tryb budowy rodem z TTD który jest bardzo czytelny co ułatwia rozbudowę naszego małego imperium kolejowego. 
Ciekawym pomysłem jest zastąpienie standardowej waluty systemem żetonów, lecz wymaga on odpowiedniego zbalansowania.
Z niecierpliwością czekam na czwartą erę i dalszy rozwój.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999430933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1936, 'last_played': 1605937281}
review:
Mashinky scratches a train building itch, it's fun and satisfying and the graphics are lovely. Definitely worth playing with, easily 15-20 hours of fun, probably more, but it's no Railroad Tycoon 3, at least, not yet.

A few comments about the current (early access) release:
Dollars quickly become worthless, making the economy a bit screwy. Passengers and mail don't care where you take them to, so there's no incentive to have long distance passenger lines, everyone just goes back and forth between the two nearest stations. The option to have trains reverse slowly instead of magically flipping direction seems like it could be interesting, but automatic route finding doesn't seem to use nearby sidings or loops to turn around and manually scheduling trains to go via a specific point to get them to turn around is a bit of a nuisance. In some ways though my biggest quibble is a sense of scale; complex intersections or multiple platform stations end up significantly larger than the biggest cities, sometimes there's just not enough space to fit them in which can be frustrating.

Hopefully some of these issues can be addressed before release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135810527', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1504, 'last_played': 1619410023}
