author: {'steamid': '76561197976249852', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1657801250}
review:
This game's biggest Pro compared to other transport games.

Good Thing 1

It's like OpenTTD, but with actual progression and objectives.

What I mean by that, is that instead of simply needing money, pretty much everything but the basic trains require tokens. money is also considered tokens, but I am going to ignore that. 
Now tokens can be summarized to "global recourses". 
For example. one of the more advanced steam trains costs "coal tokens" to buy and to pay for maintenance. 
This require you to have set up a coal transport line. But before you have that, you must have a passenger transport line since, that makes the money you need in order to run the coal line.
In every other transport tycoon I know of. You only need money. 
So once you have found the most profitable way to make money, you have no real reason no to do that all the time (For example the OP Planes in OpenTTD). 
Goods were always an optional thing to transport and would maybe help town growth. 
But here, there is a natural progression from passenger transport, to more and more complex goods that require more and more factories to be produced. Since you need the goods in order to build better stuff, you are naturally encouraged to produce these more and more complex goods.. It reminds me a lot of factorio (Which is a good thing).

Good thing 2: You can modularly upgrade stations and industries. I enjoy this mechanic very much.

Good Thing 3: The game is good looking. While not as great as transport fever it is still a pleasant view for the eye.

Good Thing 4: The game also heavily incentivizes complex rail networks through a variety of mechanics I can't quite put my finger on. 


This game's biggest Cons compared to other transport games:

1
Its Early Access. So, the early diesel age is the limit for now, and a lot of content in the form of trains and recourses are missing.
2
Only two types of signals (Block and basic chain), also no fast signal placement as far as i am aware of.
3
Bridges and tunnels are very rigid like OpenTTD, (So only 100 % straight bridges/tunnels, no signals on them either)
4.
Very simple auto train orders, stop at station/full load/unload all, that is all. 
5.
No clone train button, unless I am mistaking.
6.
No route function/No Easy way to change a series of trains' orders/No Easy way add tons of trains to a route/No Easy way to Replace tons of trains with a different set of wagons/locomotives ect.
7.
No multiplayer or A.I. for multiple companies.
8. 
Only trains, other modes of transportation is "planned"
9.
No steam workshop
10.
Passengers don't have destinations. Like in for example transport fever, because of this all passengers exits the train at the first valid station.

All in all i highly recommend this game for any transport tycoon or resource management fan. And while there are far more negative points than positive ones in this review, that is simply due to them being minor features that are important, but not integral to a good experience (AKA, Quality of Life). And there is a good chance most these negative points will be made outdated through updates or modding. (Since they are so "minor") 

I was pleasantly surprised to see how different this game is simply through its token system. It's actually quite a brilliant system.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981156924', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1576861544}
review: If you've ever played Transport Tycoon or any of the same type of game from that genre, then I think you'll be impressed with this.  It's not complicated.  In fact, it's quite simplistic in its approach and impressively intuitive in introducing new players to the game's world.  An added bonus, in my most humble opinion, is the game's music.  Refering back to Transport Tycoon, the music in that game compared to the music in this game are right on par with each other.  The in-game music is relaxing and sets the tone for the game world.  Very nice!  Another added bonus, you actually get to "ride along" on your creation.  I'm a grumpy old gamer and this is a bit of a novel idea.  Not that it's completely new, mind you, but rather a welcome addition to THIS type of transport game.  I know it's still very much in development, but thankfully very playable!  Good job developers!  The graphics are good.  The game's sky backdrop could use a little work, but the game is still very much alpha...so, not a game breaker.  In the little amount of time that I played this title, I never experienced any CTD's or errors.  That's a HUGE plus!  Again, good job developers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116677182', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2877, 'last_played': 1610202111}
review:
Я рекомендую эту игру к покупке лишь в том случае, если вы хотите поддержать разработчика. 
Игра разрабатывается почти 7 лет одним человеком.
Посмотрите какие-нибудь обзоры на нее, например от RIMPACa, обратите внимание на все функции, которые реализованы в игру на данный момент и вы поймете, что такими темпами она будет разрабатываться еще 2-3 года.
Безусловно игра интересная и у нее есть потенциал, но после того, как я узнал, что разработчик уже вот 7 лет создает эту игру, я перестал в нее играть.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978088722', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1697294647}
review:
Well done train tycoon game. It is still early access, but already fun to play, with a fresh new approach regarding economic. It is more weighted to reach a certain amount of goods to do research, while money is just a number to show how good your business is running....and to buy you more trains, tracks, buildings, of course.   

You build your tracks on a square view, well known from former tycoon games. Then you change over to state of the art graphics to watch your trains move. Signals are still a bit fuzzy...but probably I didn't catch all mechanism to understand how they are working here. Last but not least you could jump on your train on the first-person view and enjoy the ride. 

One could choose from different states of realism...like to allow your trains to turn around on single tracks, in one-track-stations or if you need them to drive backwards instead, or you simply build loops for them to change driving direction. So far I only tested simple setup till I'm firm with the game. 

Pricing is fair, nevertheless, you might want to wait for a sale while in early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967426975', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1695756681}
review: Wspaniała! Choć nie grałem jeszcze wiele, już widać niesamowitą konstrukcję tej gry. Trzy płaszczyzny zawiadowania. Widać, że czerpie garściami z klasyka klasyków jakim jest Transport Tycoon, ale też zawiera masę niesamowitych mechanizmów autorskich twórcy gry. Chociażby budowa w trybie izometrycznym, co daje przejrzystość ruchu i instalowania infrastruktury, a później wszystko można obejrzeć w otoczeniu 3D. Genialne! Czyżby w końcu ktoś wkroczył na poziom Transport Tycoon? Powiem szczerze, że od lat dziewiędziesiątych kiedy to grałem na platformach PC i Playstation we wspomnianego klasyka, nic nie budziło mojej nadziei, bardziej niż teraz. Brawo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042525500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1518753332}
review:
Meh.  It's okay, but I'm not thrilled.  Graphics are great.  The controls aren't intuitive.  The signals are very clunky and the pathfinding (probably due to the signal logic) is horrible.  You spend more time trying to figure out how to make an intersection work than you do playing the game.  This might be a learning curve thing.  But then again...why is there even a curve? Train signals aren't that hard.  Factorio's signaling and pathfinding for instance is much more intuitive and functional - and it's not even a "train game".

I'm going to not recommend this game at this time.  Hopefully it gets better as the development continues.

Devs: Pretty graphics are good.  Trains that don't take away from enjoying them would be even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086455897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3805, 'last_played': 1692034490}
review:
Un petit bijou.
Au début c'est un peu déroutant au niveau des récompenses / revenus / monnaies. En fait c'est mieux.

Les missions sont récurrentes, mais les refaire ne pose pas de problème.

Un gros plus : la gestion des signaux est impeccable avec en plus les 'chain-signals' (me souvient plus de la traduction.
Quand vous voyez ce que vous pouvez faire au niveau de la gestion de vos gares les plus usitées grâce aux signaux, quand vous rejouez ensuite à Transport Fever où les trains se bloquent facilement, vous apprécierez encore mieux ce jeu.

Les mises-à-jour sont fréquentes mais pas trop.

C'est un plaisir de recommencer sur une nouvelle map et les passages d'une époque à l'autre apportent leur lots de piment. Bref je le recommande vraiment car il reste un des jeux de transport ferroviaire les plus aboutis et intéressant.
Chaque bâtiment peut être amélioré et cela change tout !

De plus il n'est pas fini donc encore en évolution et malgré cela pas un plantage avec mes 60+ heures de jeu au moment où je rédige cette évaluation. Pas vu de bugs jusqu'à présent!.

Une chose : les deux types de vues Construction / utilisation semblent bizarres les 5/10 premières minutes.... ensuite on s'y est tellement bien habitué qu'on ne fait plus attention.

Bref : Je recommande fortement !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066999418', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1518016638}
review:
Půjdu rovnou k věci. Tahle hra mě opravdu hodně naštvala. Naštvala mě až tak, že si dám tu práci a napíšu na ní recenzi. 

Logika vyhledávání trasy - tragická. Vlak prostě jede vždy striktně nejkratší trasou. Zní to skvěle, ale má to háček. Háček zní "VŽDY". Například i když vám kolej končí ve stanici. Pro představu: Je dáno nádraží "B" - 3 koleje vedle sebe. Levá a pravá vede skrz, prostřední vede do stanice jen z jedné strany. Čili z jednoho konce do nádraží vstupují  koleje, z druhého jen dvě krajní.

Touto stanicí má projet vlak, který jede z A do C. V případech, kdy krajní kolej je trasa z A do C, jen v podstatě o čtvereček delší, ale k cíli vede - kolej je nádražím B průchozí, zatím co tato, o čtvereček kratší trasa, končí ve stanici - není nádražím B průchozí. Engine vyhledávání trasy to vezme takto: "Cesta přes tuto stanici (B) k cíli (C) vede, přes tuto kolej však ne, ale ... nezájem, pošleme vlak tudy". Ten se zde samozřejmě zasekne, otočí a vyrazí zpět, což samozřejmě vede ke kolapsu celého traťového systému. 

U hry, která je na bezchybném fungování logiky vyhledávání trasy v podstatě založená a současně ani nelze uživatelsky určit přes kterou kolej má vlak jet, je tato chyba naprosto zásadní, a díky tomu je hra nehratelná... bohužel. Tedy pokud vás nebaví stavět koleje z bodu A, do bodu B. Žádné křížení, co vlak, to samostatná trasa. Pak to funguje. Na druhou stranu ještě aby tohle nefungovalo ;)

Občas zmizí kus nádraží, ale vlaky přes to jedou... :) Ona vůbec si grafika ve hře tak nějak přepíná textury jak se jí zachce, ale na to se po chvíli zvyknout dá. Jednak je to jen občas a naprostou většinou se tak děje na místech, kde to neovlivňuje hratelnost. Takže co... Hlavní jsou vlaky.

Další UX hrůznost. V depu mám vlak, má danou trasu, která funguje. Hurá. Chci další takový. Neexistuje možnost "duplikovat trasu" - musíte proto otrocky naklikat všechno znovu. K tomu samému postupu jste nuceni i když jen měníte lokomotivu. Proboha proč? O.o 

Algoritmus plánování trasy kolejí... K tomu se raději do hloubky vyjadřovat nebudu. Protože právě to, co u konkurenčních her vždy tvořilo tu zábavnou podstatu hry, se zde stává naprostou a nefalšovanou noční můrou. Algoritmus chvílemi nabízí tak neskutečná zvěrstva, že se to lidský mozek snaží ze všech sil nevidět. Přemýšlení o tom, proč to daný algoritmus "vymyslel" zrovna takhle, nikam nevede. Prostě to takhle taky jde, tak... Chvílemi jen sledovat ty návrhy vyloženě fyzicky bolí. Mosty, náspy, okliky - to vše za milion. Ale zvětšit nádraží do svahu, to samozřejmě nejde. Takže bagr, jednou kliknout, odebrat hlínu a znovu na zvětšení nádraží. A už to jde. Absoultně tomu chybí koncept. Buď má všechno jít, nebo všechno nejít. Tohle je kočkopes...

Závěrem hodnocení: V této fázi hru prostě NELZE doporučit. Jako "free to play" betaverzi asi ano, jako maturitní práci také, ale jako finální produkt za €23 rozhodně ne. 

Pro srovnání OpenTTD vám dá to samé, jen dokonale hratelné - bez chyb. Na oplátku nevidíte vlaky z 1st person pohledu. To se IMHO oželet dá, zvlášť když vezmu v potaz poměr cena/výkon. OpenTTD je zdarma a krom naklápění kamery je to v podstatě dvojče tohoto počinu.

Hudba je skvělá. 1*

Výběr aktivního monitoru při spuštění hry je na dnešní dobu mimořádně user friendly - uvětšiny her/programů stále ještě chybí. 1*

Jen díky tomu bych hodnotil 2/10

P.S.: vy dva, kteří jste u této hry hrdě uvedeni jako testeři dejte okamžitě výpověď a změňte práci. Kdybyste totiž dělali co máte, takováto recenze by NEMOHLA vzniknout.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198090859060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 23207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12225, 'last_played': 1692094220}
review:
OTTD spiele ich mit Vergnügen schon sehr lange. Mashinky versprach ein guter Nachfolger zu sein/werden. Aber selbst als EA Spiel wird mit fortschreitender Nutzung des Spieles (über 120 Std) der Spielspaß immer weniger, unter anderem aus folgenden Gründen:
Die KI der Züge ist sehr mäßig, da werden große Umwege angegangen, durch Bahnhöfe gefahren, trotz kürzerer Verbindung. Nach einer Wendung bei Verlassen eines Bahnhofes versucht der Zug öfters in ein Gleis gegen ein Richtungssignal einzufahren.
Gleisbau: recht elegant gelöst, aber Tunnel und Brücken sind ein Graus. Unter einer Brücke kann zum Beispiel kein Signal stehen. Unter einer bestehenden Brücke ist ein Gleisbau kaum/nicht möglich. Tunnel haben Wasserprobleme usw.
Signale: eine dauernde Klickerei um längere Strecken mit Signalen zu versehen. Die hinzugekommenen Kettensignale sind recht ordentlich, aber nicht über einen Tastaturbefehl zu erreichen. Gleiseinfahrten sind damit aber nicht sauber zu gestalten. Dass mehrere Züge gleichzeitig einen Bahnhof erreichen, wie mit Pfadsignalen, ist nicht sauber zu lösen. 
Tokens: ein Wirtschaftssystem, bei dem man mit fortschreitender Spieldauer die Geduld und den Spaß verliert. 
Weiterentwicklung: schleppend bis gar nicht. Spiel ruckelt bei höherer Auflösung, Gleise verschwinden, Aufträge verändern sich, nicht bearbeitete Signale verändern sich bei Umbauten, andere Signale bleiben einen Zug aufhaltend dauerhaft auf rot, trotzdem das die Strecke frei ist etc. etc.
MASHINKY scheint wie soviele andere EA Spiele zur Spielleiche im IT Keller zu mutieren.

Edit Juli 2018:
Mittlerweile gab es einige Updates, dadurch bekam das Spiel eine deutliche Aufwertung. Es bedarf einige Zeit sich einzuarbeiten, aber es lohnt sich

Edit Ende 2020: seit einiger Zeit startet MASHINKY auf meinem 32bit System nicht mehr! Meine anderen 32bit Steam-Spiele funktionieren.

Edit August 22: Jetzt mit einem neuen AMD Ryzen, 64er System, steige ich wieder in MASHINKY ein und staune was man an Eisenbahner Fertigkeiten in den letzten zwei Jahren verlernt hat. Aber auch MASHINKY hat sich in dieser Zeit an einigen Stellen, deutlich verändert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000143011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1686692784}
review: Гениальная идея с жетонами ресурсов, отныне развитие происходит поэтапно, эпоха привносит не только новые поезда но и новые виды ресурсов, и сколько бы Вы не накопили "старых" ресурсов для покупки нового поезда вам придется попыхтеть, отстроить дополнительную железнодорожную сеть, частенько затрагивая уже существующие пути, частенько их переделывая и тд. Вдобавок для получения жетонов не всегда достаточно привезти товар из точки А в точку Б, например для железного жетона необходимо загрузить руду и уголь и пригнать на литейный завод, а с литейного завода пригнать слитки в мастерскую, и только тогда будет заработан этот жетон. Надеюсь в следующих эпохах цепочка будет еще сложнее, а зависимость от жетонов весомее.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274983860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1704260447}

There are some things I  wish were in the game like signals on bridges and a way to see the train besides trying to find it inside your entire empire without coming out of construction mode. However this is still a very fun and good game... just wish the map editor worked properly....

author: {'steamid': '76561198007300695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1642439379}
review: Déçu par Railway empire (pour le prix auquel il est proposé, je ne recommande à personne de l'acheter), je me suis tourné vers Mashinky, un autre jeu du même type. Et là, j'ai été étonnament surpris : il s'agit d'un très bon jeu de gestion ferroviaire, original et innovant. Et il ne s'agit là que d'un jeu en accès anticipé !!! J'ai hâte de découvrir le reste....

author: {'steamid': '76561198008942632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1560965436}
review:
Definitely addictive, with creative new concepts for the genre (token, quest, control over time progession).
My only complaint so far is that the size of crossing- and switch-sections (the part of the track you have to isolate with signals to avoid crashes) is far to big compared to the rest of the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067214847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1644186200}
review:
This game need a lot more 'polish' - even though its been 7 years in the making - it has stayed visually in that time. The 3D is nice - but you don't build from that view - you go into "isometric" view and thats where it looks very DOS like (overlapping tags, type to hard to read...visually not apealing at all)- this needs a rework bigtime. 

I can not recommend this game - it still looks and feels very VERY early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002172036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1547313853}
review:
Fantastic. Really captures that old Transport Tycoon feel which is an older classic game from the 90s. If you always wanted a train set this is your game.

Looking forward to future updates! Buy to support!

Train graphics are great, lots of nice little touches already, music is good, cool mechanic with old-isometric/new realistic graphics helps with switching your playstyle with enjoying your train-set and helping with making it. Needs some refining on the token system, I can't help but feel that a money based system with fuel consumption would work better but eh, if it works it works.

Keep it up devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057866879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 10488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8664, 'last_played': 1578725978}
review:
Super addictive, this is the railroad building game I was looking for. 
Understanding signals may be the biggest thing to eliminating frustration!! Once you understand them, the game takes off.

Again, yeah it is a work in progress, but wow, hats off, this is already awesome, and super playable already. So excited to see how development continues!

_____________

It has been a while and I am still loving this game and seeing all the continuing improvement!
As soon as multiplayer comes out I'm buying copies to give to all my friends, whether they asked for it or not :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990047960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 3784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1704310965}
review:
I have been playing this game for a week now and it really starts to grow upon me. There is so much challange in the maps, connecting all the resources, adding new ones to the existing lines after a new era opens, sometimes rearranging whole areas to fit them in. Projects wich can be time consuming but so rewarding if everything runs smoothly. And the finetuning, oh man there is always something wich can be improved.  New more effective locomotives, better cargo cars, industries wich you can upgrade with addons to improve the output/effectivenes. The way the game has added tokens as  a currecny to open new eras and/or buy upgrades is very well done. These tokens can be aquired as part of a production chain, wood/iron/oil tokens. And it is rather good looking to, taking a ride with your trains is quite enjoyable. 

Ofcourse there is room for improvement, one direction signal placing could be easier, money piling up in to large quantity for instance. But overal a very recommendable game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057128549', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2451, 'last_played': 1708800654}
review:
Transport Tycoon in aktuellem Gewand!

Jeder der Transport Tycoon Deluxe oder OpenTTD angespielt hat, wird in Mashinky ohne lange Eingewöhnungszeit erste Schienennetze ans laufen bringen. Viele Elemente aus dem zeitlosen Klassiker wurden übernommen. Viele neue Elemente wurden hinzugefügt oder ausgetauscht.

Nachdem man sich einen Startpunkt auf einer neuen Map ausgesucht hat, kann es losgehen. Zwei Städte miteinander verbinden und die ersten Passagiere von A nach B und zurück transportieren. Das erste Geld wird verdient. Mit dieser Methode kann man in TTD weiter arbeiten, bis das Geld so schnell sprudelt, dass man es gar nicht mehr ausgeben kann. Dieses Problem hat Jan Zeleny geschickt gelöst. Wenn man in Mashinky Brücken mit hoher Geschwindigkeit oder schnellere Züge bauen möchte reicht Geld allein nicht aus. Man muss die Wirtschaft auf der Karte bedienen, damit man an Holz-, Kohle- und Stahltoken kommt. Damit kann man dann bessere Züge, Brücken und Bahnhofserweiterungen kaufen. Sich nur auf eine Güterart zu konzentrieren macht demnach wenig Sinn.

Ein weiteres Problem bei TTD ist, dass man nur eine Produktionsstätte bedienen muss. Diese kann so viele Rohstoffe verarbeiten, wie angeliefert werden. In Mashinky muss man auch in diesem Punkt flexibler bauen. Eine Fabrik braucht Zeit um die Rohstoffe zu verarbeiten. Man kann die Produktion mit Fabrikerweiterungen optimieren. Dies klappt aber nur bis zu einem gewissen Grad. Wenn man auf einer großen Karte spielt (max. 512x512 Felder möglich) muss man mehrere Fabriken bedienen, damit man die Rohstoffe verarbeitet bekommt.

In TTD bringt es wenig Güter über eine kurze Strecke zu transportieren. Die Entfernung ist der wichtigste Faktor für den Gewinn. Dadurch neigt man dazu, Güter an vielen "sinnvollen" Abladepunkten vorbei zu transportieren. Eine Fabrik im Süden bekommt dadurch die Rohstoffe aus dem Norden und andersrum. In Mashinky ist die Entfernung nicht wichtig. Wenn Rohstoffe und Fabrik nebeneinanderliegen, kann man es nutzen.

Ein besonders schönes Extra ist die 2. Ansicht. Beim Bauen genießt man die Kacheln, damit man einen guten Überblick hat und größere Kreuzungen gut planen kann. Möchte man seine Strecken im Zug mitfahren wechselt man mit der "Leertaste" in die 3D-Ansicht und genießt eine schöne Fahrt.

Alles in allem werde ich noch viel Zeit in diesem Spiel verbringen. Momentan ist in der 3. Epoche Ende (Stand: Januar 2018). Weitere Epochen werden in den kommenden Patches geliefert. Regelmäßig werden kleinere Änderungen eingefügt, die das Spiel bisher immer verbessert haben. Das habe ich in Early Acces Spielen auch schon anders erlebt.

Bevor ich noch mehr schreibe spiele ich lieber noch eine Runde. ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198191237918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1772, 'last_played': 1677500071}
review: Очень понравилась игра, задумка с разнобразием ресурсов и улучшениями заводов просто потрясающая! Хотелось бы мини показатель прироста или убытия ресурса , допустим в среднем за год в виде цветной стрелочки рядом с его колличеством (идет прирост или убытие), а то легко проворонить. Очень хотелось бы посмотреть на остальные виды транспорта! Не корректно ведут себя поезда или симафоры (функционал недостаточен или я чего то не понял) перестраиваясь лишний раз без надоности и перекрывая движение и тормозя другие , и хотелось бы симафор который позволял паралельное движение поездов на перекрестках, при попытке самостоятельно такой сотворить из нескольких симафоров поезда становятся в ступор пытаясь сделать ненужное в данном случае перестроение. Так же не хватает смены локомотивов без задания заново или копирования маршрута. Разработчики молодцы!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993837389', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1516286190}
review:
This is literally OpenTTD.

It will probably do well. If you want to pay for TTD again, go for it. I did. But I don't recommend doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980869674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1707605294}
review:
A fantastic little Transport-Tycoon-Lite, an excellent halfway meeting point for both simple and complex transport games. Splitting the visuals into a build mode and spectate mode is a brilliant idea. Some players might not like the player cash including resources like Timber and Coal but it makes for some great variety compared to the more "realistic" games.

Some positive points that set Mashinky apart from similar games -
[list]
[*]Multiple cash types for the player to earn and spend
[*]Being able to upgrade stations and industries with individual components is visually appealing and enjoyable gameplay
[*]The signal system actually shows you what is going on making them much easier to learn
[*]Trains are smart enough to path their own simple routes without excessive micro management
[/list]

Hopefully the game continues to develop visually and gameplay-wise, but it's an extremely postive start!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062823574', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1673723943}
review: tchoo tchoo

author: {'steamid': '76561197992303973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1675949252}
review:
I had high hopes about this game, as I am a long year Open Transport Tycoon gamer. I like the graphics, I do not like the idea of trains making profit in wooden or other tokens, this is just unnatural. I really hope this is reverted to real money. The biggest size map is very small compared to OTTD, as the trains ( tracks take more space ), I definitelly would want the maps to be bigger by factor of 10-15. As this is still in development, if the payments in token was removed ( or optional in game options ) and maps got significantly larger it is a keeper, the small maps are barely playable. As of now, there are only steam machines available, but this is ok as this is being worked on.
Long story short:
+
modern game, nice graphics

-
token payments
small maps

As of now it is for core fans only, if you expect a full game, wait a little longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010883491', 'num_games_owned': 1932, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1507526177}
review:
Mashinky — транспортный тайкун от чешского разработчика Яна Зеленого, который занимается проектом уже 7 лет. Цель игры — создание собственной транспортной империи на процедурно сгенерированной карте. Игра комбинирует реалистичную графику и изометрический режим строительства. По мере изучения новых технологий игрок переходит от эпохи к эпохе (в раннем доступе доступны 3 эры из 7), получает возможность кастомизировать транспортную империю: улучшать фабрики, станции, пути, поезда, двигатели. Проект был тепло встречен любителями транспортных стратегий, так как представляет собой красивый, полноценный, продуманный тайкун, учитывающий пожелания сообщества. Местами забагованный, но играть и получать удовольствие можно уже сейчас.

Ближе к релизу можно надеяться на полноценный обзор.

Чтобы следить за остальными интересными релизами, присоединяйтесь к Dokole?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056083014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3467, 'last_played': 1635021770}
review:
The game is running smooth and (pretty much) stable, has a clean UI and overall looks very promising. Mid-term assessment (18/01) would be 5 of 10, I'll give it a thumbs up for the potential it has.

To whom it may concern:
This stage after seven years of development? Mmmhh.. well, I should return to my no-early-access-policy. I mean, its a huge effort for a single person to get this far and the developer, Jan, has got my greatest respect for that, consider myself bowing low to him. But a) its a mere remake of a classic theme, b) its lacking content and depth to be a lasting game experience at this stage. c) it may well be the content in his application portfolio for a job with a major company in the near future, and we all know too well what that means for future development.

Some thoughts about game details (what comes to mind right now):
- the real mode looks up-to-date and pretty (besides the constant flickering due to heavy moire patterns in the distance) and for sure took a great amount of the development time. It may be relaxing for some ppl to follow the trains through the great landscape, but its otherwise useless. You'll spent most of the time, if not all of it, in the construction mode. I see the (developer's) advantage for splitting those two modes, but with regards to the game experience I'm not sure if that's a successful decision.
- track building is easy and path finding is fantastic, though some tougher heights and rivers could spice it up a little (an Undo-button would be great).
- train building does what it has to do without making it a new or better experience than with other games of this kind. Some clarification about weight/length numbers and more feedback to the user about penalties, if any, is urgently needed.
- signal handling is easy to use, but lacking the depth of competitors, which is (for me) not necessarily a bad thing. Its a design decision: realism of a simulation or the user friendly handling of a satisfying game.
- the german localization has lots of cringy spelling mistakes in it and is incomplete.

I dont want to tear it apart at this point, its well on its way actually, but dont expect a game at this stage that keeps you motivated for more than a couple of hours, because after 2 or 3 hours you've seen it all and understand how things work. Hope remains Jan will keep on it and build it to the heights it has the potential to reach. Go for it, Jan!

author: {'steamid': '76561198305842348', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1675501036}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980787602', 'num_games_owned': 1145, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 3537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2635, 'last_played': 1697914778}
review:
[h1]Toy railway in your PC[/h1]

I have tried many different games of this type and OTTD is the only one that I have played a lot because it concentrated on building railroads and allows you to build almost any creasy design that you can come up with.

This game visually is the better version of OTTD, it is based on the same title building system which is quite flexible. Unfortunately, for now, there is not that much content in it, but it is already possible and enjoyable to build railroad systems of different complexity.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1265438163

The economic part of the game as the lack of AI opponents is not bothering me at all because building and watching how it runs is everything I'm interested in. This game has already become one of my favorites and I will definitely be waiting for the next updates.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1265438026

[h1]Sid Meier's Railroads![/h1] Benziyor ondada şehirlere ham madde sağlayarak şehirlerin ve şehir içerisindeki fabrikaların gelişmesini, büyümesini sağlayıp diğer şehirlere demir yolu taşımacılığı yaparak diğer firmalara yada oyunculara karşı gelişmeye şirketinizi büyütmeye çalışıyor zamanla gelişen teknoloji ile trenleri ve tren parçalarını rakip şirketlerin hisselerini alıp onların şirketlerini silebilir yada şirketinize katma fırsatı sunan zamanında iyi bir oyundu, belkide zamanında türünün tek örneği olabilir bu oyun o oyuna göre şimdilik kısıtlı içerik var ama zamanla daha iyi olacaktır.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041885520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2846, 'last_played': 1673664353}
review:
A very clean TTD inspired game sure to snag anyone who enjoys OTTD, the graphics are lovely to look at, the building system is intuitive to OTTD veterans, and the new mechanics give the game a fresh feel. Particularly of note to OTTD veterans is the token and era systems which reintroduce the expansion pains of early game at regular intervals giving you more reason to expand and future proof.

That said in its current state the game is rough in those parts, with the token system being relatively unbalanced when it comes to more powerful locomotive upkeep drinking away at your tokens without being significantly better than basic money burning locomotives. This is far from a big issue but more a gameplay suggestion that if you're gonna pick up this game something to remember while playing.

The game has great potent and has an active discord for bug reporting and discussion, both of which receive feedback from the team and has been stated as being wanted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007172969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 8064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3274, 'last_played': 1692377800}
review:
Es muss schon richtig viel passieren, dass ich eine Rezension für einen Early Access Titel formuliere. Ich mag eigentlich kein Early Access. Da ich aber oft genug abends zu Hause sitze und etwas „Neues“ ausprobieren möchte, ohne dafür 50 Flocken (Tacken) über den Tisch wachsen zu lassen, greife ich als ordentlich Abhängiger eben doch auch auf Early Access Titel zurück. 

Mashinsky, was es ist: 

-	Eine Eisenbahn Management Simulation
 
Was es nicht ist:
 
-	Eine U-Boot Simulation

Womit es zu vergleichen ist:
 
-	Open TTD
-	Transport Tycoon Deluxe
-	Transport Gigant

Womit es nicht zu vergleichen ist:
 
-	Silenthunter
-	RailRoads 
-	Railroad Tycoon Reihe
-	Transport Fever


In Mashinsky dürfen sie grob die verschiedenen Epochen der Eisenbahngeschichte durchleben. Dabei werden sie zuvörderst von der ekeligen (subjektive Bewertung) Grafik abgeschreckt. Die wirkt irgendwie schwammig und gepinselt. Aber um die Grafik geht es bei einer SIM ja auch nicht.  Also Augen zu und durch. 
In Mashinsky steckt eine ganz originelle und wirklich neue Idee. Anders als in allen anderen Titeln fahren die Züge nicht nur Geld ein. Sondern auch Kohle (nein, kein Synonym für Geld, sondern echte schwarze Kohle) und Holz, Diesel usw. Und diese Zahlungseinheiten heißen „Tokens“. Sie werden durch den Transport bestimmter Waren verdient und durch Erwerb und Betrieb von Zügen und Erweiterungen für Industrie und Bahnhöfe wieder verbraucht/ausgegeben. Dabei spielt der Transport von Personen klassische Geldtokens ein, mit denen alles für einen grundlegenden Fahrbetrieb gekauft werden kann und alle anderen Tokens verstehen sich als „Luxus-Tokens“ für schnellere/leistungsstärkere Züge, einzugsvergrößernde Bahnhöfe oder z.B. dem upgraden von Industrie. Und so schleicht sich sofort, und ohne dass es der Anfänger-Spieler so richtig begreift neben dem klassischen Verbinde A mit B Eisenbahnspiel ein Ressourcenmanagement Spielsegment ein, dass über die ganze Spieldauert ein austariertes Balancing erfordert. Denn die superschnellen Kohletokens wie nix verfeuernden Schnellzuglokomotiven sind schnell gekauft aber schwer am Leben zu erhalten. So mir nichts dir nichts steht der Spieler ohne Kohletokens da und seine Züge bleiben dann zwar nicht auf der Strecke (also sie bleiben natürlich schon auf der Strecke/Gleis) aber sie verlangsamen sich spürbar. Dadurch wird der Spieler gezwungen, sich genau zu überlegen für was die derzeitige Holz/Kohle/Diesel-Token Produktion ausreicht und für welche Anschaffung sie besser noch ausgebaut werden sollte. 
Eine weitere sehr originelle Idee ist die Beeinflussung des Übergangs in neue Zeitalter. Der Spieler kann durch den Einsatz der Tokens vom Holz- ins Kohle- ins- Dieselzeitalter usw. springen. Aber auch hier muss abgeschätzt werden ob sich der frühe Sprung ins nächste Zeitalter schon rentiert. Denn was nützt es die neuen schicken Diesellokomotiven theoretisch erwerben zu können, wenn einem praktisch die Tokens fehlen. 
Der Bau der Strecken verläuft wie in den alten Klassikern. Eckig. Kantig. Unflexibel. Aber das funktioniert. Zum Bau der Gleise wechselt man in einen grafisch abgespeckten Baumodus um Höhenunterschiede und alles nett im Schachbrettmuster zu visualisieren. Das Signäling ist wie in jedem guten Eisenbahnbauspiel eine Wissenschaft für sich und erfordert gerade von Nicht-Eisenbahnern (oder nicht Thyriels) viel Einarbeitungszeit. Als Transportfever Veteran dachte ich: „Ha, kenn ich, ich bin unbesiegbar!“ Nope. Ich war sehr besiegbar. Aber wenn man Signäling und Wegfindungs-KI der Züge mal verstanden hat läuft es größtenteils rund. 
Zwischendurch gibt’s mal Transportaufträge, aber die wirken im jetzigen Stadium der Entwicklung noch sehr gezwungen und aufgesetzt. Das hängt aber sicher damit zusammen, dass Maschinsky im Early Access zu erst das Open World Spiel anbietet um die gesamte Technik etablieren zu können. Später gibt’s vielleicht noch eine Kampagne. Wir werden sehen. 
In jedem Fall habe ich mich (auf den zweiten Blick) unheimlich in Maschinsky verliebt, obwohl so viele Spielinhalte noch gar nicht verfügbar sind. 
Abschließend muss ich noch einmal versuchen zu formulieren, warum Mashinsky meines Erachtens nicht mit RR und Transport Fever vergleichbar ist. Erstens ist die Trennung notwendig um die Originalität, die Jan Zeleny (ist oder war auch Entwickler bei Bohemia Interactive) hier an den Tag legt, zu würdigen. Zweitens geht Maschinsky mit dem Tokenprinzip notwendiger Weise Kompromisse ein, die weg von der Simulation der „Realität“ hin zu einem Puzzlespiel bedeuten. Aber dieses neue Spielprinzip ist so eingängig, dass es unheimlich viel Spass macht, das „Puzzle“ (ich hasse eigentlich Puzzles) zu lösen oder lösend zu konstruieren. Ich bin in jedem Fall sehr gespannt wie es weiter geht und empfehle den Erwerb schon zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt, unter der Vorraussetzung, dass sie Spass am Experimenieren haben und die Entwicklung "erwarten" können.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970682399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3615, 'last_played': 1573424051}
review:
For EA, I find this game fun and easy to play. I've only hit a few bugs. Build mode reminds me a little of older games like Locomotion and Open TTD, but this is definitely different. I look forward to the following additions the developer says are in plan:
[list]
[*]Mod support through the Steam Workshop
[*]More quests, challenges, and game events
[*]Bug fixes :)
[/list]
Things I haven't seen mentioned, but I hope that one or more are available some day:
[list]
[*]Subways and an interface for building underground.
[*]AI competitors
[*]Random maps that generate coastline or island scenarios.
[/list]
Those are things I've wanted to see in other games as well...

author: {'steamid': '76561198034591726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1513972250}
review:
Ich mag Eisenbahnspiele eigentlich sehr gerne. Dieses hier ist jedoch extrem einfältig. Die Spielmechanik ist extrem einfach gehalten, der Bau lässt wenige Möglichkeiten zu. Das Signalsystem ist sehr störanfällig und hat mit der Realität nichts zu tun.

Meiner Meinung nach hat man sich hier mit der Grafik verrannt und dafür alle anderen wichtigen Punkte außer Acht gelassen. So kann es weder mit tiefgängigen Klassikern wie TTD oder Locomotion konkurrieren, noch an aktuellere, grafiklastigere Titel wie Transportfever heranreichen. Herausgekommen ist ein seltsamer Hybrid mit zwar schöner Grafik, jedoch einer seltsamen Steuerung, einem anspruchslosen Wirtschaftssystem und einer Eisenbahn, die mit der Eisenbahn der echten Welt kaum etwas zu tun hat.

Ich kann das Spiel derzeit nicht empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068093637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1515178535}
review:
Просто развод на деньги. 
Разработчик делает игру уже 7 лет и, похоже, все эти годы он потратил на графику. Это у него получилось - картинка в игре действительно сказочная.
Но на этом список плюсов игры заканчивается, потому, что в игре нет ни контента, ни работающих механик. Поездов тут достаточно мало и ездят они как хотят: могут проехать станцию назначения, могут поехать по встречке, упереться в светофор и поехать обратно и так по кругу, не смотря на то, что их полоса свободная.
Как я уже сказал - развод на деньги. Вам продают пустую коробку в красивой упаковке и обещают, что в будущем ее будут наполнять. Это достаточно привычно слышать от игр в раннем доступен, но надо понимать, что если текущий результат - это все, чего добился разработчик за 7 лет - то чудес ждать не стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007691253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1635976307}
review: У игры хорошая база, симпатичная графика. Но контента пока конечно не хватает, нет того разнообразия и свободы, что были в Transport Tycoon. Идея с ресурсами, как формой валюты интересна, но все же лучше бы она выглядела как некий дополнительный бонус к основным деньгам, нежели чем полностью почти их заменяла. В целом игра понравилась, жду выхода альфа версии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093865850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 3075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1608574813}
review:
전체화면 플레이시 가끔 팅기는 현상이 있습니다. 창모드로 플레이시 안정적이라 창모드로만 하다보니 몇개월이 지난 지금 개선되었는지는 잘 모르겠습니다.

처음 구매했을 때 2nd era까지만 구현되어 있어 플레이 타임이 꽤 잛았습니다만, 현재는 3rd era까지 구현되었고 wagon 및 여러 가지가 추가되었습니다. 이제 반이상 개발되었다고 보는데, 그래도 싱글플레이로 즐기기에 짧은 느낌은 있을 것 같습니다. 다만 기본 가격이 비싸지는 않아서 그럭저럭 괜찮은 분량이 될 것 같습니다.

초반에는 버그 수정 등으로 피드백을 자주 잘 해주었으나 요즘은 피드백은 꽤 줄어든 느낌은 있습니다. 대신 미구현 부분 완성에 박차를 가하는 중인 것 같습니다. 최근에는 자체 위키도 구축을 했습니다.

이로 미루어 보아 지속적인 개발의지가 강한 것 같고, 샌드박스도 개선되어 제 기능을 해준다면 꽤 오래 즐길 수도 있을 것 같습니다. 지금은 달성 불가능한 미구현 부분 외에도 달성가능한 일부 도전과제도 블락을 해놓아서, 그냥 크게 업데이트 할때면 짧게는 2~3주 길게는 4~5주마다 새로 플레이를 해보는 중입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962071672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1666199264}
review:
It's not done yet. That's the first thing, you should have in mind before buying and while playing. Most of the negative reviews show a lack of people's understanding, that this game is in development since 7 years and will be for some to come probably. By one man only! 

When taken these facts under consideration, you do enjoy a nice little time travel to the early 90's, where Transport Tycoon made me and millions of other players simply addicted. Mashinky is trying hard to be a Transport Tycoon 2.0 but also brings some additions and game changes. 

All in All, for a game that is undergoing development still, it is a nice game. Graphics are even better than titles from huge companies with thousands of employees, but Mashinky is made by one person alone. That fact, and that someone seriously tries to bring back Transport Tycoon, and doing that definitley with lots of love, the money is well spent in my opinion.

I am very much looking foward to the next months, to the updates. Considering, what is planned and promised, this will be a very fun game soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232352624', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1604842178}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045597537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3309, 'last_played': 1693269109}
review:
I played Transport Tycoon since the DOS days and Locomotion since it came out.  This is a wonderful update in the genre.  I like the 3D views, although I tend to spend most of my time in the build-view as I'm constantly making changes to my game. The map editor is pretty friendly.  Zooming out on the build map gets pretty busy with everything showing.  It'd be nice to be able to filter what is seen there.  
There are some issues with bridges.  After building a bridge and removing a track from underneath it, I can't rebuild track under the bridge unless I delete the bridge, lay the land track and then recreate the bridge.  I suspect this will be resolved at some point.
I've tried Transport/Train Fever games, the rail building there is very cumbersome.  I like this interface much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070816268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1650097448}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997039516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1635608066}
review:
Достойный продолжатель традиций Transport Tycoon.
Графика далеко ушла от прородителя, но до идеала ей далеко. С другой стороны, графика этой игре особо и не нужна. Она тут просто как дань современности. Большую часть времени все равно проводишь в "мультяшном" режиме строительства.
Самое интересное тут конечно - строить развязки, устанавливать семафоры и пытаться по одной линии пускать несколько составов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030884517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1600632656}
review:
Huge disappointment to me. Graphics are great but that's all there is to it, at the moment, and looking at the roadmap, it doesn't look like it's gonna get much better. 

I played very little and saw no physics, no economy, no human behavior simulation, no engineering whatsoever, just drawing lines between tiles.
I mean, why make all this nice graphics and trains, and then have the train make a U-turn at full speed? I don't see how this game ranks anywhere close to its competition, even when complete, and am seriously considering asking for a refund.

2022 update: A lot has changed since my 2017 review... Maybe not enough... But I have great appreciation for the devotion and perseverance of Mr. Jan the developer. So changing review to thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007695370', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 17167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1600, 'last_played': 1697739874}
review:
It may [i]say[/i] Early Access, but the builds that I've been playing on are [i]extremely[/i] stable. Apart from minor graphical blips in build mode (that don't affect gameplay at all), there are almost no bugs that impact the game.

The split between build mode and regular view is a fantastic idea, and it's implemented flawlessly within the game. Many retro game fans will feel right at home with the isometric and blocky terrain and easy-to-distinguish features while building, then swap over to regular view to enjoy the scenery.

Gameplay is simple, yet complex. Transport passengers for money, use money to invest in businesses and transport goods, then use higher-tier goods to upgrade your railways, stations, and buy new trains. Working with multiple different types of "currency" keeps the game fresh and exciting, and advancing through the eras feels rewarding. Stations have modules to increase certain things like cargo capacity, station size, and even addons like a restaurant to keep passengers happy and earn extra cash. Factories also have upgrades that can increase output, improve conversion rates on certain goods, and even accept further raw resources to produce better output.

There are little objectives and missions that pop up every so often, urging you to deliver a certain type of goods or complete a simple task, rewarding you with currency, materials, or even one-of-a-kind upgraded trains later on.

And of course, adding the ability to ride in your trains or carriages is enough to make even the manlist man squeal with glee...

So far it's an early build, and it's apparent. But just the two eras in the game already have provided me with 20 hours of non-stop enjoyment, and regular updates and progress reports from the devs are a good sign of the dedication to the game.

I can't wait to see more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031665431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1514607787}
review:
I gave Mashinky a try because I like train and tycoon games, and it looked really interesting. I like the art design of the trains and buildings in the game and up close it reminds me of something of a light-hearted 'gothic', or perhapse similar to what you would expect a steampunk game to look like. The depth of economy is there pretty well. There are lots of industries to connect together to earn economy "tokens" to use to upgrade factories and towns, and new industries are presented over the eras as new technologies become available. Overall I liked the originality put into the game, especially with being able to swap to a grid construction mode, then swap back to the eye candy mode, which impressed me with it being an Early Access title.

The reason I am not recommending it is because of the AI pathfinding and signaling/switching. Maybe it's because I am used to the Train Fever and Transport Fever game mechanics, but getting trains to go where you want and to use the track you want is a freaking nightmare in this game. Even a track that only has one train on it can still get lost if the layout is even remotely complex in design (due to strategy of connecting industries/towns, etc). I tried everything I could think of using signaling and passings and nothing I did worked, and this is comming from someone who has designed lines on Transport Fever that serviced 20+ trains from multiple lines on a single complex corridor layout on the side of a cliff! I was really proud of that one >:D  I don't claim to be a signaling genius, but if I can't do it, the 'average joe' or 'casual gamer' who has little experience with rail tycoons and layout of track logistics will be pulling their hair out from the roots.

In short, this game is original and inventive, but it is too frustrating to work with and the AI makes Kim Jung Un look like a holy messiah in terms of brain power. Although this game actually had economical features that I wished were in Transport Fever, the latter is a ---FAR--- better game for rail tycoon enthusiasts. It's a shame too, because as I stated earlier, I actually liked this game, but the problem with it is in the core of the game design, not something I expect the Developer to be able to "patch" better in the coming future. The pathfinding and signaling, as designed, just does not work. :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198056190983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1703430137}
review:
Great Game,
In game detail is wonderful, with an amazing map, and an equally as impressive construction map, all quests and tasks are well thought out and generally easy to understand and complete.
Pros:- I enjoy this games factory/industry layout and the ability to transfer shipments at stations in stead of a 'one train-one shipment' style of other games. 
Cons:- The game is still early access atm, so its not a massive drama, though do be careful on a few of the quests that allow you to 'ride in your train' these quests can sometimes crash the game.

As for the overall play through, geberal mechanics, art style, and the general player absorbtion into the game I would give this game a healthy 3.8 out of 5. This game will most definitely get better as its finished, definitely worth jumping 'on board' XD .

review: I played this for a few minutes and then asked for a refund. Its a good start, but it feels a lot like OpenTTD. So I would just play that instead. The spiffy 3d graphics are pretty, but I spent 9 out of 10 of those minutes playing in construction mod.  If you want a newer version of OpenTTD this is a good game to keep your eye on, but it is early access so there is still a lot of work to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126717338', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1702424467}
review: Para estar en desarrollo esta bastante bien, me gusta, es simple pero se pueden hacer grandes cosas ademas de un dolor de cabeza, me gustan estos juegos asi, me acuerdo cuando jugue otros titulos tycoon de trenes, solo que este añade mas cosas, yo tambien soy programador y entiendo lo dificil que seguramente fue, todo el camino que durante 7 años Jan Zelený ha estado creando esta obra, por lo que veo, ya se tiene un objetivo final para la version final del juego y me gusta mucho. El juego tiene 2 modos de visualizar el terreno, isometrico como los antiguos juegos con celdas (Modo Construccion) y el modo realista donde el terreno se suaviza y se texturiza mucho mejor, ademas de la oclusion de ambiente y la calidad de los modelos hacen que se vea muy pero muy bien graficamente, yo creo que si investigo un poco y me muevo por los archivos del juego demas le hago algun mod, lo pensare, no se me da bien modelar y menos texturizar pero si se pueden hacer mods programables con alguna funcion o comportamientos seguramente pueda y ser parte de la comunidad moder de este increible juego, las pocas horas que he jugado este juego me encantaron, ya llegue a donde llega el "early acces" y aun me faltan varias cosas aun por descubrir, son como casi 6 horas creo, uno a este tipo de juegos les puede poner muchas mas horas, esta genial todo, cambiaria quizas un poco el menu, por ejemplo el fondo que puedan ser locomotoras del juego y en algun lugar alguna nota con alguna anecdota o historia de esa locomotora y sus caracteristicas, asi aprender un poco mas, si añaden otro tipo de transporte mejor. El precio quizas es un poco alto pero no lo es tanto y se les entiende, de todos modos pagaria quizas un poco mas por este juego, ojala no tenga DLC de pagos jajajaja. Saludos a los desarrolladores!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010839870', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 3039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1689319506}

author: {'steamid': '76561198297614707', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1633676664}
review: Absolutely brilliant -- It's like Locomotion and Railroad Tycoon had a baby. I see purists complaining about pathing, passengers that get off at the next station after getting on, traffic jams and other limitations at this stage. Take it easy guys, and show a little more respect! Jan has been working on this for over 7 years, and has done an excellent job of integrating the classic transport tycoon graphics style with a modern 3D engine. Compared to something like Train Fever, I found this much more enjoyable, and far less taxing on system requirements. Be patient and give it time. It's like a fine wine that needs time to mature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009690830', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1559658949}
review:
Nie samowita gra w opatciu o grę OpenTTD daje dużo lepszą grafikę i grafikę podobną do openttd.. Już przegrałem trochę godzin, ale czekam na dalsze rozwijanie sie tej gry bo kiedy wyjdą nowe lokomotywy, przedsiebiorstwa, wagony i inne bajery to grać sie bedzie grało wiele godzin bez końca :) , ale najbardziej to wyczekuję trybu multiplayer z możliwościa własnych serwerów 24h/7 to było by coś co by mnie kręciło :) Kciuki by jak najszybciej się pojawił workshop z możliwościa dodawania modów robionych przez graczy :) 

Życzę tej grze jak najlepiej bo wciąga i życze by jak najwiecej osob miało podobne myśli o tej grze co ja, a przedewszystkim by gra nie konczyła sie rozwijać :) Pozdrawiam Glizdorpl

author: {'steamid': '76561198070903492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1622873574}
review:
Es macht riesen Spaß und Hunger auf mehr. Ich spiele schon seit langem ähnliche Spiele.... Eisenbahnfieber eben :). Dieses hier ist etwas besonderes. Viele Details die ich in anderen Spielen ähnlicher Art geshen haben kommen hier zusammen aber dennoch findet man eine eigene Handschrift.
Bitte weiter so, werde aufmerksam folgen.
Wer Eisenbahn mag sollte auch dieses Spiel in seiner Sammlung haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970882297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1571676445}
review:
Grossartiges Spiel in der early Alpha Phase mit enormen Potential, finde ich.
Viele Titel erreichen mit einer späten Beta nicht einmal dieses Level.

Dennoch gibt es aktuell noch schwächen und zwar ganz besonders in der Wegfindung.
In diesem Zusammenhang fehlen besonders Schmerzhaft die Kettensignale und ein Routensignal, ähnlich wie es bei TF existiert.

Besonders eine Routenführung(Signal), mit der man die Route auf bestimmte Wege zwingt wäre zur Überbrückung, bis eine Lösung mit der Wegfindung gefunden wird, nützlich.

Ich sehe das aktuell als Hauptproblem an, wobei auch eine ordentliche Doppelgleis-Realisierung wünschenswert sein wird.

Alles in allem, sieht es für ein Ein-Mann- Produkt hervorragend aus, hat enormes Potential UND ist dennoch jetzt schon spielbar für viele Stunden.
Wenn man auf komplizierte Streckenführung verzichtet(fehlende Kettensignale), hat man sogar noch länger Spass.

Also:
Es ist eine frühe Alpha, womit man nicht zu viel erwarten sollte, bekommt aber dennoch schon einiges geboten und ist somit ABSOLUT zu EMPFEHLEN... ...

(Und mit solchen Aussagen gehe ich nur sehr sparsam um... ...zuletzt bei Faktorio)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028754277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 32793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 99, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1712386492}
review: Tahle hra má strašně našlápnuto. Od dob TTD tohle bude první pořádnej nástupce. Má svoje mouchy a občas ošklivou grafiku textur modelů a nějaké ty grafické chybky, ale to nic nemění na skvělé a hlavně zábavné hratelnosti. Člověk utopí ve hře spousty hodin. Za mě mohu jen doporučit. Ale mějte na paměti, že hra je neustále ve vývoji. Takže musí člověk s nějakou tou chybkou a nedokonalostí počítat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017853879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1670656486}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031274480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 36506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4398, 'last_played': 1703785158}
review: I got this game yesterday and could not stop playing. I almost quit becuase I did not understand the use of signals originally, After viewing the community guide to signals and blocks I was quickly on point. The guide and online manual demonstrates some very unique solutions to routing trains into stations. This link details how to set the signals for various intersections: https://mashinky.com/wiki/index.php?title=Junctions . I now really enjoy learning how to master the setting of signals and block control for train routing (deterministic vs. automatic routing). This is a much better replacement of SM Railroads (automatic routing). Highly detailed items, great graphics. Currently, there are only a few resources: passengers, loggs, lumber, coal, and iron. Iron (iron mines) does not appear until you get to the Steam Age. The new upgrade will add three more resources and new resource buildings and unlock perks. Resources must be delivered to thier appropriate industry production buildings to gain new refined resources and products. Very stable game. Occasional crashed on in-game reloads. Many buiding extensions are available to increase revenue and other resources. A guide on developing resources is in the online manual. Train car consists must be changed at the depot (realistic). Car consists can't be changed at stops. It seems this is done for realism, otherwise, how would the empties get back?. There is a Sell button to delete/remove cars/engines when at the depot. The game is definitly a work in progress and is still being developed to provide various new items. Nice game overall. A real contender! It satisfied my thirst to build a rail empire.

review: El juego esta muy verde, pero se puede jugar primeras 2 eras para ver detalles y como va ser el desarrollo de cada etapa. En fin es el mejor tycoon en detalles, graficos, y posibilidad en futuro jugar en multijugador y con steam works. En prencipio no me gusto, pero luego comparando con otros juegos que tambien de trenes, decidi por este, creo que merece puntuacion de 1 a 10 una muy fuerte 9...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960328041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1513094963}
review:
I am sorry, but this game is not enjoyable for me.

The business aspect of the game is so simplified that it's just not interesting. Cargo and passengers can be delivered wherever you want. They just don't have any specific destinations and it there is no requirement to build proper lines with multiple stations for example when it comes down to passenger transport.

I built a simple line between three cities and the train always dropped of everyone at every single station. That tells me that there is nothing behind the passengers other than "Produce x amount of passengers at station". So basically - take two cities that are far away and transport passengers between them => massive profit. I expect more from a business simulation in the current year.

Also the UI is rather weak at the moment, but I think this will probably be optimized in the future.

If you just want to have sandbox to have a few trains running around go ahead and try it. If you expect a good business simulation I don't think you'll be happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257988868', 'num_games_owned': 3573, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1512550950}
review:
[h1]无法运行[/h1]

首先感谢奶牛关提供的测试机会。
================================
完整体验请购买游戏正版许可。

[h1]Mashinky 战略铁路大亨[/h1]
[h1]Mashinky评测[/h1]

大家好我是少年粥。
这是我至今为止领到任务中，让我觉得最沉重的一个任务。
首先还是感谢奶牛关提供的评测机会，但我一接到任务就发现了一个很严重的问题：
[h1]游戏无法运行[/h1]
接下来的日子，我试图在steam讨论版块、奶牛关询问问题的解决办法。steam方面没有得到任何回复，奶牛关的好心玩家们则劝我直接询问开发者。就在惴惴不安的一个月中，我靠单位的电脑，断断续续体验了几次游戏。我不清楚为什么我的win8.1pro系统打开游戏后只显示任务栏而没有窗口。没有人解释这是为什么。
所以我毫不犹豫地给这款游戏一个差评——它甚至无法运行。

我无法运行这款游戏，所以我不会对它的游戏性或者其他方面作任何评价。

[h1] 粥粥评分[/h1]
画面：★★★☆☆
音效：★★★☆☆
情怀：★★★☆☆
游戏性：★★★★☆
性价比：★★★☆☆

author: {'steamid': '76561198086483671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1517758187}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041628378', 'num_games_owned': 1502, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1511464538}
review:
This game is a decent game if you want a change of pace with your transportation games. 

It uses tokens to unlock trains and so-on. which isnt bad in itself, except you need to transport wood or coal to unlock stuff so it kind of binds you to doing what it wants you to do. 

the signaling is also confusing. signalling was very straightfoward in OTTD and transport fever. but this game i dont know what it wants from me. i end up having 17 signals down a mile of track to make the trains move. 

its not a "bad" game, but i didnt enjoy it. if you want a change of pace from your standard transport game give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032271620', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1697876831}
review: Man(n) hat ja immer Wünsche oder Erwartungen. Da ich nun schon etwas älter bin, hab ich damals leidenschaftlich das gute alte Transport Tycoon gespielt. Ich hatte immer gehofft irgendwann mal einen Nachfolger in den Händen zu halten bzw. heutzutage auf die Festplatte laden zu dürfen. Es gab einige Kandidaten, doch letztendlich bisher noch keinen würdigen Nachfolger. Mashinky dagegen hat das Zeug dazu. Es sieht jetzt schon sehr gut aus und ist für einen Early Access-Titel schon ziemlich weit. Ich glaube da kann was Großes draus werden :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984885559', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1711075629}
review:
If you miss RTC3 then this is definately a game to jump in on. Even though the game is a work in progress and the third age is in development I can safely say this game is worth a look.

It is playable with only a few noticable bugs. It can be quite fun and challenging if you really get into the logistics of the game. When the next "age" is launched it will really open up some interesting play style.

Positive: 
Good Gameplay
Good Graphics
Good controls and route management.
Good Update and Feature schedule

Negative:
Watch those large map load times.  dont give up. it will load
Task Switching can cause Drain Bramage
No Multi Player yet (currently single player only, but multi-player will be added at some point is in the future .)

Game was gifted to me by a friend, but I think the $25.00 USD is a very fair asking price at the time of this review.

review:
古き良き時代が楽しい汽車っていいよね！！
もうこれだけで十分なんですが
３Ｄにした時のｸﾞﾗﾌｨｯｸがステキ
２Ｄで路線を引いて３Ｄでﾆﾔﾆﾔ

ｹﾞｰﾑは人員輸送と資源輸送で資源と資金を増やし
やれることを増やしていくようです
資源で開発が進め新しい汽車をＧＥＴし開拓していきます
採掘する資源も拡張されていき
木と石炭だけから鉄、鋼鉄資源と増えて行くと
小さいﾏｯﾌﾟじゃ物足りなくなってくるわけで
ＰＣ負荷が許す限り開拓したくなる

そんなゲーム　ｾｰﾙこなくても買いなくらいｵﾇﾇﾒ
原価で買ったけど満足している！これで何日潰すことになるやら、、、

ちなみに日本語ないけど英語だけで十分遊べます
ｼｽﾃﾑを覚えれば語源なんて関係ねぇ！
駅つないで輸送するだけだ！あとは画面見てニヤついておけ！


人の行き来が列車に限られ他のﾌｨｰﾊﾞｰ系よりお手軽だと思うのだ
繋げれば繋げただけ収入が増える。街が発展すれば客車はあふれるだろう

Zurzeit noch in der Early Access. Es werden aber ständig Updates und Patches nachgeliefert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214735964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 108, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1711456781}
review: Игра классная, но очень короткая пока что. Я почти не выходил из режима строительства, поэтому даже красотами насладиться не успел. Жду продолжения игры, новых паровозиков и новых эпох. Ну там типа электровозы, тепловозы. ичто-то надо делать с двухпутными линиями, однопутные строить это моветон. У AI есть проблемы с прокладыванием маршрута до станции, иногда глючит и приходится отрезать неправильные пути глупому поезду, чтобы он попал на свою станцию. в целом очень хорошо!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007344563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1705094196}
review: Parádní, návyková hra. Až na menší výjimky bezproblémově hratelná i v aktuálním early access stavu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997815266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2381, 'last_played': 1676427068}
review: This game is great for what it is and will only get better. I see a lot of comments about trains kinda going off and doing their own thing. This is probably due in fact to the way the AI is attempting to navigate your tracks. I've had this happen when I develop intricate track networks. I've found the best way to manage this is to build seperate lines or on connected lines to force signals to block traffic from other lines. I can't wait to experience the 3rd era and am excited to see where this game will go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039421519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1446, 'last_played': 1668248629}
review: как раберёшься в игре, так сразу понимаешь её потенциал, а потенциал у неё ого-го!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989948272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1707499383}
review: Jako dítě jsem trávil studené a deštivé dny hraním Transport Tycoon Deluxe, byly to určitě stovky hodin neředěné zábavy a tahle hra starý TTD hodně připomíná. Do toho je vše pěkně zabaleno do moderního kabátu a možnost svézt se vlakem z pohledu první osoby je super, pokud si chcete dát na pár minut voraz od stavění a jen se pár minut kochat krajinou a postavenou tratí, nejlépe, pokud v dáli vidíte projíždět další vláčky Vašeho železničního impéria. Je třeba podotknout, že jde zatím o betu/early access verzi hry, takže občas něco pozlobí, nebo něco chybí, ale ten příslib do budoucna je sakra velký. Této hře jsem věřil od začátku a proto jsem ji podpořil zakoupením v pre-order a jsem rád, že nezklamala. Tento český projekt stojí za to podpořit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014008188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1708392195}
review:
Had high hopes for this... was very dissappointed.  Dont waste your money on it, a lot of issues. 
- Trains will just run off to random stations for no reasons.
- There is no way to prevent "traffic jams" when running multiple trains unless you run dedicated single line track every where as the signaling is inadequate.  You spend a fair amount of effort trying to unclogg your lines which cost you money and time...
- I have had two trains collide head on a signal... obivously they dont always work.
- You cannot upgrade a train engine without completely rebuilding the trains route.
- The terrain excavation interface is a little difficult to use. 
This game is good for about 30 minutes.  Once you start to expand and get numerous depots and lines running it becomes quite frustrating as all you do is spend time uncloging traffic jams and trying to keep everything flowing. 
Played it several times and I end up shutting it down in frustration after awhile... Regret the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110521356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1703614927}
review:
Hra Mashinky od Jana Zeleného příjemně překvapila hned na začátku, přípomíná všem určitě desítky hodin strávených ,,kdysi,, ve všemožných simulátor hrách typu Tycoon a mě navrátila zpět do dětských let které jsem trávil u nenásylných her budovatelského typu.
Na druhou stranu ale po pár hodinách zjistíte že hra je ještě ve velmi ranném stádiu a  je to zatím jen taková malá ochutnávka toho na co se doufám můžeme v brzké době těšit.
Nezbývá než doufat že Jan Zelený to se hrou myslí smrtelně vážně a že i nadále jako dopusud bude pravidelně komunikovat s komunitou která mu určitě drží palce i do budoucna
Díky za tuto hru a přeji mnoho úspěchů

author: {'steamid': '76561198348963835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 12809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5957, 'last_played': 1641556265}
review:
This is an enjoyable game. It reminds me of Train Valley, but Mashinky is better because it is AI driven so you don't have to man the switches, and the graphics, the possibility to get right inside the train, is awesome. I feel like I'm a kid again playing this; laying out the track, setting up the city, adjusting the switches, and letting the imagination go wild. This game brings the imagination to life. Very cool.
While this is still early access, I'm less interested in the different eras and more interested in just playing with trains so it doesn't bother me that there are only two eras. You can play the game forever, I think. Well, actually, you can't because the AI sometimes screws up the paths, but really this makes it more like a real-life train set. All and all, I am having a great time with it. Now, I will sleep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037169608', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1556905635}
review:
Cavalcando l'onda dei giochi retrò in perfetto stile anni 90, Mashinky, ricalca e ridona nuova luce ai miti del passato quale Transport e Railroard  Tycoon. Molti sono, infatti, i punti in comune con questi titoli, che sono stari rivisti e\o sapientemente utilizzati.

Scopo del gioco non è difficile da intuire, dato che tutti i tipi di gestionali che abbiano come tema i trasporti, hanno come obiettivo comune quello della prosperità! Una prosperità che in Mashinky è possibile realizzare, non solo con il trasporto delle decine di merci e passaggeri su mappa, ma anche completando degli incarichi che spunteranno di tanto in tanto su schermata. Ad empio, potrebbe venirvi richiesto di collegare due città, o di trasportare un paricolare tipo di mercanzia ed a incarico ultimato, ricevere una gagliarda ricompensa! 

Ma gli elementi innovativi di Mashinky, non sono questi. Oltre al progresso economico ed al nostro conto in banca, di pari passo ed importanza, va anche lo sviluppo tecnologico e gli "upgrade", che vengono scanditi dalle "ETA'" che dovremo di volta in volta sbloccare. Queste ERE, si sbloccheranno al raggiungimento di particolari obiettivi che, una volta conseguiti, ci permetteranno l'accesso all'età successiva con il suo bel bagaglio di innovazioni sotto ogni punto di vista. 

Inizierete dall'età del carbone, con solo 2 tipologie di locomotive e solo 4 tipologie di merci (passeggeri, legname, assi e carbone). Una volta raggiunto l'obiettivo (per questa era circa 100 unità di assi e di carbone), passerete a quella successiva con upgrade che riguardano non solo le locomotive ma tutto il resto.. edifici, risorse e potenziamenti. 
Ovviamente, prima raggiungerete queste ETA' e prima ne beneficerete degli effetti del progresso.. pena?? Il rimanere nel 1990 con ancora le locomotive a vapore! 

A tutto questo, aggiungete anche la sapiente introduzione di una modalità costruzione in 2d (o quasi) che richiama la mitica GRIGLIA di costruzione dei Tycoon precedentemente citati. Questa modalità, attivabile con l'ausilio del tasto SPAZIO o con l'apposita icona, vi permetterà di realizzare la vostra linea ferroviaria in modo sapiente e sopratutto semplice ed immediato, senza incroci bordellosi o binari non posizionabili dopo magari "ore" di costruzione. Una cosa sicuramente positiva ma che, personalmente, limita un po la costruzione stessa dato che ogni binario deve NECESSARIAMENTE stare nel mezzo del quadratino. 

RICORDIAMO CHE E' IN EARLY e che i progetti futuri del gioco sono davvero belli! Tra questi:
- modalità competitiva multiplayer fino a 8 giocatori
- tante nuove "ERE" addirittura fino al Futuro!
- na marea di locomotive e vagoni
- un'altra marea di risorse
- la possibilità di personalizzare i treni e...
- ... quella di guidarli!
- la risoluzione di bug ecc ecc ecc..
- altro che non ricordo.

[b]PRO:[/b]
- tecnicamente, il comparto video molto bello da vedere nonostante sia in Early!
- restiling di vecchie perle del genere, con elementi innovativi molto carini
- sistema delle "ETA'" azzeccato e ponderato!
- tanti treni e vagoni
- tanti upgrade per ogni edificio, stazione, fabbrica ecc ecc
- molto semplice ed intuitivo....

[b]CONTRO:[/b]
- ... a patto che si conosca un po di inglese dato che, OVVIAMENTE, manca l'italiano! (Work in Progres??)
- la modalità costruzione 2d è fatta molto bene, ma limita un po la costruzione della ferrovia.
- manca una IA in single player che vi metta i bastoni tra le rotaie! Peccato..
- è forse troppo "simile" ad alcuni giochi del passato.
- l'audio è un po una merda..
- ancora in early con funzionalità limitate e bug della sua categoria.

[b]VOTO (provvisorio):
7,5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198124768870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2094, 'last_played': 1633293360}
review: The game is still in early beta, but I already love what's available. I appreciate how the currency is not just a pool of money, but incorporates coal, wood, and steel tokens to represent the trading of goods for services that old railroads often did. So far, so good.
