author: {'steamid': '76561197992602846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1533943900}
review:
Jak praví anglické rčení: "So far, so good". Super začátek super hry. Už se nemůžu dočkat dalšího obsahu, který přibývá skoro každým dnem.
Hra se díky dobrému tutoriálu (né, že bych ho potřeboval, mám nahráno stovky hodin v OTTD) hraje skoro sama. Perfektně je vyvážený poměr mezi hratelností (stavěcí mód) a vizuální stránkou (kochací mód).
Ještě doladit ceny všeho co se dá koupit, ať po dvou hodinách hraní nemám na kontě desetitisíce zelených peněz a jen desek žetonů dřeva.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138372077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1693408375}
review:
Pas le premier dans le genre mais il a son style à lui qui rend Mashinky intéressant et agréable à jouer. On se prend à se mettre à bord d'un train et regarder le paysage défiler. Un peu comme dans Transport Fever, il est vrai. 
C'est le travail d'un seul homme et le développeur mérite notre soutien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104866677', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1697388417}
review: Przy grze Transport Tycoon spędziłem wiele godzin. Z tą grą będzie tak samo. Trzymam kciuki za ten projekt

author: {'steamid': '76561198023374272', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1705529935}
review:
Although the game is unfinished as of yet I have found it really enjoyable so far.

Mashinky offers a more simplified version of other management/transport titles, this is great for someone who wants a level of control and building but doesn't have countless hours to dedicate daily or finds the micro management too much.

As mentioned the game isn't fully completed yet so don't expect to develop your rail network through to modern times although there is enough content here to begin with.

I would definitely recommend taking a chance on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050247537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1529134299}

author: {'steamid': '76561198314532801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1653, 'last_played': 1624217149}
review: Mashinky jsem si koupil hnedle v předprodeji. A nelituji toho. Na hry dnes už moc čas nemám, ale nějakou hodinku týdně si na Mashinky vyhradím. Hra má zatí mspoustu nedostatků a obdobími, která jsou nyní k dispozici projdete velice rychle. Nevím tedy jak, ale i tak se dá na hřes opravdu hodně zaseknout. kdo má rád trasportní simulátory, tak by určitě neměl tuto hru vynechat. Jinak doporučuji rovnou od začátku použít větší mapy. Na malých se toho za chvíli moc udělat nedá. Tak neváhejte a šup do toho...

author: {'steamid': '76561197992459734', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1672930748}
review:
Wer OpenTTD mochte, könnte Mashinky lieben. Vielleicht bereits jetzt, vielleicht auch erst in ferner Zukunft, denn über eines muss man sich im Klaren sein: Es kann noch eine ganze Weile dauern, bis alle geplanten Features in das Spiel implementiert sind und man auch nur einen Hauch der Tiefe und Komplexität eines Transport Tycoon Deluxe erreicht.

Trotzdem kann man natürlich bereits jetzt Spaß haben mit dem Spiel und mit seiner Kaufentscheidung den Entwickler unterstützen und für seine Arbeit motivieren. Dafür bekommt man regelmäßige Updates und Blogeinträge (bisher jede Woche) und kann sich aktiv an der Entwicklung beteiligen. Und hier ist das ausnahmsweise mal kein platonischer Werbespruch, denn der gute Jan ist trotz der wenigen Zeit sehr aktiv im Forum unterwegs und tauscht sich regelmäßig mit den Spielern aus. Mashinky könnte das Sommermärchen der Early Access Games werden. Bleibt nur zu hoffen, dass sich der Traum auch bewahrheitet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965801932', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1666518265}
review: Reminds me a lot of Railroad Tycoon with a great deal of improvements as far as track laying and managing the trains. The token system for the currency in game is novel and reinforces the board game feel you get when switching to the editor mode. Switching to the scenery mode is beautiful, and it's rather soothing to switch to the in-train camera and ride around as the engineer or a passenger. Greatly looking forward to seeing how the game progresses as it's developed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093982838', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1640295743}
review:
Schon jetzt ein wirklich tolles Spiel aus dem hoffentlich noch viel werden wird.

Wer es satt hat, sich mit umständlichen Gleisbau und empfindlichen Terrainangleichungen herumzuschlagen, für den ist dieses Spiel genau richtig.

Back to the roots, Gleisbau im Gitternetz a la Railroad Tycoon 2 und Terrainangleichung aus Rollercoaster Tycoon, simpel und so gut spielbar! Mehr braucht es eigentlich auch gar nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051924962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 26801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5000, 'last_played': 1697375945}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030797771', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1509886930}
review:
Ich habe es zwar noch nicht allzu lang gespielt, doch irgendwie könnte man meinen das es eine starke ähnlichkeit mit TTD hat. zumindest der Bau Modus. Denn muss man auch einfach mal hervorheben. :) 
Ich mein man Baut übersichtlich und kann nachher sien eSchöpfung genießen :).
Auch  was ich mal anders nennen möchte is das Budget System. Echt Coole Idee. Anstatt sinnlos Kohle zu schefflen, was es ehrlich gesagt schon oft genug gibt, ist man hier gezwungen ausgewogene Lieferketten zu bilden, um am Ende das Beste vom Besten zu bekommen.
Auch das aktuelle Zugsystem ist nett ausgedacht. Ich hoffe das die Zugkraft in de rzukunft noch iene wichtigere Rolle spielt. Einfach nur lange Züge bauen ist langweilig.

Auch freue ich mich auf die Ankündigung das es mehrere Transport möglichkeiten geben soll.. das macht die Welt Lebendiger :). 
Was ich nicht hoffe das es am Ende so ein banales Spiel wie Transportfever wird das am Ende einfach nur an der Technischen Leitsung scheitert. Dafür steh ich einfach zu sehr auf TransportTycoonDeluxe  Gimigs :).
Risie Maps mit unzähligen Möglichkeiten sein Imperium aufzubauen und einfach Gigantische Transport Systeme zu kreieren.

Für die jenigen die es noch nicht toll finden wartet ab was noch alles kommt bevor man es einfach nur schlecht bewertet. Es ist ja noch Early Access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019564457', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 31469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1708702642}
review: Unlike the majority of this community, I'm not actually interested by trains. I've never played the historical games they talk about. But I do like resource management and real time strategy games, partically where you have to build or design things. And this game combines these genres perfectly, making this a great game for me. Already lots to do, with lots more planned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016650745', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1671920050}
review:
To me, best tycoon game in a long time.

The concept and gameplay is very similiar to Transport Tycoon with one major difference - economy. While in Transport Tycoon money is the only currency, Mashinky uses token system where transporting different cargo will net you different tokens each having different purpose. E.g. transporting people earns you money which you use only for building and the most basic trains and upgrades. If you want to purchase certain upgrades (better trains or improvements to buildings) you need coal, wood or iron tokens as well. You can earn these only by transporting the appropriate cargo, e.g. to get a wood (timber) token, you need to transport logs from forest to a sawmill where they are turned into a timber which you have to further transport to toolworks where it is finally turned into the timber token you use as a currency.

The token system is not realistic but it is fun to play with and at the same time it achieves one important thing - you need to use all industries, not just the most profitable ones. 

Pros:
+ token system
+ addicting gameplay
+ nice graphics in building mode (on the other hand, I did not particulary like the realistic 3D mode, but it's not used very much anyway)
+ train AI is quite good even in complex railway setups
+ music.

Cons:
- except for the first few you get at the beginning of the game, subvencies are mostly useless and you really do not need them. The game is easy as it is even on hard difficulty.

Feature requests: 
Please add an option to (automatically) replace engines/wagons with different ones while retaining their original order list. Sending them manually to depot whenever you want to change the engine or the wagons, and in case of engine replacement making a new order list, is quite annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046897182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1977, 'last_played': 1688480563}
review: This may become a good game, but as of now I have found it totally frustrating. Pathfinding leaves a lot to be desired, you cannot dictate track direction meaning double tracks both fill up with up trains leaving nowhere for the down train. I had difficulty with the first log quest, the train just refused to move even with nothing in front of it. I had four passenger stations, you cannot do return journeys, it stops at all the stations on the way out then goes all the back to the first one.  I'd like to recommend this as I love these train games but as of now I would suggest you wait before buying.

review:
This ia already a superb game and I understand there is still lots to be added.  Great graphics and gtame play with tutorial help to enable an easy start. I just love the locomotives and simple industry set-up. I would recommend mashinky to anyone who enjoyed playing railway tycoon/sid meier's railways. Seven years in the making and the initial release is terrific.
I would suggest watching a couple videos on youtube to see just how good this game is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056607094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1685984141}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984099931', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1620158634}
review:
As a TTD veteran, I instantly fell in love with this game when I saw the demo on youtube. Even in early access, there are already so many things to do, even on a small map (haven't even yet tried a large map). Of course, some functions could be improved on. I miss for example the option to move buildings which makes it quite expensive if, for example, you extended your train depot. In general though, this is a beautiful game for everyone who fondly remembers building kilometers/miles of track in Chris Sawyers games of old. Especially the first person view is something I can't get enough of.

*suggested improvements*
- Pathfinder algorithm like in OpenTTD. My trains now get too easily gridlocked on intersections.
- Ability to move your own buildings.
- More clearly tutorial about which goods are accepted where. A lot of crates are now waiting in my workshop without a seemingly valid target.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989250468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1700577985}

author: {'steamid': '76561198105771949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1702976399}
review: Na hru Mashinky jsem se velice dlouho těšil a v mnoha ohledech hra splnila očekávání, ale je tam pár chyb které mi vadí například - vlaky se rádi potkají u obousměrného návěstidla (chybí zde něco jako v simutrans longblock), tudíž na jednokolejných tratí je prakticky nemožné postavit hradlo a zvýšit tak propustnost tratě, občas vlaky stojí u návěstidla a mají na stůj a to i přes to že trať před nimi je volná (pak kliknu na ignoruj návěstidlo a z nějakého pro mě nepochopitelného důvodu ignorují návěstidlo vlaky všechny a srazí se)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990983079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1668200727}
review: Zatím velká spokojenost a těšení se na další vývoj :) Dlouhé čekání stálo z to. Jde o více než důstojného nástupce "railroad tycoon". Skvělá hratelnost a zážitek nejen pro milovníky mašinek jakékoliv velikosti. Ekonomika mě postupem hraní - přeplněné sklady i nádraží, kterým má železniční síť nestačí. Za dobu hraní bych přidal ještě štítek "sandbox". Doporučuji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180336869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1581282275}
review: Hra je super, stavění železnice je realističtější než ostré úhly v TTD. Moc rád si zahraju tycoon hru v moderním kabátě. V TTD je vcelku jednoduché rychle začít vydělávat peníze, Tady to zatím chtělo více snahy a navíc systém úkolů a potřeba dalších surovin budování značně obohacuje.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078092752', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1686249181}
review:
Ta gra jest wspaniała. To fakt, zawiera błędy, nie zawsze jest super wydajna, a obecną kampanię można spokojnie zrobić w 2h. Ale co z tego, skoro wreszcie, po tylu latach, powstała gra w której można tak po prostu poukładać tory i puścić kolejkę przez pola, lasy, obok miast i jezior. Można zrobić tor dookoła całej planszy, wsiąść i po prostu rozkoszować się pięknymi widokami. Szczególnie, że już na obecnym etapie gra bardzo ładnie wygląda i umożliwia zobaczenie świata z pozycji pociągu! 

Trzymam kciuki za twórcę. Mam nadzieję, że gra będzie się prężnie rozwijać.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029841156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 50617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 77, 'playtime_at_review': 20143, 'last_played': 1712333341}
review:
While I just purchased this game today (Nov.14), I think I can definitely say that Mashinky is on it's way to becoming a good railroad title, a mix between Transport Tycoon and Railroad Tycoon. The graphics are especially nice, giving off a sort of early 2000s-era vibe that RT3 had in spades. The use of tokens instead of actual cash is an interesting idea, making use of a system that most transportation games don't bother trying.

There are still some clunky bits here and there however. Things like altering a train's orders takes way too many button clicks. However the most egregious error so far is the game's lack of...PATH SIGNALS.
What does this mean? It basically means that this game suffers from the major flaw that Chris Sawyer's Locomotion suffers from; even if two trains' paths don't cross at all, if they share a signal block, they'll stop anyway. This one fault adds a bit of frustration to the game that shouldn't be there when OpenTTD and Transport Fever already have path signals.

What's even worse is train pathfinding. There are many instances when a train will take a path and refuse to change it, resulting in manual deadlock.

Regardless, Mashinky is a decent title for an alpha 7 years in the making. Whether or not you wait for a price drop depends on how much of a fan of these kinds of games you are. The game is still in development though, so sooner or later my qualms will probably be fixed. We'll just have to wait and see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045351997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1605298438}
review:
POZOR, ZATÍM ALPHA VERZE!

I to málo, co je zatím uvolněno, stačí na mnoho hodin zábavy. 
Hra má dva režimy: stavební a realistycký pohled. 
Konstrukční připomíná starý dobrý Transport Tycoon a přiznám se, že v něm trávím čas i když právě nic nestavím :-)
Vše je velmi dobře optimalizováno, ovládání je intuitivní a přehledné. Velmi rychle se dostane pod kůži.

Díky nastavení si ji můžete docela dobře přizpůsobit i z pohledu náročnosti hráče.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008819319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 35645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3758, 'last_played': 1576914842}
review:
Good game, the major bug is with the signaling and train route logic. For example, if a route between point A and B is missing a turn. Your train will go on an endless loop. That's fine.. unless you got 20 other trains going and over 30 possible destinations you got to keep your eyes on. Not only won't you get a warning, but the lost train always manages to screw up your other routes by reversing and or jaming up what are meant to be single traffic lane.

NEXT UPGRADE needed : Better artificial intelligence of trains. Even if a signal is green, a train should know that proceeding will leed it on the wrong course.

NEXT UPGRAGE #2 : Being able to put double/triple locomotives on a convoi and to being able replace them without going to the depot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009484595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1510470318}
review:
Great game. Not difficult to fulfil the challenges (quests) which are along the lines of "supply 400 logs to any sawmill in one year". All requests are easy enough to accomplish, but it's how you go about accomplishing them. You might hae to re-route other rail lines or build tunnels, or use signals and sidings intelligently.
It's graphically very pleasing, and you can switch to isometric mode to build your stations and lines etc, then switch back to the more beautiful world, and even ride on the train if you wish (driving the train will be implemented in future updates).
Well worth what you pay for it. At the moment, only a few "ages" are available (just steam ages at the moment, diesel and maglev trains will be updated soon), but you can progress easily and just enjoy the game. 
I thoroughly recommend this game. Highly enjoyable.

review: Mashinky, dlouho očekávaná hra. Náhrada za předešlé klasiky je tu. Musím říct, že Jan Zelený zaslouží nehlubší poklonu za své odhodlání vytvořit takovouto super hru. author: {'steamid': '76561198097232207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1508663179}
review:
[b] Za tři  týdny předběžného přístupu hry Mashinky na Steamu, hra zaznamenala přes 450 pozitivních ohlasů a jejich počet stále stoupá, což dělá hře velmi kladné hodnocení 87%. Zajímavostí je, že tato česká hra je vyvíjena jen jedním člověkem, Janem Zeleným. Hra stojí 22,99€ a zakoupit si ji můžete na tomto odkazu. [/b]

Není novinou, že hra je inspirována Transport Tycoonem, hrou z roku 1994. Už ale z názvu je zřejmé, že v tomto případě se nezabýváme všemi typy dopravy. Ve hře je vaším úkolem stavět důmyslné železniční spoje, křižovatky, semafory či nádraží tak, aby byly co nejvíce efektivní. Jednou z novinek oproti Transport Tycoon je možnost upgradovat za peníze nádraží či průmyslové podniky o další objekty, které vám zrychlí nakládku a vykládku, ve hře totiž také záleží na rychlosti, jakou hráč dokáže zboží nebo pasažéry přepravovat.


Každá krajina, ve které se hrajete je jedinečná, takže se nestane, že by se prostředí opakovalo. Postupně do hry přibudou další epochy od dob páry až po nejmodernější vlaky. V budoucnu také budete moci ovládat vlak z pohledu strojvůdce, zatím je tomu tak, že pohled z první osoby lze použít, vlak ale jede automaticky.V plánu je také zapojení multiplayeru.


Po grafické stránka hra nabízí krásné a realistické modely lokomotiv, vagónů či budov a měst. Pokud budete převážet zásoby či obyvatele do měst, budou tato města prosperovat.

Hra potěší všechny fanoušky vláčků i virtuální podnikatele a umožní vrátit se zpět do dětství ke hraní si s vláčky.

■■■□□ Délka hraní
■■■■□ Obtížnost
□□□□□ Příběh
■■■□□ Grafika

author: {'steamid': '76561198028269282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1545286430}
review:
Twenty years ago, I played the original Railroad Tycoon and it was my absolute favorite game. Despite the sequels and copycats (some more decent than others) that have been introduced over the years, I never thought I would ever encounter a game like it... until now. Mashinky successfully pairs that same level of simplicity with the beauty of modern graphics while giving the gameplay new elements that add more interesting challenges.

Pros:
- I like the ability to switch between the simplified isometric look for building and the more detailed look for just enjoying the view.

- The complex, yet easy to understand "resource tree" makes setting up routes to convert raw materials to tokens an interesting exercise in logistics and problem solving.

- The procedurally generated maps always guarentee a different experiance with each new game.

Cons:
- I actually missed the Trains having to reverse out of stations as it was more realistic and did necessitate more elaborate track plans and orders, it would be nice to retain that feature as an option.

- Some Structures, trains, and extensions seem overly expensive given the slow rate of production for some tokens especially when certain challenges have a time limit.

- While a minor nitpick, the placement of some key resources and structures can often be frustrating when you have limited resources and have to reach across almost the length of the whole map. When new ages are unlocked, the new resource buildings tend to spawn in rather inconvienent places, one example was a post office spawning way outside of the city beyond the reach of the fully extended station I had already built there.

Perhaps the roads can play a part in connecting resource buildings to cities like if the "town hall" and a resource building are connected by road tiles, then the station with the "town hall" within it's range would have access to it, this would seem more realistic and make it important for players to build more roads.

Overall I look forward to seeing more added to this game and what the final result will be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007577172', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 8921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1960, 'last_played': 1696940548}
review:
Konečně náhrada za legendární  gamesku, kterou nebude ani po 30 letech třeba představovat pač žije v našich srdcích i dnes si jí můžete zahrát s kamarády pod názvem Open TTD Transport Tycoon Deluxe.

Mashinky mi dělají dvě radosti a to, že na tom dělá rodák s České Republiky Jan Zelený a druhá radost, že konečně úspěšně někdo natrefil notu po svém.

Bylo tu tolik pokusů o napodobení legendarního skvostu hnedka vám jich pár nadhodím.
Kde začít zkusím na to jít od zadu.
[list]

     [*][2017] Mashinky ( opět palce na horu CZ vývoj ) 10/10
     [*][2016] Factorio   ( opět palce na horu CZ vývoj ) 10/10
     [*][2016] Transport Fever                                           7/10
     [*][h1] [2015] Transport all the Time[/h1]                  10/10  developed
                                                          ( moje tvorba projekt nezveřejněn a material uložen stále je 
                                                            možnost projekt obnovit )
     [*][2014] TrainFever                                                   5/10
     [*][2013] Cities in Motion 2                                         8/10
     [*][2011] Cities in Motion                                            7/10
     [*][2004] Chris Sawyer's Locomotion                         4/10
     [*][2004] Open TTD ( clon klasické legendy )           15/10
     [*][2004] Transport Giant                                            4/10
     [*][2003] Railroad Tycoon 3                                       5/10
     [*][2002] Industry Giant II                                            3/10
     [*][1999] Simutrans                                                    4/10
     [*][1998] Railroad Tycoon II                                        6/10
     [*][1994] TTD  ( Chris Sawyer )                                 20/10
[/list]

No co šnůra to je dlouhá a jsem rád, že se to někomu podařilo nejblíže vystihnout to zrádné TTD:P

Držím palce a už se těším na další dopravu a modernější svět....

Jen tak dál kostičkový systém nejde zde nahradit jiným způsobem aspon ne ty co se o to pokoušeli selhali....

Gratulace Janu zelenýmu o úspěch. ( to co chtěl prodat za rok prodal za 3 dny:P )

22.11.17

Pod stromeček bude překvapení těšte se.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090518331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 22108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1706561367}
review:
Hru jsem zakoupil tento týden. Jsem velmi spokojený i když už jsem se dostal na současný konec hry (konec páry a začátek nafty).

Hrají po práci a je to pro mě skutečný relax. Jako správný "šotouš" oceňuji možnost "svézt se ve vlaku".

Držím palce. Doufám, že se hru pro vede dotáhnout do konce a že bude poskytnuta možnost vytvářet módy. Protože právě to dává hrám tohohle typu největší šanci na dlouhý a úspěšný život.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970208201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1697164852}
review: For where it's at in EA, it's great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018018027', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1507307724}
review: Игра сырая и с рядом странных решений. Сейчас брать большого смысла нет и не уверен, что когда-нибудь появится - концепция морально устарела, сейчас есть куда более глубокие тукуны на тему транспорта.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025766979', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1679348737}
review:
Super. Jak na wczesny dostęp mało błędów. Gra ma duży potencjał i szansę pobić TTD, Transport Giant i inne podobne tytuły ale jeszcze dużo pracy przed Jan Zeleny i jego zespołem.
Podsumowanie
+ proste i szybkie  budowanie
+ czytelny tryb budowy
+ model ekonomiczny oparty na różnych surowcach (piniądz, drewno, węgiel itd.)
+ naturalny interfejs, osoby grające w tycoony praktycznie nie potrzebują  samouczka.
- wiem że to najmniej ważne ale mimo wszystko słaba grafika,
- trybu podglądu dla mnie mogłoby nie być (99% gry spędzam w trybie budowy) 
- obecnie mała ilość powiązań przedsiębiorstw (do 2 ery tylko 1 drzewko fabryka narzędzi - surowce) to stanowczo za mało jak na 2 erę gdzie rolnictwo, przemysł spożywczy itd ?
- pasażerowie nie mają stacji docelowych tylko "wsiądź do pociągu byle jakiego"

Mimo wszystko czekamy bo od czasów Transport Giant nie było dobrego tycoona według mnie. Szkielet jest dobry a zawartość mam nadzieje że będzie szybko rozwijana. Jak na ten etap produkcji gry to 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198346564287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3275, 'last_played': 1644466381}
review:
信号灯默认是双向的，若想建设复线，点击信号灯切换成单向信号。
信号指示的是到下一个信号之间的区间，因此在单线上设置多余的信号可能引起两辆车对顶。

author: {'steamid': '76561198014985900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1550300596}
review:
Pro: The game play is very fun and additive finding out better ways to lay your track and your routes.  Big Thumbs up here.

Con: only two ages, and can be finished WAY to quick.  I would really hope they knock out a few more really quickly based off what I see in the game so far.  Otherwise its not really worth the $25 usd even with it being early access.  Wait for steam sale where you can get it for $10 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972222920', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1578324239}
review: Macht Spaß

author: {'steamid': '76561197988657198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1510227827}
review:
Que de souvenir pour les anciens qui ont connu Transport tycoon deluxe (le premier) car c'est pas loin d'être le même.
Bon sauf qu'on gère que des trains, pas d'avions pas de bateau ou de camions.

C'est un bon début, prise en main globalement facile, et sa aide d'avoir jouer a transport tycoon pour les astuces des chemins de fer :)

Pour l'instant il n'y a pas de concurence, se qui est bien sur regretable, donc ont s'ennui assez vite.
Le system de faire plusieurs monaie est pas mal, ca change.

Graphiquement ca va, sauf que je joue jamais en vue normal, je suis toujours en mode construction, et sa dérange pas.

Je regrette que les villes ne grandisent pas au fur et a mesure du temps, qui est pas de réputation avec les municipalités comme dans transport tycoon.

Mais pour l'instant, un bon jeu, a suivre je recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015431210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1669924779}
review:
This game is just fabulous. In it's current beta state, it's already a polished marvel of train transportation. The developer and his supporting crew are responsive, listen to the community and have a vision where this is going to. Basic modding support is present and will hopefully be extended soonish.

For all the sandbox train transportation wants i could possibly have, this scratches my itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050098256', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1700484718}

and

author: {'steamid': '76561198013069639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1590223249}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003871705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2149, 'last_played': 1697624096}
review:
В игре с 2017 года, наиграно более сотни часов, но активная фаза давно прошла, а разочарование осталось. За это время автор игры успел родить сына, найти работу и положить болт на и так неспешный проект. За это время вышел и успел обрости модами Transport Fever 2. А игра всё еще в раннем доступе. Но обо всем по порядку. 
Графика:
Учитывая, что 99.9% времени я проводил в режиме редактирования, мне вообще непонятно, зачем надо было делать два отдельных режима, но будем считать это авторским видением. Но вот почему нет нормального MSAA, вместо него дешевые заменители FXAA и TXAA, я точно не понимаю. Зачем в редакторе искусственно ограничивать качество текстур - тоже. В обзорный режим стараюсь не заходить, он ужасен, и игра явно не для любования красотами созданного тобой мира. 

Геймплей.
Логика поиска путей и свободной линии на станции - однозначно лучшее, что до сих пор я видел в транспортных  тайкунах. Штампы - прекрасное решение, которого очень не хватает в подобных играх. На этом всё хорошее заканчивается. Семафоры до сих пор доставляют головную боль, на сложных пересечениях пропустишь один - привет, затор. Спасают штампы, но новичку очень много хлопот.
Вы начинаете новую игру, выставляете маленькое количество всего (потому что только кажется, что карта 256х256 - это много). Всё хорошо до той поры, когда переходишь в новую эпоху. И тут начинают вылезать новые мастерские (это еще ладно) и ГОРОДА. Которые в реальной жизни появлялись за сотни лет до появления ЖД. В итоге до начала 6-й (пока это последняя) эры на карте от кучи мастерских и городов просто нет места, все это опутано хаосом рельс, которые надо редактировать каждую эпоху. А ведь автор ввел еще прокладку линий электропередач. В итоге хочется клетки уменьшить минимум в 2 раза, но наверно и этого будет мало.

Пользовательский интерфейс. 
За 4 года я три или четыре раза просил автора разнести значки монеток, так как при крупных суммах денег значения сливаются и читаются отвратительно, места для этого навалом. Но автор пилит паровозик в честь рождения спиногрыза, он очень занят. Шрифт в окнах и значки несбалансированы, на некоторые оттображаемые позиции не хватает подсказок при наведении мышью. 

Итог. 
Наиграно более 100 часов, по неспешности развития проект скоро догонит Star Citizen. После предыдущего оптимизма осталось разочарование. Всем любителям ЖД тайкунов я бы рекомендовал смотреть в сторону Transport Fever 2, хотя там есть свои недостатки, зато огромный мир и куча модов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114950823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 3943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1701716563}
review:
Sweet little game so far. Works well overall, some UI tweaks are still needed, and the game content is limited, which is perfectly fine for an Early Access Game. 

I absolutely love being able to switch from 3D to 2D isometric view, it works really well, and truely makes this rail sim unique among the dozens and dozens of others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315557255', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1590326045}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist ein Mix aus Transport Tycoon (Im Baumodus ist die Ähnlichkeit unverkennbar) und Transport Gigant mit sehr netter Grafik.

Wer sich schon gefragt hat, wann diese Niche endlich wieder besetzt wird, ist mit diesem Spiel gut bedient.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085114442', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1557474324}
review: Медитативная расслабляющая стратегия!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037407287', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1601302127}
review:
Skvělá budovatelská strategie, která se nese v duchu Transport Tycoon. Vše je zabaleno do líbivého kabátku při zachování úrovně hratelnosti. Můžete se tedy kochat i hodiny neutěšeně modelovat krajinu k výnosu svému.

Hra je velice chytlavá už v předběžném přístupu. I když se dá úvodní série úkolů překonat zhruba do půl hodinky, hra tím nekončí. Spíše naopak, máte klid na stavbu drážní sítě po celém herním poli. Můžete využít každou možnost výdělku, vybudovat spolehlivou pavučinu tratí a ekonomicky si tak podmanit celou zemi.

O vývoji je také možnost aktivně komunikovat s vývojáři. Updaty jsou velmi časté a jsou slíbena brzká uvolnění dalšího obsahu.

Patrioty potěší fakt, že se jedná o ryze český projekt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003544651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1509578660}
review:
Ich finde die Steuerung im Vergleich mit allen ähnlichen Spielen die beste und einfachste, aber auch sie hat noch viele kleine Macken.
Aber prinzipiell ist das Erstellen von Bahnhöfen, Schienen und "Ampeln" wirklich sehr leicht und nicht so ne riesen Fummelei.

Ansonsten ist es nett aber man erreicht derzeit sehr schnell das Ende der Möglichkeiten. Langzeitmotivation gibt es noch überhaupt keine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209702983', 'num_games_owned': 11, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1516439620}
review: Игра норм... но при покупке ожидал что в скором времени игра будет полноценной, а она так и осталась в раннем доступе..

author: {'steamid': '76561198218868931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1605903318}
review:
Для того, что бы развернуться поезду - нужна петля втрое больше чем гипотетический город, в итоге все пути выглядят уродливыми нагромождениями, перфекционист внутри меня плачет кровавыми слезами.
Работа семафоров и логика движения поездов - треш и угар, при двух пустых платформах два поезда будут бороться за одну из них, игнорируя вторую, даже с учетом семафоров и наличия соединений.
Типичная двухколейка отсутствует как клас. Проложить две ветки рельс параллельно и задать движение по одной в одну сторону, а по другой в обратку - забудьте, это обернется петлями и нетривиальными развязками настолько, что у вас отпадет желание в следующем городе делать такую же... 

При всем при этом апгрейд городов и станций - интересны, отсутствие денег и постройка за различные жетоны выдаваемые за перевозку ресурсов - достаточно интересный подход, прорисовка - понравилась.

В общем двоякое впечатление, с одной стороны можно посидеть поиграть, с другой - хочется отправить напильник разработчику, что бы допилил все эти странности... 

Сейчас сыровата, но потенциал, если допилить - заметно. В общем пока не рекомендую, дабы поберечь ваши нервы, но если вы с нордическим характером - попробуйте.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140558503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1090, 'last_played': 1539577080}
review: Nice new way of transporting people and goods game. Odd at first, but in a short time get hang of game and run threw all the early game play quickly.... looking forward to more content showing up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033765045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1890, 'last_played': 1670268701}
review: Por fin un juego que hereda de verdad el espíritu, la jugabilidad, y la diversión sin límites que tenía "railroad tycoon II". Hacía décadas que nadie emprendía el proyecto de dar un digno sucesor a tan magnífico juego, y al ser un Early Alpha, sin duda queda mucho por ampliar en cuanto a contenidos y demás. Sin embargo a día de hoy no sólo es jugable, sino que representa un auténtico reto encontrar algún bug. Lo que hay hasta ahora no tiene errores y es perfectamente jugable. Enhorabuena también por la traducción al español (por fín alguien que sabe escribir con corrección ortográfica y gramatical). Estamos ante un juego que acabará siendo un título ATEMPORAL. Recomendable 100%, vale cada céntimo que cuesta, incluso en su estado actual. No puedo esperar en las próximas semanas al nuevo contenido. Confío en que los desarrolladores no dejen el proyecto a medias y sigan de aquí en adelante con él. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035933221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1517176380}
review: A promising Transport Tycoon remake that is currently entirely meaningless. This is very early access and the game that you can play today is little more than a demo. You only have access to a few starting goods and the content just isn't there yet. Not good enough to warrant a purchase unless you are fine with 3-4 hours of playtime for €22. That said, the game is well-made and stylistically faithful. I would recommend putting it on your wishlist and coming back in 6 - 12 months.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981583396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2713, 'last_played': 1563540112}
review: This game is destined to become the next OpenTTD. I highly recommend it. The developer has worked on it for 8 years, and thought it's not feature-complete, it's already a lot of fun to play (*if* you like Early Access games). The dev is great wrt community interaction, and there is a discord community where people talk about the game and report bugs. Keep your eye on this one, it's a real pearl in the making!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032451565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1672174303}
review: Dobre

author: {'steamid': '76561198073443137', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1697911017}
review:
Moim zdaniem na chwilę obecną gra nie jest warta takich pieniędzy. Dostępna jest tylko era pary (pierwsza). Nie za bardzo zróżnicowane towary (drewno, deski, węgiel, ruda, stal). Brakuje możliwości szybkiego zastąpienia pociągów na nowsze (a przynajmniej nie znalazłem takiej możliwości). Nie rozumiem po co jest tryb "normalny" i tryb "budowy". Chodzi mi o to, że (przynajmniej ja) i tak jestem cały czas w trybie budowy. 

Ogólnie jednak gra ma pewien potencjał. Gra się miło, ba wciągnęło mnie nawet na kilka dobrych godzin pomimo dość ubogiej wersji. 

Mimo wszystko, na chwilę obecną daję łapkę w dół, bo moim zdaniem cena jest za wysoka, jak na ten etap gry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120244797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1661961447}
review: Hra Mashinky je velmi poutavá a jen těžko se on ní odchází. Dlouho jsem čekal že zas někdo udělá hru ve stylu Railroad Tycoon nebo Open TTD. Graficky je velmi povedená, hlavně se mi moc zamlouvá ta změna mezi normální a stavebním pohledem. Hlavní důraz kladu na grafické provedení této hry, která se nesnaží udělat vizi že to je jako skutečné, jak už to v dnešních hrách bývá zvykem dokonalé 3D a VR. Zde je krásná hra která je již na první pohled "dětská a nevinná" v dobrém slova smyslu (až na srážky vlaku ty nevinné nejsou) a v tom je to kouzlo této hry. V této hře si vzpomenete na ty krásné modely vlaku, aut atd. s čím si hráli naši otcové i otcové našich otců. Ode mě PALEC NAHORU a poděkování JANU ZELENÉMU i celému pomocnému týmu že tuto hru vytvořily. Hra má svůj potenciál, určitě hráči který mají tento žánr rádi to ocení a třeba to nadchne i nové hráče.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142228303', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1621113441}
review:
It is fun, but it is going to be a legend - has potential.  Amount of content for now is not to big, but plans are great.  Even now it is fun to play medium map, create junctions, connection between industries. I bought it primarly to support development and I payed 11h already. 

I love OpenTTD.  I was waitning years for a worthy successor. Here it comes! Fingers crossed and wallet vote for Mr Jan Zelný!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087918584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1674898944}
review:
Schon nach kurzer Zeit hat mich das Spiel in seinen Bann gezogen und mich überzeugt.  Gleise verlegen, Strecken planen und Industrien verbinden und dann alles optimieren und verbessern. 
Ich freue mich schon auf viele Spielstunden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086992856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1514298329}
review:
Игра классная. Сначала не врублялся как и что делать с ландшафтом, как его выравнивать и увеличивать, но спустя полчаса мучений понял. Сейчас пишу и говорю, что я дебил из-за того, что не вдублял в самое легкое. Доступны только две  эпохи на 18:12 31.10.2017. Интерес вжился в меня с самого начала, для меня это очень удивительно, обычно чтобы был интерес к игре я должен поиграть полчаса-час. В самом начале надо брать кредит для развития либо ждать и ждать пока жетоны сами не придут к тебе, а потом просто не успеваешь тратить все деньги и приходится выдумывать всё подрят: Проложить всю ж/д через все города, не соединенные с другими дорогами либо вовсе проложить всю дорогу через все города последовательно. Места хватает чтобы проложить только параллельную дорогу от мастерской до шахт или лесопилок(у меня совпал так ландшафт, у вас не знаю как). Самый сложняк, когда все поезда апгрейдишь до самых крутых в твоей эпохе(вторая эпоха)(жрущие уголь), а уголь заканчивается...

Вроде, всё уже построил, всё сделал, но интерес не отстает(сижу на одной карте). Не смотря на то, что у меня почти бесконечное кол-во всевозможных жетонов играть на одной и той же карте интересно, хотя всё уже  развито и ничего развивать нельзя. Доступны только четрые поезда на второй эпохе, два из них из первой эпохи. Разницы между поездом за 200 зеленых жетонов и поездом за 50 желтых жетонов нет. Разгон лучше у поезда за 200 жетонов, а максималка в 90миль/час почти никогда не удастся развить поезду за 50 желтых жетонов. Данный факт смею утверждать после проведения определенных опытов. А вот разница между поездами первой эпохи существенны.

Минус игры - оптимизация

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198039958675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1549111597}
review:
Le risque est à prendre quant à « l’investissement » que représente l’achat d’un logiciel encore en développement, c’est très prometteur. 
Il reste pas mal de petits détails à régler, quelques petits bugs, mais rien qui puisse gâcher l’expérience de jeu, d’autant que le développeur semble être réactif et sort des mises à jour régulièrement. 

Je n’irais pas à le comparer à Railroad Tycoon pour l’instant, il y a beaucoup de similitudes (et c’est tant mieux), mais c’est malgré tout suffisamment différent pour « rafraichir » le concept. D’autant que RR Tycoon existe en libre pour patientez et comparer…. 

Les graphismes sont beaux sans être exceptionnels non plus, j’aime beaucoup les petites animations dans les gares et autres installations. 
Le concept des différentes « monnaies » est intéressant, tout comme les challenges réguliers, ça casse un peu la monotonie…

Très sympa aussi la gestion du trafic à l’approche des gares. Le vrai challenge est peut-être là au final.

Bref, même si ca peut paraitre un peu  cher pour l’instant (attendez que le jeu soit proposé avec une offre, mais bon, on parle d’une vingtaine d’€uros, pas de 60 ou 70 ... )
J’attends avec impatience la suite quant à moi…

author: {'steamid': '76561198042603892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2171, 'last_played': 1630199893}
review:
Really solid train simulator, worth buying, even though there are many train games out there.  For an indie game, it's less glitchy than some of the bigger budget games out there.   The developer seems to be working hard and paying attention to players. 

There's plenty of content to make it enjoyable now, but much more is planned.  I love upgrading the stations and even industries to create an industrial empire.

At first, the train drivers seem to be really stupid, and it's hard to get the trains to go where you want.  But once you learn the routing and switching systems, it all makes sense.  Now my little train drivers stick to their routes and go where they tell them.

Then when everything's running, you can enjoy the scenery--even look out the window as the train traverses the countryside.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044166514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1708533331}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047066053', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1648260003}
review:
Damn you. You made me love this game so much, I didn't realise where the 5 hours of the evening went away. I think it brings out the inner train engineer in all of us.
I love this game. This has very good chance of being the proper successor to TTD and OpenTTD. 

[b]Pros:[/b] 
[list]
[*]Very easy to pick up
[*]Good graphics 
[*]Great engine sounds and whistles (OOOOOH, i love these)
[*]Nice randomly generated maps
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]Slightly repetitive music.
[*]Need some more music control options
[/list]

[b]Neutral:[/b]
[list]
[*]It will crash every once in a while
[*]Few random bugs (visual glitches)
[/list]

[b][u]Note:[/u][/b]
This game requires tonnes of RAM and resources. My machine was running HOT - Machine specs - i7-7700HQ; GTX 1060-6GB; 24GB RAM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021511659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 28794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6275, 'last_played': 1698058072}
review:
Still in Early Access, but this far looking very promising.
Train/Tycoon simulator with strategy elements  mixed in. Not quite fully fleshed out, but I imagine the goal was to address any issues that may pop up (in EA) before filling the rest of the game out. Responsive dev.

Looks very polished.. giving that ride-along experience should you want it. I must admit I'm more into the route optimizing/resource controlling, so I tend to spend most of my time in Construction mode. But in regular view it is quite pretty.

Still a few missing features but as mentioned before, I imagine the first priority is to hammer the bugs out.

Edit: Relatively consistent updates (but some of them lack a changelog), so you can tell the developer is dedicated to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156739493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1678475737}
review:
Le jeu est encore en alpha à l'heure où j'écris, et n'a donc qu'une partie du contenu (seulement deux âges historiques sur une petite dizaine de prévus) et une partie du gameplay (il n'est pas encore possible de conduire soi-même les trains, mais c'est prévu, et j'ai très hâte). Mais il est déjà super, un vrai coup de cœur !

Les jeux de gestion et/ou simulation ferroviaire sont très peu nombreux, ceux de qualité encore plus rares. Mashinky fait la part belle à la gestion (de réseau ferroviaire et des ressources) et sera complété par une partie simulation avec la possibilité de conduire manuellement les trains (de façon plutôt arcade, cependant, j'imagine ; j'ignore ce qu'a prévu exactement le développeur ;-)).

La prise en main et l'interface sont agréables ; le mode de construction (rails, gares, etc.) est simple à prendre en main, et le système de signalisation est relativement puissant tout en étant très aisé à comprendre. Seul l'établissement des lignes manque de simplicité et il n'est pas encore possible de visualiser d'un seul coup d’œil toutes les lignes établies — nul doute que cette fonctionnalité viendra plus tard.

Le mode 3D est propre et sympathique, les graphismes détaillés et plaisants (même si la portée de la vue à la première personne est limitée par un effet de flou, à dessein je présume). La campagne et les villes manquent encore de quelques détails pour les rendre plus diversifiées, mais là encore, le jeu n'est qu'en Alpha.

Après avoir joué 6 heures (au moment où j'écris ces lignes), je suis largement parvenu à la seconde période historique, et je n'ai exploité qu'environ 2/3 des ressources de la plus petite taille de map possible (128*128), sans compter qu'il y a matière à optimiser le réseau déjà construit. Bref, sans être un bac-à-sable total, le jeu laisse le joueur très libre, ce qui lui confère d'ores et déjà une grande durée de vie, de plusieurs dizaines d'heures — pour qui aime les trains, évidemment ;-).

Enfin, concernant les performances, j'ai une bonne machine, mais le jeu semble très peu gourmand. Et quant aux bugs, j'ai rencontré un problème d'affichage léger et un ou deux problèmes de pathfinding chez certains trains, et... c'est tout. Rien de gênant ; pour une alpha, on peut difficilement faire mieux.

En conclusion : si vous aimez les jeux de gestion, je vous conseille Mashinky :-). Et si en plus vous aimez les trains/les réseaux ferroviaires, n'hésitez plus une seule seconde ^^ !

author: {'steamid': '76561198075122349', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1653145897}

review:

Love the fact that it's not only about money but also about materials, you have to create to build and run your trains. Really looking forward to where this game gonna be in a year or two! But I'm hooked already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032214704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1691539905}
review:
This is Transport Tycoon on steroids. I loved the original by Chris Sawyer, and if you have not played that version I would suggest you try it out, if its still available for the PC. As of this writing I have played through on all 3 current map sizes with varying setups. The game has crashed a few times while its loading a new game but that is expected and a few other minor bugs. My experience so far has been nothing but positive.

1. Riding along with the train is awesome
2. The early industries are a great way to start
3. Transporting people and later on mail is fun. The mail cars need to be able to carry a larger load than 7 mail though.
4. Trying to coordinate the transportaing of goods from one place to another is very satisfying.

This game is well worth the price even in early access mode. Cheers, and have fun being a kid again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071534764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1694134367}
review:
Overall, great game.

The only gripe I have is that there are no path signals, [u]YET![/u]

I will be keeping an eye on this game, amazing potential.
It already delivers plenty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250838394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2186, 'last_played': 1688725366}
review:
First thing first, this is not an early access game. This is more likely a beta phase game which tonnes of rooms of improvement. I spended around 29 hours when they released the first ver ( 2 era ) and then I stopped and continue playing when I heard 3rd era was out. 

Pro
1) Its a train sim tycoon. It is not like we drive a ready made train on a ready made rail. NO. We build it and we can view it in first person mode
2) Quests and challenge. There is bunches of quests and also challenge to overcome. I had 48 trains in a small map and I need to manage or else they will stuck.
3) I love how the game using checker grid when we in build mode and I can see clearly and plan ahead.

Con
1) Limited tutorial. There is no tips or balloon that show us this is token for fuel, this is token for something-something, no there is not. All you have to do is guessing. Not too mention it take me 34 hours before I realized the mails is not collected because I dont know we actually need to delivery the mails to the PO.
2) Please expect that this game is not perfect yet, my game suddenly crash for no reason and also lag when it reached 30 trains. 
3)  Maybe it just me, but I am prefer I like to have a menu that we can change unit, for example mile to km. Not a big problem

TL:DR I am rooting for this game. Please do not dissapoint me

author: {'steamid': '76561198046999524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1645656489}
review:
Klare Kaufempfehlung!

Stundenlang bis ins kleinste Detail tüfteln. Massenhaft Güter transportieren. Verbindungen optimieren, verschönern und neue Loks für unterschiedlichste Aufgaben auswählen. Die Landschaft bei einer Zugmitfahrt genießen. Signale setzen, Fahrtrichtungen vorgeben, um perfekte Abläufe zu schaffen. Das Gefühl zu haben, man spielt mit der Modelleisenbahn bei sich in der Wohnung.

Wer sich jetzt angesprochen fühlt, der sollte Mashinky sofort kaufen. Gerade weil es im Early Access ist und man diese tolle Arbeit von Jan Zelený unbedingt unterstützen sollte!
Wer einmal Transport Tycoon gespielt hat, der wird das Gefühl nicht los, dass Mashinky der würdige Nachfolger ist.

Ich liebe dieses Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050407001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3786, 'last_played': 1703259137}
review:
↑ GOOD ↑
• beautiful graphics
• you can switch between build and view mode
• entertaining jazz music (apart from 1 track and some repetitive parts of other tracks)
• gameplay mechanics are great
• random and scripted quests - keeps the game rolling after you've finished linear play
• nice UI touches (like water color painted menu)

↓ BAD ↓
• little game, music and other content for 23e (for 15e it would be more favorable content-wise)
• music track Grease On Rails made me turn off all sound for 5 minutes and then turn it off whenever I started to hear it
• some of the other music tracks have long parts where the music is extremely repetitive and makes me start TTD music
• not many options in game settings, when you start a map

→ NORMAL ←
• early access bugs (you don't say?)
• early access game optimization (no s h i t sherlock...)

On a (slow but) sure way to be the real and worthy successor of the best transport game of all times - Transport Tycoon (or TTD or OTTD).

The developer really liked TTD and it shows in the gameplay of Mashinky. It's seamless and makes you want to play longer and longer. Make that junction, add that industry to the chain, connect those 2 cities, oh there's another forest here that I can haul to my sawmill, etc.

Yes - as most of the negative reviews say - the game has little content if you want to play strictly in a linear way and progress quickly to the "modern age". Because it has just 2 out of 7 train ages. So if you play quickly, you'll end quickly. And maybe it will not be worth 23e to those playing just the linear way.

But for me it is finally a game, that is a light at the end of a long tunnel. Going from Transport Tycoon golden ages to Mashinky with similar gameplay and gorgeous graphics.

Btw, loving how many industries there will be compared to the original TTD.

Reviewed 24.10.2017, edited 21.11.2018

author: {'steamid': '76561198028148235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1709832906}
review:
After 4 hours of game play, I like this game. 
GRAPHICS & CONTROLS - The graphics are really nice especially when doing a ride along on your trains. The controls are fairly easy to learn and I really like the ease of expanding and adding functions to your stations. You still have to accomplish tasks in order to add these items but I like them a lot better than the last two train sims that I have played. The passengers are utilizing the stations that I built without me having to start another trolley or wagon system internal to the town. It may get more complicated later as the towns expand.

PASSENGER, FREIGHT & CARGO -  I seem to be learning the cargo aspect of this game a whole lot easier than a couple of other train games that I never quite understood how to do. At least in this game, the freight & passengers gather at the station.  You can expand the station tracks easily (if you have money) to accommodate additional train (passenger & freight) by adding additional tracks plus it even knows that the new tracks belonged to that station & did not create a new station name (like another game has done to me). 

ENGINES & DEPOTS - You start with a couple of  early 20th century steam engines to pick from  along with some early passenger & freight cars.  I just completed a number of tasks so I was given the opportunity to expand my depot and build larger engines.

So far, the only minor issue that I have had (Windows 7-64 bit, 16 GB RAM, EVGA GTX 970) is one crash after about 3 3/4 hours.  The game saves automatically (at an interval that you set) so nothing was lost. I am not sure why one train cannot seem to find its path consistently but that could be me and not the game. I would definitely recommend the game at this point especially when I saw that the developer had just done some updates in the past week.  You can tell that he has made this a labor of love for trains.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120940770', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4650, 'last_played': 1697496795}
review:
After years of waiting for someone to make a Railroad Tycoon type game, the wait is over. This is by far the best train game that I have played in a long while.

The game features a few quests and 2 eras in it's early stage it also has a tutorial to help you get started, the ability to ride the train and toot the horn is a bonus. The graphics contain stunning mountains, lakes, trees, the houses and other buildings that have amazing detail. You have free reign of laying down the tracks to suit your map layout, it also contains bridges and tunnels that you can actually ride through on your train.

You are able to expand on the different stations as well as the industry, there are also a few upgrades to the trains. The maps to play on are different each time you start up, and having the capeability to chose to make the game hard or easy is up to you. 

This game is very relaxing with no pressures to build quickly against competition, the soundtrack is really nice the hours just fly by even though it feels like minutes of playtime. 

The game is updated regularly and I look forward to the future updates of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972245774', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1508960111}
review:
Mashinky is a one-man-team effort to capture the magic of Railroad Tycoon and other similar games. This is an impressive effort so far. At the moment this is a procedurally-generated sandbox game where you start with some cash, a map with some cities, coal mines, forests, sawmills and factories and you build your dream transportation empire from there. As you build up your network of stations, depots, etc., you get quests to complete specific tasks and unlock new locomotives, carriages, extensions for buildings and progress through different technological ages. You also have various terraforming tools to raise and lower the terrain, plant or remove trees, build tunnels, bridges and roads.

That said, this is a very early build version. It is very rough. The framerate is frequently terrible (and I'm running this on a PC which can run Witcher 3 on nearly max settings at 60 FPS with no framerate drops), it often stutters when switching from construction view to regular view, and I've experienced many hard crashes to desktop. Also, whether in full screen or window mode, the game really does not like being alt-tabbed out of. There also isn't really a tutorial at present, just a few tutorial quests to teach the bare basics, so expect to start a new game a few times to really understand how the many systems work in the game and what big differences are introduced when you advance through the ages. Also, the signals are a bit fiddly and require some trial runs as you're trying to organize your train schedules. Many features are not yet complete or work as intended but this is an early access game and the creator is very responsive to the community and quick with the updates. I'd also like to see a feature where you can toggle laying a dual track instead of a single track by default, it would safe a ton of time.

So overall, if you are a big fan of Railroad Tycoon, railroad board games (this game borrows a lot of mechanics from board games such as Age of Steam), or building intricate transportation and production networks, definitely keep an eye out for this game. Even with the crashes, stuttering framerate and some missing features, it's very addictive and already has a lot of depth. Just be aware of its rough edges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030963194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 15902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8475, 'last_played': 1687614305}
review:
While this developer started out with updates quite often, as of late it has become silent with lots of postponements and bugs left in game. Devs have stated that balance is the key to them and a large focus of why next era is taking time. But there are so many exploits available, that no balance exists even in completed phases.

I started out as a fan, but find that I have grown away from Mashinky due to the failure of devs to deliver on commitments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060863711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1518125352}
review:
Early Impressions Review

Even though I'm a huge strategy fan, Mashinky is actually the first ever train transport tycoon I've played. So, I have no previous impressions from other similar games. Gotta say, I'm happily surprised how much fun the game is! I just played for 7 hours straight and can't stop. There isn't much content yet, but it's already very fun and addicting. The isometric build mode is really neat and easy to use. Realistic mode looks great up close too. It's beautifull how everything comes to life and quite enjoyable following one of your trains. It also has decent UI, good music and a map generator with several options to play with.

So far, I'm very impressed. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980459063', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1609295478}
review:
As a lover of the more advanced-level tycoon and strategy games, this tickles an itch. Quite a basic selection of toys at the moment, still needs more detail, but I can see it has a lot of potential. The building mode and token system proves quite intuitive. Would like to see some commercial buildings in towns and cities as well.  The economy seems to work fairly well so that innovation is rewarded and inefficiency punished. In this genre, capitalising on your own failure is the greatest reward.

However, it feels like the trains' logic is a little stochastic. More than once, my trains have crashed into each other because they decided to take a silly route around when there was what seemed like a clear alternate path. Though that was easily subverted by building separate branch lines.

Overall, the board game concept is enticing and the visual style crisp. As it is, this is quite a promising tycoon game, and I can see it's going for more than just a casual approach.

Really fanatasic game. Even though there are some bugs still in developement, it really is a well-made game. If you like transport managing sims and like trains then you will like this.

I was shaky about the price at first but I realise now you're paying for the quality and the fact there is little like this avaliable.

Also I usually end up looking up a bunch of videos on these games to learn how to play; however, to my suprise there is an awesome quest system to teach you most the things you need to know and then you can work out the rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081934327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1584254821}
review:
Voto 10/10

Un gioco davvero stupendo, molto curata e realistica la grafica; ho trovato molto intuitivo il sistema di creazione e gestione dei binari e degli snodi ferroviari.

A prima vista non sembra un'alpha, sono implementate anche le collisioni tra treni con un effetto abbastanza realistico di deragliamento.

Se continuerà ad essere aggiornato regolarmente potrà diventare il vero punto di riferimento del genere dei gestionali ferroviari.

Consigliato!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036945159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 16887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2384, 'last_played': 1703952844}
review:
I came across this game on Youtube. I played Chris Sawyer's Locomotion for many years and the prospect of a potential  next generation was to much to pass.  I also welcomed the opportunity to support the developer and team who has worked many years on the project. 

I have had a few days trying out the game and it does not disappoint.  It is obvious that the devs have, like me, experienced many of the issues that made, at times, simliar "train" games so frustrating.  Just off the top of my head here are a few of those issues that are nicely resolved in Mashinky. 

- Clean and clear terraforming
- Quick and accurate placement of signals and their directionallity
- An arrow on the track showing both directionallity and its aspect (red or green)
- Very fluid track laying (I note the devs have opted against multiple track laying. I think it is because they have opted for a differing "geometry" for track that is line with the tiles as opposed to that on the diagonal, I guess one can only have clunky multiple track laying or slick single track laying)  
- As someone with impaired vision I greatly welcome the use of a clear font on a dark background. I do wish other devs would follow suit.  Thank you to Steam too.
- If you undo track, buildings, roads, etc then you get your money back.  In this sort of game as you are designing as you build then it is enevitable that you will want to "unbuild". Also, later gameplay often requires complete rebuilding of junctions and stations. It is just dandy to be able to do what you want without constantly watching the  money drain away.
- One of the great turnoffs in many PC games is "The Pokemon Imperitive". Not a Robert Ludlum book, just my term for gameplay that persistantly drives the player to greater goals and new targets.  Actually, I get quickly irritated by this and prefer to do my own thing, take a different approach, take time out to learn something, etc.   I play games to amble about  and enjoy others to strive and enjoy.  Mashinky does allow you to refuse or accept proffered goals and as I understand it it is possible to set up a game with a lot of starting tokens,  no challenges and for me a lot of fun.
- The devs have created two distinct games views - design and realistic.  The former is actually a game in itself. Then you can simply hit the space bar and go into a realisic view, ride on the trains, and this is another aspect of the game. The graphics are excellent although I do find (as a Train Sim person) that the track rendering is a bit clunky; this may be my PC as is due an upgrade.
- Unlike,in say, Locomotion, you cannot name your trains; they are simply numbered "Train 1" etc.  Initially I was a bit disappointed by this until I remembered the problems that naming trains actually causes. Frequently ending up with 3 trains called "Coal to Power Station" and getting completely confused.  
-The various menu boxes for each train, station, etc. can be resized making say a list entirely visible. 
- double clicking on virtually any name takes you to it i.e. stations, trains, etc.
- All objects have clear and concise labels - this can be turned off if required - a nice touch there. 
- A surprising and elegant idea is the addition of "extensions" these seem to be available on nearly all items and permit the addition of say a waiting room to a station, which costs, but increases the catchment area of the station.
- the game works in tokens for money (green), coal (black), etc.  This should make the game universally attractive.
- Another interesting concept is the splitting of passenger services from freight. The former earn money tokens the latter do not but do, in conjuction with tasks,  earn other tokens.          


Other observations
This is very much a game in development with devs very much in touch with their audience. It is good to be part of this and I look foward to the pleasure that upgrades will bring.  I really value this fairly recent approach where devs connect to those who play their games. I am sure we have all said "if only the dev had done this to make a good game a great game. 

Currently there are some workarounds, quick and dirty fixes, etc.  This is fine with me as it is a work in progress. 

A small niggle  - I would welcome the highlight colour in the save game menu to be red or blue as I really struggle to differentiate the game that has the focus.  

Second small niggle.  Forested areas are shown in design view as I think it costs more to build in such areas. The forest footprint is generally feint but on occasions is dark enough to occlude the signalling arrows. This makes setting directionallity occasionally difficult. 

The names generated for stations appear to be only UK ones and a fairly limited range at that.  As I live in the UK then I am happy with this but I would welcome a larger database as one is always hoping to see towns appear that you know and love/hate.  Why not charge people to add a town/village name of their choice.  Hmmm, Great Snoring, Great Fryup, Barton in the Beans, Curry Mallet, Mudford Sock, Marsh Gibbon, etc.  

This is a game I have been awaiting for mny years.  Thanks devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003591275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1651679888}
review:
Самая странная и самая интересная экономическая модель из всех, что я видел в транспортных стратегиях. В любой другой игре уже через пол часа достраивая очередную линию думаешь "это просто еще пара миллионов денег" и играть становится неинтересно. Здесь же (даже при всего двух открытых эпохах!!) я убил 10 часов чтобы сбалансировать доходы и производственные цепочки на самой маленькой карте!

Минусы - сделал все, что мог и теперь тупо жду обновления. Ну и оптимизация оставляет желать лучшего - маленькая карта дает стабильно 40 фпс, а вот средняя уже проваливается от 25 до 15. При таком уровне графики это, если честно, шокирует.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071888617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 8272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2501, 'last_played': 1650468910}
review:
Vyborne pane Zeleny!
Po vydani jsem byl velmi zklaman z chovani vlaku na navestidlech, ale opravil jste to hned za tyden v prvnim patchi!

Osobne je mi pekna grafika celkem ukradena - pohybuju se totiz temer vyhradne po konstrukcni mape ktera je udelana vyborne. (kdyby nekdo vahal, je to opravdu staveni velmi podobne TTD)
Ve hre je jeste hodne nedodelku, ale jsem presvedcen ze autor maka az se z nej kouri.....

Ta koncepce s ukolama je prekvapive dobra, mel jsem strach ze mi budou chybet AI oponenti, ale nechybi!
Hra je jeste hodne nedodelana, ale uz ted si s ni uziju srandy kopec. Nevahejte fandove TTD.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198106657336', 'num_games_owned': 1170, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1687708618}
review:
Konečně důstojný nástupce legendy Transport Tycoon. 
Jednoduché a přehledné 2D rozhraní pro stavbu tratí jako v původním transportu s následným přepnutím do 3D režimu funguje a vypadá výborně. Systémem "žetonků" hra vede k návaznosti dopravy a využívání "všech" zdrojů - tady nestačí vozit ve velkém dřevo na pilu a za chvíli být v balíku :) - pokud z pily neodvezete nařezané prkna do fabriky žádná odměna nebude. Na druhou stranu hra přímo do ničeho nenutí - chci jen osobní vlaky, propojit všechny města a nechci vozit uhlí? No tak uhlí nebude, sice nebudu mít silnější parní mašinky (na provoz je potřeba žetonky uhlí), nepostavím některé rozšíření...
Důležité - hra je ve velmi ranné fázi vývoje, chybí dost funkcí/obsahu, a naopak je tam dost chyb - pokud očekáváte, že si teď zahrajete víceméně plnohodnotnou hru odložte nákup o pár měsíců - jinak budete velmi pravděpodobně zklamaní (ostatně stačí si pročíst negativní hodnocení hry - většina je o tomtéž).
